1.content:
Have you ever wished you could trade your old, boring life for a brand new one? That was the question posited by the numerous advertisements for a company called New Horizons. The company started about 5 years earlier; the brainchild of some eccentric millionaire. The idea behind the company was that if you were unhappy with your current life, or simply bored with it, they’d create a new one tailor-made for you. The catch was that you’d have to say goodbye to your old life.

I’ll be honest; there have been times, over the last year or so, that I was very tempted to make an appointment for a consultation. Now before you get the wrong idea, I love my family very much; so I didn’t take such a serious decision lightly.

I lived in a small town in southern New Jersey; probably no more than 20 minutes to the beach and 15 minutes to Delaware. My dad left years ago, so it was just me, my mom (Abigail), and my twin sister (Kelsey). I know what you’re probably thinking; what’s so wrong with my life that I’d be tempted to get a new one.

Well, the answer to that is rather complicated. I wasn’t popular but I’ve had two friends (Kyle Williams and David Beltran) since pre-school. I wasn’t bullied (much) at school, and my home life was decent enough. It’s just that, for whatever reason, ever since I turned 13; I just wasn’t happy with my life.

I often found myself, out in public, watching random people and imagining what it would be like to have their life for myself. I would never admit to it in public, but there were a few times where I imagined what it would be like to live some random woman’s life.

I don’t know; maybe one day I’ll finally have the courage to make that appointment.
1.title: Prologue

11.content:
Today started like every other Saturday; I woke up at 7:45 to the sound of my alarm clock. As I sat up in bed, I noticed the telltale smell of bacon and sausage coming from downstairs. Today was one of those days where I almost didn’t want to get out of bed; but the smells coming from downstairs, coupled with the fact that I had plans with Kyle and David, were enough to get me up.

Getting out of bed, I trudged downstairs to the kitchen; to find that Mom and Kelsey were sitting at the table eating breakfast. I noticed that they were both giving me strange looks as I sat down, but I didn’t think much of it. That was until I heard them whispering to each other.

Slapping some bacon onto my plate, I said, “Would you guys mind telling me why you’re looking at me like that?”

Mom and Kelsey turned to face each other; after getting a nod of approval from Kelsey, Mom turned to me and said, “You’ve made no secret of the fact that you’re unhappy with your life, Kevin. Everyone knows that you’ve tried your best to put on a happy front, but it’s not working.” Getting up, Mom retrieved an envelope from the counter. Handing it to me, Mom said, “There’s something in
this envelope that your sister and I think will help you.”

Mom was being cryptic for some reason, but I opened the envelope anyway. The envelope was of a decent size; so I wasn’t surprised when a pamphlet slid out onto the table. I was, however, surprised when I saw that it was from New Horizons. In shock, I looked at Mom and said, “W-What’s this?”

“I think you know what it is, sweetie.” Her expression turning sorrowful, Mom said, “Right there is the key to a better, happier life for you.”
11.title: The Beginning

111.content:
I was speechless; I couldn’t believe Mom and Kelsey would do this. “I appreciate the thought, you guys; but I-I can’t do this.” Sliding the pamphlet away, I said, “You know, as well as I do, that I went through with this; you’ll never see me again.”

“I understand that sweetheart; but what of mother would I be if I didn’t do everything in my power to help you.” Tearing up, Mom came over and hugged me. “Just knowing that you’ll be happy will be enough for me.”

Kelsey was in tears as she got up to hug me. “I’ll always love you, Kevin.” Wiping away some tears, Kelsey said, “They have this secure email server; so you better use it to email us.”

Stepping away from them, feeling overwhelmed, I said, “I think you’re both jumping the gun here; I haven’t decided to go through with this yet.”

As she grabbed some tissues, Mom looked at me and said, “Sweetie, you and I both you’re your decision was made the moment you saw that pamphlet.” Looking at the clock on the wall, Mom said, “Now I know you have plans with Kyle and David, but I was able to make an appointment at New Horizons’ regional office for noon.”

I had planned to go to the beach with Kyle and David; one last hurrah before school started in a few days. But Mom was right, that wasn’t going to happen now. “I suppose they deserve to know what’s going on; I’d had to leave them out of the loop.”

“It’s a 45-minute drive to the office; so if you want to say goodbye to them, be back here by 10:45.”

Turning to leave the kitchen, I barely made it 5 feet before turning around. Embracing both Kelsey and Mom, I said, “Thank you, guys; yo-you have no idea how much this means to me.”
111.title: Kevin's Speechless

1111.content:
I rode my bike into town; on my way to meet with Kyle and David. We’d known each other since pre-school, so they were well aware of just how unhappy I was with my life. Arriving at our meeting spot, the fountain in the town square, I rode up to them.

Kyle was the first one to see me; waving at me as I got closer. “Hey man, where’s your beach stuff?”

“We need to talk, you guys.” Stopping in front of them both, sighing, I said, “Something’s come up.”

The three of us went to a quiet area nearby, where I told them everything. The expressions on their faces mirrored what I’d seen on mom and Kelsey. Once I was finished, after they’d had a chance to process what I told them, Kyle said, “Are you really going through with this?”

“Yeah, I’m really going through with it.” Sighing, I said, “I have an appointment in a few hours.”

“I mean, I know you’ve been unhappy for a while, but I never thought you’d go this far.” Looking at me, David said, “You realize that you may never see us again, right?”

“I know.” Taking a deep breath, I said, “You guys have been my best friends for years; I’ll miss you both so much, but this is something I need to do.”

Neither Kyle nor David was the emotional type, so I was a little surprised when they started tearing up and hugging me. That got me going as well; the three of us were all crying for a minute or so. “I love you, man; you’re my brother.” Looking at me, Kyle said, “I want you to know that David and I will be there for Kelsey and your mom.”

“Thanks, man.” Choking up, I said, “T-That means a lot.”

As I turned to leave, David came up to me and said, “Promise me one thing, man; wherever you end up, please lead a happy life.”

“I’ll try my best.”
1111.title: Meeting Kyle & David

11111.content:
If I thought that breakfast was bad, I wasn’t prepared for the car ride. Since it was fairly likely that I wouldn’t be back in town, Mom decided to drive to some of my favorite places in town,

Kelsey and mom would take turns reminiscing about some memorable events that happened at each location. I participated too; I may not have been happy with my overall life, but there were some joyous moments.

One particularly memorable moment that we talked about, was an incident at our 8th birthday. We had a party in the park, all of our friends came. Everything was going well until my uncle sat down at the picnic table; the table was off balance and fell over, causing me to get covered in birthday cake.

As Mom turned towards the highway, Kelsey looked at me and said, “I can’t believe I’m never going to have any more memories of you, after today.” Taking my hand, tearing up, Kelsey said, “You’re my twin brother, my first best friend; wherever you end up, I know in my heart that you’ll be happy.”

“I don’t have to go through with this, Kelsey; Mom can just turn around and go home.”

“We both know that’s not going to happen, Kev.” Sighing, Kelsey looked at me and said, “We both know what could happen if you don’t go through with this.”

I knew what Kelsey was getting at; if things got worse for me, what’s to say I wouldn’t resort to suicide somewhere down the line. Looking at her, I said, “I guess that doesn’t leave me with much choice, does it.”

Digging through her purse, Kelsey pulled out a small envelope. “I read that they let clients keep some mementos from their former life.” Handing the envelope to me, Kelsey said, “Hopefully this will keep you from forgetting where you came from.”

Opening the envelope, I found that it contained a dozen or so photos; mostly of Kelsey and me. Holding the envelope close, I said, “I’ll treasure this for the rest of my life, Kelsey.”
11111.title: Heading to the Office

111111.content:
Due to privacy concerns, Mom and Kelsey couldn’t enter the building with me. So after saying a length, and emotional goodbye, I went inside. I stopped briefly as the door closed, looking back at my family for the last time. You can do this, Kevin. After waving to them, I turned and walked up to the receptionist counter. “Hi, m-my name is Kevin Scott; I have a noon appointment.”

The receptionist, a cute looking girl in her early 20s, looked at the screen for a moment. “Ah yes, there you are.” Pointing down a long hallway, she said, “Go down the hall to the waiting room, 4th door on the right. Doctor Harris, one of our intake specialists, will be with you shortly.”

“Thank you.” Pausing, I turned to her and said, “You probably can’t tell me; but how often do people my age come through here?”

“About 1/3 of our clientele are around your age; ranging from 12 to 20 years old.” Looking at me, before returning to her work, she said, “What you’re doing is for your happiness; no one here will hold that against you. I hope you have a good life, Mr. Scott.”

After thanking the receptionist, I walked down the hallway towards the waiting room. As I walked by the glass window, I saw a woman in her mid-to-late 60s sitting inside. She looked up at me as I walked passed; I could almost swear I saw a look of recognition in her eyes.

As I took a seat, a few spaces down from the woman, I grabbed a magazine from the wall. I was about to open the magazine when the woman got up and took the seat next to me. “You’re awfully young to be here, young man.”

“Yeah, well my life hasn’t been the best.” Sighing, without looking from the magazine, I said, “My mom and sister thought this would be in my best interest.”

“That must’ve been a very difficult decision for your mother to make.” Pausing, the woman said, “If one of my children said they were coming here, I don’t know how I’d handle never seeing them again.”

I was starting to get a little uneasy about the way the woman was looking at me; I didn’t know her, but she seemed to think she knew me. “I don’t mean to be rude; but why are you looking at me like that?”

There was a confused look on the woman’s face, but that was quickly replaced by a look of realization. “How silly of me; I forgot you wouldn’t recognize me like this.” Looking at me, she said, “My name’s Helen Collins, but you knew me was Duncan Wilcox.”

My jaw dropped. The woman sitting next to me, in her late 60s, just said that she was Duncan Wilcox; the star QB at school during my Freshman year. He disappeared halfway through the school year; with his family and everyone else thinking that he died in an accident. But here he was – a senior woman.
111111.title: Starting Anew

1111111.content:
My mind struggled with the idea that this assuming older woman next to me used to be a high school quarterback. I watched as she put on a pair of reading glasses and picked up a celebrity gossip magazine. “What happened to you? Everyone in town, including your own family, thinks you’re dead.”

“I figured I might as well be; after the accident ruined my knee.” Sighing, she said, “I’d be able to walk again, but I'd never play football again. Can you picture Duncan Wilcox not playing football? I sure couldn't.”

“Yeah, but this place could’ve made that possible again.” Gesturing to her, I said, “But why this? Why become a little old lady?”

“My goodness.” Showing me an interview with cast members from a popular show on the CW, she said, “Why would anyone let their children watch this show? I heard more foul language in 15 minutes then I would’ve cared to.”

The funny thing was; the show was something that Duncan would have liked. “Why become an older woman, Duncan...I mean, Helen?”

“I had such fond memories of my grandmother; once I finished my psychological evaluation, I realized I wanted to be more like her." Something in the magazine caught her attention again. “Oh dead, there was so much sex and nudity in this movie. Whatever happened to leaving it to the audience’s imagination?”

The more she talked, the more I realized they’d altered her personality as well; she was every bit an older woman, complete with the way she talked and acted. “That’s what happened to Duncan; but what about your life now?”

“I’ve never been happier, Kevin; I’ve been married to a wonderful man for almost 2 years now. In fact, our oldest daughter just gave birth to twins; so I guess that makes me a grandmother.” Pausing, Helen said, “I flew up from Florida last night so I could see my family.”

“You’re going to tell them you’re alive?”

“Oh goodness no, they would never accept that. My father was one of those men are men types; he wouldn’t like that his oldest son is now an older woman.” Sighing, she said, “No, I heard through the grapevine that my sister got into Yale; she leaves today and I felt like seeing her off. The company is providing me with a driver for the day; I’m just waiting for them to get here.”

Smiling, I said, “I’m glad to see you’re happy, Helen.”

“Thank you, Kevin; I hope that you find some happiness as well.”

Just then a woman in her 30s, dressed in an impeccable skirt suit, walked into the room. Stepping towards me, her hand outstretched, she said, “Mr. Scott? I’m Dr. Eliza Harris; would you please come with me?”

I silently got up and followed her out of the room; as I did, I heard Helen say, “I’m glad they told me she’s a singer; the way she’s dressed, I would have assumed she was a streetwalker.”

I couldn’t help but chuckle at just how complete Helen’s transformation was; I wondered what they could do for me.
1111111.title: From QB to Senior Citizen

11111111.content:
I followed Dr. Harris down the hall to a modest-sized office with a window overlooking the river. Looking around, I saw various diplomas and awards; along with a smattering of other personal effects. “I hope you don’t mind, Mr. Scott; but the room where we generally have these meetings is having some work done.”

As Dr. Harris closed the door and took a seat behind her desk, I said, “It’s alright, Dr. Harris; and please, call me Kevin.”

“Of course, Kevin.” Looking over some paperwork, Dr. Harris said, “Before we get started on the nitty-gritty, I’m required by law to make sure you’re doing this of your own free will.”

“It wasn’t exactly my idea to do this, but my mother and sister saw how unhappy I was; so they talked me into it.” Seeing the look on her face, I said, “So short answer; yes, I’m doing this of my own free will.”

“It’s okay if you’re having second thoughts, Kevin; what you’re about to do is quite drastic.”

“I need to do this, ma’am; I need to have a life where I can be happy.”

“With that in mind; we have many different options for you to chose from; from finding a new family anywhere in the world, to even
starting over as a member of the opposite gender.” With a kind smile, she said, “We here at New Horizons can make you whatever you want to be; from a newborn Mexican boy to a teenage girl in Australia with musical aspirations. The point is, your new tailor-made life begins the moment you leave this building.”

“Is it a requirement that I leave my friends and family behind?”

“Of course not; but most of our clientele decide to go in that direction.” Turning serious, Dr. Harris said, “As you know, there are laws in place to govern this industry; and one of those laws states that you need a signed document, from a therapist, stating that you’re truly unhappy and need a do-over.”

I wasn’t aware of that until now. Wincing, I said, “So I’ll need to get professional help before I can start?”

“There’s no need to worry, Kevin; we’ve got several therapists on staff who can evaluate your view of your current life." Calmly, Dr. Harris said. “Understand that once you go through with this, there’s no turning back. That’s why we need to be absolutely certain that this is what you need.”

“I’d like to see one of your therapists, please.”

“Very well.” Standing up, a smile on her face, she said, “I believe Dr. Willard is free; she’s one of our more thorough therapists.”
11111111.title: Dr. Harris

111111111.content:
I got up and followed Dr. Harris out of her office; as we went down the hall, I noticed three impeccably dressed woman coming out of a nearby room. One of them, a petite red-head, looked to be about 7 months pregnant.

They all glanced at me as they walked past; no doubt realizing what I was here for. I threw them a casual wave as Dr. Harris stopped in front of a door that said Evaluation Department on it. She opened the door and we walked inside a small room, slightly bigger than the waiting room; consisting of a sitting area and three doorways leading into offices.

All but one of them was closed, as Dr. Harris me towards it. A quick glance through the door showed an attractive woman sitting behind a desk, looking at something on her computer. I found it interesting that every employee I’d seen here so far was a woman. Knocking on the open door, Dr. Harris said, “Miranda, do you have a moment?” gesturing to me, Dr. Harris said, “I have a potential client in need of an evaluation.”

“Sure, I could use a break from this anyway.” Looking up from her computer, sighing, Dr. Willard said, “Who knew booking a wedding venue 2 years in advance was so time-consuming.”

As Dr. Willard got up to walk over to us, Dr. Harris said, “Miranda Willard, this is Kevin Scott; a 15-year-old boy who is, as his mother said, perpetually unhappy.”

“I don’t think I’ve met a teenager yet who didn’t seem to be perpetually unhappy.” With a brusque tone, Dr. Willard said, “Hello, Mr. Scott; it’s my job to determine whether or not you qualify for our services.”

“I’ll let you get to it, then.” Stepping towards the doorway, Dr. Harris looked at me and said, “Good luck Kevin.”

After Dr. Harris closed the door, Dr. Willard pointed towards her couch. “Have a seat, Mr. Scott; let’s get right into it, shall we?”

*********************************


One hour and two boxes of tissues later, Dr. Willard and I were both struggling to regain our composure. I went into detail about how I loved my family and friends but felt that the life I had wasn’t the one for me. Dr. Willard, far from the brusque and seemingly combative person I thought she was; turned out to be a caring and understanding woman. Dr. Harris wasn’t kidding about her being thorough.

After signing some paperwork, Dr. Willard turned to me and said, “I want to apologize, Kevin, for putting you through all of this; but, as you were told earlier, we have to be certain this is the best course of action.”

“I-I understand.”

“You probably noticed that I was entering your answers into my computer; we have a program that uses that information to come up with four possible new identities for our clients.” Looking at me, she said, “Before I show you the results; you’re able to change certain aspects. For example, one of your possible choices is that of a 5-year-old girl.”

The whole time I’d been answering those questions, I found myself wondering if something like that was a possibility. Looking at Dr. Willard, I said, “Really? One of my options is a little girl”

Nodding, Dr. Willard continued, “Now say you want to be a 3-year-old girl, or even a 5-year-old boy; we can change that.” Looking at me, she said, “Just know; once you make your decision, it can’t be undone. You’ll be brought down to the hall to one of our Life
Designers; where you’ll help design your new life from the ground up.”

There was definitely far more to this than I thought, but it wasn’t enough to scare me off. I deserved to be happy, after all. Taking a deep breath, I said, “I’d like to see my options, please.”

Dr. Willard silently turned her computer monitor towards me; on the screen, I saw four options to choose from:

Option A - 5-year-old girl
Option B - 13-year-old boy
Option C - 26-year-old woman
Option D - 37-year-old man
Option E - 53-year-old woman

I took a fair amount of time to come to a decision; after all, the life I chose would be mine for the rest of my life. After what seemed like an eternity, but was in fact only 5 minutes, I looked at Dr. Willard and said, “I think I’ll go with _____.”
111111111.title: The Session with Dr. Willard

1111111111.content:
The life I was about to choose for myself would be mine for the rest of my life; so it only made sense that I took the time to think it over. After what seemed like an eternity, but was only five minutes, I looked at Dr. Willard and said, “I think that Option A is the best choice for me.”

“That’s an excellent choice, Kevin; congratulations on making one of the biggest decisions of your life.” Making note of the choice in my file, she looked at me and said, “Forgive me, Kevin; but you don’t look happy.”

I could’ve easily blamed that on a lifetime of being unhappy with myself, but I wanted to be honest. “I am happy, Doctor; more than you can know.” Sighing, as I leaned back in the chair, I said, “Be honest with me, is it weird that I chose to be a little girl?”

“No, Kevin; it’s not weird at all. It’s perfectly normal; after spending their first life as one gender, many clients want to spend the next life as the other.” Looking at me, she said, “For people in your position, who choose to become young children again, see it as an opportunity to make different life choices.”

“I suppose that makes sense.” Shrugging, I said, “I mean; there’s nothing more different from a 15-year-old boy than a little girl.”

“If you still have your doubts; one of my colleagues in Life Design was born male.” Looking at me, she said, “If she’s willing to do so, perhaps she’ll tell you her story.”

“I suppose it would be nice to talk with someone with firsthand experience.” Thinking back to my conversation with Helen, I said, “I met an older woman in the waiting room, who I knew from school. She told me a little about her new life, but was more focused on critiquing the latest trends.”

“Ah yes, Helen Collins.” Nodding, Dr. Willard looked at me and said, “She chose one of our most extensive personality alterations; I’d be hard-pressed to find any remaining personality traits from her old life.”

“She seems perfectly happy though, so I guess that’s all that matters.”

“There is one more thing we need to figure out before I bring you down to Life Design.” Looking at me, she said, “You need to pick a name?”

“Like first and last?”

“No, just the first name.” pausing, Dr. Willard said, “Because you’re becoming a young child, we’re going to place you with a pre-determined family. They’ll raise you as their daughter, and in time you’ll come to think of them as your parents.”

That was something I hadn’t thought about; I would need parents as a little girl. I certainly wasn’t going to do all of this to end up on the street or in foster care. Leaning back in the chair, once again, I said, “I’ve never been 100% sure why, but I’ve always liked Sophie.”

“Well then, Sophie; it’s nice to meet you.” Looking at me, she said, “I think it’s only fair to warn you; from here on out, everyone you meet here will converse with you as a little girl.”

“Okay, I suppose that’s okay.”

Grabbing the file from her desk, Dr. Willard got and said, “Okay Sophie, sweetheart, let’s go design your new life.”

I groaned a bit as I got up; rolling my eyes as I followed behind Dr. Willard. She wasn’t kidding when she said they’d talk to
me like I was already a little girl.”
1111111111.title: I'm Going to Be a Little Girl

11111111111.content:
My hand in hers, Dr. Willard led me down the hall to a door marked Life Design. Opening the door, the two of us walked in and I saw the pregnant woman from earlier sitting behind a desk with her lunch. When she looked up and saw us, she put her food away and said, "I'm sorry, Dr. Willard, I didn't know you were here."

“Don’t worry, Leslie.” Smiling, with a reassuring tone, Dr. Willard said, “Why aren’t you out with Carrie and Erin?”

“A walk in the park in 80-degree may sound fun to most people; but not when you’re seven months pregnant.” Wiping some crumbs from her desk, she said, “I figured I’d just have my lunch inside; where its air-conditioned and I have easy access to a bathroom.”

“I’m sorry to interrupt your lunch, but I’ve got a new project for you.” Pointing to me, she said, “This is going to a 5-year-old girl named Sophie.”

“Pleased to meet you honey; my name is Leslie Cummings, but you can call me Mrs. Cummings.” Coming around her desk, Mrs. Cummings shook my hand and said, “As a matter of fact, I decided to change my sex and become younger as well.”

“I mentioned that to her before we came here.” Pausing, Dr, Willard said, “I thought you might like to tell her something about it; keeping in mind she’s only a child.”

I’m not a child yet. I was already starting to get sick of them talking like that around me; I was still a 15-year-old boy after all. As she took her seat behind her desk, Mrs. Cummings said, “You know me: always willing to share.”

“Okay then.” Turning to me, Dr. Willard said, “It was lovely to meet you, Sophie; I wish you nothing but happiness in your new life.”

I took a seat as Dr. Willard left the room. Once it was just the two of us, I looked at Mrs. Cummings and said, “You used to be a man? What happened?”

“I had a big argument with my daughter, and I realized I wasn’t seeing things from her point of view. So I came here, to New Horizons, and became a 22-year-old woman.” Smiling, she said, “Now I work here, helping to give people the same second chance that I got. I’ve even got myself a wife and a baby on the way.”

I watched as Mrs. Cummings gently stroked her belly. Something about that enticed me to reach my hand out. “May I...?”

“Of course you can, sweetie.” Gently taking my hand and holding it to her belly, she said, Thank you for asking me first.”

My eyes went wide when I felt a thump; the baby was kicking. Looking at Mrs. Cummings, I said, “You must be so happy.”

Mrs. Cummings nodded, before saying, “I’m a little disappointed, though; I was hoping for a little girl. That way I could make up for hurting my first little girl.” pausing, she said, “But it turns out that I’m having a boy, so I’ll just have to teach him to be a better man than I was.”

“I hope you have a girl soon; everyone deserves to make up for their mistakes.”

“That’s so nice of you to say, pumpkin.” Looking past me, her eyes went wide. “How silly of me; all this time I’ve been talking about myself when I should’ve been helping you.
11111111111.title: Life Design

choices: Skip Ahead (Waking up after the proceure)
111111111111.content:
So that’s how Mrs. Cummings and I began the lengthy process of designing my life as Sophie. I should’ve realized how much work would be involved, but I was still thrown off guard.

The first thing that we worked on was my physical appearance; with some input from Mrs. Cummings, I settled on blue-green eyes with strawberry-blonde hair that reached just above my shoulders. One thing that I suggested, which I always thought looked adorable on little kids, was a smattering of freckles on my face.

After that was done, we turned to my height; I didn’t want to go overboard, so I decided on the typical height for a 5-year-old girl – just shy of 3½ feet. It seemed trivial to me, but one of the options that Mrs. Cummings asked was whether I wanted to be left or right-handed. Since I was already undergoing a drastic change, I decided to take it one step further and change from right to left.

Once all that was finished, we waited for Mrs. Cummings’ computer to create a rendering of what I’d look like. “Okay, Sophie; so what the computer is doing right now is taking all the answers you gave me and using that to create a picture of what you’ll look like as a little girl.”

I’d been a good sport up to this point, but I was starting to get annoyed by Mrs. Cummings' efforts to dumb down everything she said. I took a semester of Animation 101 my freshman year; I knew what a computer rendering was. But I figured it was only wise to play along; after all, I was going to be a little girl soon enough.

The computer beeped after another few minutes. Mrs. Cummings looked at the computer and I saw a smile form on her face. “Sophie, sweetie, you’re going to be one adorable little girl.”

Starting to blush, I said, “R-Really?”

Turning the computer monitor to show me, she said, “See for yourself, sweetie.”

I leaned forward to get my first look at the little girl I’d soon become. To say I was floored would have been the understatement of the century; I was stunned by what I saw on the screen before me. The little girl on the screen, wearing a green dress, was downright adorable. Tearing up, I brought a hand to my mouth. “T-That’s going to be me?”

“That’s right, Sophie; that’s going to be you.” Handing me some tissues, Mrs. Cummings said, “We just have to figure out what kind of girl you want to be, then I’ll bring you down the hall to the procedure room.”
111111111111.title: Designing Sophie, Part 1

1111111111111.content:
I was starting to get excited about what was happening; to the point where I was fidgeting in my seat. “So what’s next?”

“Now that we know you’ll be a pretty girl, we need to figure out what kind of girl you’ll be.” Looking at me, Mrs. Cummings said, “For starters, what would like to year?”

Apart from a childhood dare where I went trick-or-treating in Kelsey’s ballet outfit, I had no experience with girl’s clothing. “That’s kind of hard to say; I’d like to wear stuff like t-shirts and jeans, but I wouldn’t so say to the occasional skirt or dress.”
As my enthusiasm grew, I noticed that I was starting to play along with being treated like a child. “And I wouldn’t mind some girly pajamas; maybe something from Frozen 2.”

“Sounds to me like you’re starting to get excited, sweetie.” Pausing, as she put the information into the computer, Mrs. Cummings said, “What would you like to do for fun?”

“All kinds of stuff; playing with dolls, maybe even ballet or gymnastics.” Smiling, I said, “But I wouldn’t be afraid to get dirty; especially if I’m having fun or learning something.”

“Now comes a very important question.” Looking at me, Mrs. Cummings said, “What kind of family would you like to have?”

That was by far the easiest question yet. “I don’t want just one parent; I want to have two.” Giggling a little, I said, “Two parents who would love me very much.”

“You sound like a delightful girl, Sophie; any family would be glad to have you.”

I blushed at the compliment; with a child-like tone, I said, “Thank you, Mrs. Cummings.

“Let me just put everything on this little thumb drive, and then I’ll take you down the hall.” Smiling, Mrs. Cummings said, “I think it’s about time everyone gets to meet little Sophie.”
1111111111111.title: Designing Sophie, Part 2

11111111111111.content:
My pulse was racing as I walked, hand in hand, down the hall with Mrs. Cummings. I even started skipping at one point; I wasn’t even a little girl yet, and I was subconsciously acting like one. We stopped outside a door marked Transfigurations. After knocking twice on the door, Leslie opened it.

Inside was a woman who looked to he in her late 20s; professional except for her bubblegum pink hair. “Sophie, sweetie, this is Dr. Lizzie Weintraub; she’s going to turn you into a little girl.” Handing the woman the drive, Leslie said, “Liz, this little sweetheart is Sophie.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Sophie; I’m so glad that I could be here to help you.” Plugging the drive into a computer, she said, “Did Mrs. Cummings explain to you what’s going to happen?”

She hadn’t, and I had forgotten to ask. Shaking my head, I said, “No ma’am.”

“First I’m going to give you something help you sleep, then some teeny-tiny robots will go in and make you into a little girl.” taking my hand. Dr. Weintraub said, “Now say goodbye to Mrs. Cummings.”

I silently waved bye to Mrs. Cumming as Dr. Weintraub led me into another room. Before the door closed, Mrs. Cummings said, “Good luck, Sophie.”

Handing me a hospital gown to wear, Dr. Weintraub said, “You’ll wear this for now; when you wake up, you’ll be wearing something more appropriate for your size.” Looking at me, she said, “Do you need a moment before we begin?”

As I went to change behind a curtain, I said, “No ma’am, I’ve already said all my goodbyes; I’m just ready to get started.”

After changing, I handed my things off to Dr. Weintraub, who said, “Is there anything here that you’ll want to keep? Otherwise, we’ll send it back to Kevin’s family.”

Remembering the photos, I said, “My sister gave me an envelope with some photos, I’d like to keep that.”

She quickly found the envelope and placed it in a plastic container by the door. As I climbed onto the bed, she ran an IV into my arm. After that came what I assumed was the nanites. With the sedative starting to take effect, Dr. Weintraub said, “Sleep tight, Sophie. When you wake up, you’ll be Sophie all over.”

After giving me a quick peck on the cheek, she dimmed the lights and left the room. I then closed my eyes and let the sedative do its work, so the nanites could do theirs.
11111111111111.title: Goodbye Kevin, Hello Sophie

111111111111111.content:
My dream started with myself and Kelsey eating breakfast at the kitchen table. Looking at me, a spoonful of cereal in her hands, she said, “So, what you do yesterday?”

Playing around a little with my cereal, I said, “I played basketball with David and Kyle; they let me win a few times.”

“I see.” Smiling, Kelsey said, “What else happened?”

“We went to the mall.” Was my voice getting higher?

Seemingly unfazed by the changes in my voice, Kelsey continued, “What else did you do, sweetie?”

Sweetie? “Then we went swimming; I was ascard of the pool, but Kyle stayed with me.”

My voice was higher, and getting higher with every sentence. Oddly, Kelsey didn’t seem to notice; she just continued asking me what I did yesterday. After I was finished with breakfast, I brought my dishes to the sink. However, when I got there, I found that I was too short to see over the counter; I had to get up on my tippy-toes to do it. How was I supposed to do the dishes like this?

Coming up from behind me, Kelsey said, “I’ve got this, sweetie.” Taking the dishes from me, still the same size as before, she said, “Why don’t you go pick out a movie for us to watch.”

********************************


After watching the movie, the two of us went to the park. Kelsey pushed me on the swing and let me feed the ducks; we had fun. Back home, Kelsey ordered us a pizza. I was bummed that it was a small pizza until I realized I couldn’t even eat that by myself.

After pizza, we played Candy Land until it got dark. “It’s almost time for bed, sweetie; it’s time for your bath.”

Suddenly filled with energy, I ran upstairs to the bathroom and got undressed. It didn’t faze me at all that I was a girl. As I sat in the bath, playing with some toys while Kelsey washed me, I looked at her and said, “Will I get a chest like yours?”

“Your time will come, kiddo.” Giggling, she said, “Just give it a few years.”

Once my bath was done, Kelsey dried me off and I got into my favorite pink pajamas. She then tucked me in and read me a bedtime story. Once that was over, feeling drowsy, I said, “Good night, Kelsey.”

Kissing me on the forehead, Kelsey said, “Good night, Sophie.”
111111111111111.title: Dreaming

1111111111111111.content:
I woke up to the sun shining through the window. Opening my eyes, I found that I had some hair draped over my face. Brushing it aside, I said to myself – I’m going to have to get used to this. I couldn’t help but be amazed by how tiny my hands had become.

Looking around the room, I quickly realized that I wasn’t in Dr. Weintraub’s lab anymore; instead, I was in a hotel room. “This is a nice room,” I said; giggling at the sound of my voice.

I spotted a clock on the table next to me; I tried to read it but found that I couldn’t tell time anymore. I had no idea what 7:45 meant; although judging from the sunlight, I figured I had slept through the night.

My mouth tasted icky after sleeping for so long, so I decided to brush my teeth. Pulling the sheets back, I giggled again at the sight of my little feet. Climbing out of bed, I ran into the bathroom; where I found a stool sitting in front of the bathroom sink. Stepping up on the stool, I got my first look at my new face.

It was all there; my strawberry-blonde hair, my blue-green eyes, and my freckles. I’d seen it all before on Mrs. Cummings' computer, but this was different – this was real. I was real.

I started brushing my teeth and was halfway through when I realized I’d been using my left hand. I was just finishing up when I heard a knock on the door. In the distance, I could hear Dr. Harris say, “Sophie? Are you up, sweetie?”

Full of energy, I practically ran to the door. “I’m up.”

The door opened and I saw Dr. Harris enter; along with Dr. Willard, Mrs. Cummings, Dr. Weintraub, and another woman, with tattoos on her right arm. Dr. Harris had a cupcake with her, with a candle shaped like a number 5 in it. Once everyone was in the room, they all sang "Happy Birthday.”
1111111111111111.title: Waking Up as Sophie

11111111111111111.content:
After I blew out the candle on the cupcake, Mrs. Cummings brought in a box, along with a small bag, and placed in it front of me. I’d never been particularly excited about getting presents but now it was different. Before anyone could stop me, I tore into the box and saw that it contained a pretty lavender-colored dress.

Holding it up, a smile on my face, I said, “Is this for me?”

“This is all for you, sweetie.” Smiling, Mrs. Cummings said, “A pretty girl like you deserves a pretty dress.”

The tattooed lady, who I still didn’t know, handed me the bag. “This is for you too, sweetie.”

Excitedly grabbing the bag, I opened it and found that it contained a teddy bear. I instinctively grabbed it and hugged it tightly. “I can’t thank you all enough for everything you’ve done.” Looking at everyone, I said, “For the first time in a long time, I’m truly happy.”

After a few more minutes, Dr. Harris and the others left; leaving only myself in the room with Mrs. Cummings and the tattooed lady. They took a seat on the couch, sitting awfully close to each other, as they gestured for me to join them. Gesturing to the tattooed lady, Mrs. Cummings said, “Sophie, sweetie; this is Grace, my wife.”

Feeling a little bashful, I looked at Grace and simply said, “Hi.”

“I’ve heard a lot about you, Sophie.” Smiling, Grace said, “Leslie told me about how you were unhappy in your former life.”

“Kevin’s daddy left when he was 8 years old.” Frowning, I said, “His Mommy raised him and his sister on her own.”

“It’s not easy being a single parent.” Sighing, Leslie said, “Lord knows I didn’t do a good job of it the first time around.”

“Babe, you have to stop beating yourself up over that; it’s in the past.” Looking at Leslie, Grace said, “All you have to do now is focusing on being an amazing mother to our unborn son.”

*****************************


The three of us talked for a while after that; for some reason, they kept talking about how great they’d be as parents. After a while, they suggested we all spend the day together. I jumped at the opportunity because it would give me a chance to wear my new dress.

So that’s how I ended up leaving the hotel, which turned out to be only a short distance from the beach, with Grace and Leslie. I held both of their hands as we walked down the sidewalk; we got some looks from people, but we didn’t care.
11111111111111111.title: Continue

111111111111111111.content:
We couldn’t do much more than walk along the boardwalk at the beach since I wasn’t dressed for it. We did, however, get some food and drinks at the pavilion.

After that, we walked down the street together. In addition to them buying me more clothes, I got a chance to see the two of them together. I could tell that they loved each other; and it wasn’t just the hugs and kisses. It was how they spoke to, and looked at, each other. I couldn’t help but feel they’d both be sad had Mrs. Cummings not become a woman. Their baby’s coming to a house of love. I hope I can find a home like that.

After walking for a while, a sign for Chuck E Cheese caught my attention; I practically pulled them into the building. Once inside, I played around for a little while before we sat down for lunch; where I had a kid-size cheese pizza that was so yummy.

We then went back to the hotel; to get their car so we could go to the zoo. The zookeepers told us all about the animals; and I got my face painted like a tiger and got to ride a tortoise.

It was just after 5:00 when we left the zoo; I was half asleep in Grace’s arms as we walked back to the car. I was awake enough to hear their conversation, as Leslie looked at me with a smile. “I think we wore her out, Grace.”

“I think so too, Les.” Smiling, Grace said, “I also think we agree about what to do next.”

“Thank you, honey.” Grinning from ear to ear, Leslie said, “But let’s run it by her first; it’s her decision as much as ours.”

Stirring a little bit, as they buckle me into a booster seat, I said, “Huh?”

"We'll explain back at the hotel, sweetie.”

******************************


Once we got back to my room, I ran to the bed while Leslie and Grace followed after me. Sitting next to me on the bed,
Leslie said, “Sophie, sweetie, we’d like to talk to you about something.”

"What?"

“You remember how, as part of your new life, the company has to place you with a family?”
“Uh-huh."

With Grace standing behind her, Leslie said, “Well what if the decision was a simple one?”
"I don't get it."

"Leslie and I have been talking, Sophie.” Looking at me, Grace said, “We’ve reached the part where we need you to decide.”

"What do I decide?"

Leslie and Grace put their arms around each other. “Sophie, we'd like to adopt you.”
111111111111111111.title: Spending the Day with Leslie & Grace

1111111111111111111.content:
I looked at them both for a moment, as I tried to understand what they were asking me. After a moment, Leslie looked at me and said, “We’d love, more than anything in the world, for you to be our little girl.” carefully getting to her knees, Leslie said, “The whole time we were designing your new life, I couldn’t stop thinking about being your mother. You reminded me of my daughter at that age; before my small mind tore us apart. I’d like to try again, Sophie.”

I was still confused, but not as much as before. Looking at me, Grace said, “She told me the same thing when she came home from work; it was the first time she’d ever spoken about a client like that. The way she spoke about you, I just knew that I had to meet you.” Kneeling next to Leslie, Grace said, “You’ve swept me off my feet, Sophie; and nothing would make me happier than to be your mother.”

It hit me, as I was standing there in the hotel room, just how much my life had changed in the last couple of days. When I woke up yesterday, I’d been a teenage boy with a single mother and a twin sister. Then they took me to New Horizons where I settled on becoming a little girl. When I woke up this morning, I was that little girl. Sure I had said I wanted two parents, but I had meant a mommy and daddy.

Or was that really what I meant? I couldn’t help but remember what I thought this morning; about how their baby was coming into a house of love. I wanted nothing more than to find a home like that; and here it was right in front of me. They loved each other and they loved me as well.

Just like I’d done yesterday, I was faced with one of the biggest decisions of my life. With a smile on my face, I ran over and hugged both of them. “Mommy! Mommy!”

They hugged me back; until Mommy Leslie said, “Ooh!” and touched her belly. “It looks like your little brother wants to celebrate as well.”

Taking my hand, she put it on her belly and I felt my baby brother kicking. Looking at them, I said, “Do I get to come home with you now?"

“Not yet, honey; we have to get some paperwork done. After that we’ve got to make out second guest room into a room befitting a little girl.” looking at me, Grace said, “That shouldn’t take too long, but it won’t be long before you’re home at us.”
I couldn’t help but feel disappointed. With a frown, I said, “I guess so.”

They both laughed like I was telling a joke, but I was serious. I wanted to go home with them, not stay in a hotel room. But it made sense that they had to get things ready for me. After all, they were getting ready for my little brother and they did know about him first.
1111111111111111111.title: Two Mommies?

11111111111111111111.content:
Mommy Leslie had said I could order room service for breakfast, so that’s what I did the next morning. Once it came I gave a couple of dollars to the person who brought it and then went to watch some cartoons while I ate.

I had just finished eating when I heard a knock at the door. “Are you up, sweetie?”

Running to the door, I opened it and saw my mommies standing in the doorway. After giving them the biggest hugs I could, they walked inside as I closed the door. Seeing the food on the table, Mommy Leslie said, “Did we catch you in the middle of breakfast?”

Shaking my head, I said, “I just finished.”

“Well then, do you know what we do next?” seeing my blank stare, Mommy Grace said, “We put the tray outside so they can take it back to the kitchen.”

After that was finished, I said, “Are we going home yet?”

“Not yet, sweetie.” Looking at me, Mommy Grace said, “Some of mommy’s friends are making your room extra special, so we’ll be doing something else until then.”

With that, Mommy Leslie held another bag and said, “I think I know just the thing.”

Inside the bag was a swimsuit for me, flip-flops, sunglasses, and a bottle of sunscreen. We were going to the beach!

******************************


We spent a few hours at the beach; Mommy Leslie loved being in the water. She said it helped her out because the baby wasn’t so heavy. I was a little nervous about the water, but Mommy Grace gave me my first swimming lesson. After we were done swimming, I made a sandcastle while both mommies sat under the umbrella.

After a while, Mommy Leslie’s phone went off. “Let’s get your things from the hotel, sweetie; everything is finished.” Smiling, she said, “We’re officially your parents, sweetie.”
11111111111111111111.title: The Next Day

111111111111111111111.content:
The ride home seemed like the longest trip I’d ever been on; not because of the distance, but because of the wait. Mommy Grace said it was “Anticipation.” She drove home because Mommy Leslie didn't like having her belly behind the wheel.

After a while, Mommy Leslie said, “We’re almost there, sweetie; this is our street.”

I took an interest in the neighborhood as we drove through it because I knew that I would be walking around it a lot. Looking out the window, I said, “The trees kinda look like hearts.”

Glancing out the window, Mommy Leslie said, “Now that you mention it, they sure do.”

Looking at them again, I said, “How come?”

“Do you see the power lines?” looking back at me, Mommy Grace said, “The trees grew up to the lines and then grew out to either side. That's why they've got a heart shape to them.”

Finally, we pulled into the driveway and Mommy Grace hit a button on the ceiling to open the door. Inside the garage, I saw two big bikes and a little girl’s bike with training wheels on it. As we got out of the car, Mommy Grace said, “Mommy Leslie doesn’t right her bike much right now. But you and I can ride together.” Helping me from the car, she said, “I’m sure you can’t wait until the training wheels are off.”

My mommies showed me around; there was the family room, the dining room, a breakfast nook, and the kitchen. Upstairs there was a large bathroom and a hallway that led to Mommies’ bedroom. On the opposite side of the house, I saw three doors; one was a bedroom, one had a crib and a rocking chair. The last door was closed, and I saw the letters S-O-P-H-I-E on it. Looking at them, a smile on my face, I said, “That’s your room, sweetheart; take a look.”

The room was quite large, slightly bigger than the room Kevin had, with a bed, a dresser, and a closet. There were a table and chairs in one corner, all set for a tea party. There was even a guest already, a doll whose package said her name was Anna. In front of the window, I saw a small bookshelf with picture books and storybooks on it. I spotted a pair of shoes on top of the bookcase. “Those are ballet slippers, Sophie.” Walking up behind me, Mommy Leslie said, “Once you’re all settled in, we’ll get you signed up for classes.”

Tearing up, I hugged them both and said, “Thank you, Mommies.”

I was home. I was loved. I was happy.
111111111111111111111.title: My New Home

1111111111111111111111.content:
It had only been a short time since we’d gotten home; Mommy Leslie was taking a nap, while Mommy Grace was doing some school stuff and I was walking around. I found myself in the kitchen when Mommy Grace was working on her computer.
Walking up to her, I tugged on her shirt sleeve and said, “Is it lunchtime yet?”

“No sweetie, it’s not.” Looking at me, she said, “Lunchtime isn’t until noon; that’s 12:00.”

“Oh.” After waiting a moment, I said, “Is it 12:00 yet?”

“Of course not, sweetie...” kneeling, she looked at me and said, “Don’t you know how to tell time?”

I shook my head sadly; I hadn’t realized just how much knowledge I’d lost until that moment. Picking me up, Mommy Grace said, “Don’t worry, honey; mommy will teach you.” Walking over to the microwave, she said, “Do you know your numbers?”

“Uh-huh.”

“Can you count to sixty?”

I nodded and said, “I know all that stuff, I just don’t know how to it goes together on the clock.”

“Wow, they go all out for clients like you. But don’t worry, you’ll pick it up again in no time.” Pointing to the numbers on the microwave, she said, “The number on the left of those two dots, can you tell me what that is?”

“Ten.”

“That’s right, ten! The number of the left is the hour; there are 24 hours in a day, and it's divided into two 12-hour periods. That is unless you were in the military like mommy, then it’s just one 24-cycle.” Sighing, Mommy Grace said, “So we know the hour is ten, now what’s the number of the right side?”

“Thirty.”

“Look at you, my little genius. The number on the right is the number of minutes after the hour. If there are 60 minutes in an hour, then what time is it?”

I understood what she was saying now. “It’s 10:30 mommy!”

“That’s right!” giggling, Mommy Grace said, “That means, in an hour and a half it’ll be what time?”

"12:00!"

“And since its 10:30 in the morning, that means that 12:00 has another name. At night it’s called midnight, but during the day we call it noon.” Looking at me, she said, “So since lunch is at noon, how long is it until then?”

“An hour and twenty-nine minutes.”

"Huh?"

I pointed. "The time on the clock changed."

"See? I knew you would pick it up right away." And she hugged me.
1111111111111111111111.title: What Time Is It?

11111111111111111111111.content:
The next day was a rather important one; first, my mommies got me registered for kindergarten. After all, I had to go to school. Then, after that, we went to sign up for ballet classes. I was in for a surprise when I got there; because, as we pulled into the parking lot, I saw Kelsey walking through the parking lot. As we drove by, I saw my former mommy sitting in the car.

I remembered that Kelsey took ballet, but it hadn’t occurred to me that we’d end up at the same school. My mommies said they were going to wait a few more days before emailing my former family; to give everyone time to settle. I wanted to email them myself, but they both said I was too young. I could only imagine how they’d react when they learned I was a little girl now.

******************************


After that, we went to the park to have a picnic lunch. Mommy Grace pushed me on the swing, and watched me on the playscape, while Mommy Leslie read a book on baby names. I soon realized that she hadn’t decided yet. Eventually, I got tired, so Mommy Grace and I went back to the shady tree where the blanket was set up. Sitting to Mommy
Leslie, Mommy Grace said, “How goes the baby name search?”

"Oh, you know me; I think I have the perfect name one day, and the next I hate it.”

"Maybe Sophie can help," Mommy Grace turned to look at me and said, “Sweetheart, would you like to help name your little brother?”

I know what you're thinking; but no, I didn't say Kevin. "Kyle David."

Mommy Leslie thought it over a for a moment, until she said, “You know what, that has a good ring to it.” Placing a hand on her belly, she said, “We’ll see you in a few months, Kyle David Cummings.”

******************************


That night I was asleep until a loud noise woke me. Sitting up, I listened to the rain hitting my window; when a bright flash, and the same loud noise, made me scream.

After less than a minute, Mommy Grace ran into the room. “Are you alright, Sophie?”

"I'm ascared."

"Thunderbolts and lightning are very very frightening, huh, Galileo?"

I didn’t get the reference, but I nodded anyway. Picking me up from the bed, she said, “Come with me, kiddo; I don’t think Leslie will mind.”
11111111111111111111111.title: A Big Day

111111111111111111111111.content:
The days went by fast, and it was the first day of kindergarten. Mommy Grace had to go back to medical school, so Mommy Leslie took me to school. "I'll be right here when class lets out," she said. "Then, we'll have lunch, and then I'll take you to ballet lessons. Sound good?"

"I can't wait," I said. "I love you, Mommy."

"I love you, too, angel." She kissed me. "Have a good day."

******************************


"Good morning, class," the teacher said, a woman about the age of my mommies. "My name is Mrs. Detweiler. I'll be your teacher this year. To start us off, I thought I'd invite you all to tell us all something about yourselves. I'll start: This is my second year of teaching, I've been married for four years, and my wife and I will have a baby in two months. Whoever wants to go next, raise your hand."

After a few kids had taken their turns, I raised my hand for mine. "My name's Sophie Cummings. I was just adopted. I've got two beautiful mommies, and I'll get a baby brother in two months."

"Sounds like a couple in my birthing class," Mrs. Detweiler said. "Well, we're all happy for you, Sophie."

After all the kids who wanted to talk about themselves had their chance, we went on to finger painting.
111111111111111111111111.title: First Day of Kindergarten

1111111111111111111111111.content:
Thanks to Mommy Grace, I knew that 1:45 meant that class was almost over. I didn’t want it to be over; I wanted to continue playing with some friends I’d made, Amelia Doherty and Scott Moran. But unfortunately, we had to leave; so I walked with the rest of the class to the pickup area.

I was one of the last ones to leave, so Mrs. Detweiller had us stick together until our parents showed up. After a few more minutes, I saw Mommy Leslie walking across the parking lot. Before anyone could stop me, I ran out into the parking lot to hug her. But instead of getting a hug, I got a stern look instead.

“Young lady, we don’t run into a parking lot without looking.” Grabbing my hand, Mommy Leslie said, “What if there was a car coming?”

Feeling sad, I said, “Sorry mommy.”

Mrs. Detweiller came running up to us as we stepped onto the sidewalk. Mommy Leslie had a shocked look on her face, but didn’t do anything as Mrs. Detweiller said, “Sorry about that, Leslie; she got away from me there.” Pausing, she said, “I didn’t know you and Grace were looking to adopt.”

“We weren’t planning on it, but then this little one stole our hearts.” Picking me up, the best she could, Mommy Leslie said, “She came from a broken home, so Grace and I decided to give her a supportive family.”

Was Kevin’s home a broken one? I looked at them both as Mrs. Detweiller said, “Well I can’t think of two better parents for such a lovely little girl.” taking a breath, she said, “Just promise me one thing; whatever she does with her life, promise you’ll be supportive of her.”

I thought I saw Mommy Leslie frown a little bit; before she said, “Of course, we’ll support her no matter what.”

After that, we said goodbye and walked to the car. As she clipped me into the booster seat, I looked at Mommy Leslie and said,
“Mommy, what’s wrong?”

Glancing back at Mrs. Detweiller, Mommy Leslie said, “How much do you remember of our chat before you became Sophie.”

I had to think about that for a moment; I remember bits and pieces only. “I ‘member you saying you had another daughter, who you hurt.”

“That’s right, sweetie.” Getting into the car, Mommy Leslie said, “Sara...Mrs. Detweiller was my daughter. Which I guess, in a sense, makes her your sister.”
1111111111111111111111111.title: After School

11111111111111111111111111.content:
Mommy Leslie didn’t say much during the 20-minute drive to the ballet studio; I could tell she was upset about something, but I decided not to ask her what was wrong. I just assumed that it had something to do with Mrs. Detweiller being my ‘sister’ and left it at that.

After getting to the ballet studio, I quickly ran to the bathroom to get changed into my leotard. I looked really pretty in it. Once that was done, I joined the others on the floor in one of the rooms; where we waited for our teacher to come in.

Given everything that’s gone on today, I shouldn’t have been surprised when Kelsey walked into the room behind the teacher. After introducing herself, the teacher turned to Kelsey and said, “Ms. Scott is one of my advanced students; she’ll be helping me teach this class.” Pausing, she said, “Kelsey, why don’t you tell the children about yourself?”

Stepping forward, Kelsey said, “Well, like Ms. Sullivan said, my name’s Kelsey; I’m 15 years old, been doing ballet for 9 years and cheerleading for 3.” Pausing, she said, “I actually got into ballet on a dare; growing up I was a bit of a tomboy and my twin brother, Kevin, said I couldn’t do anything feminine. Well the jokes on him; because I’ve performed the lead in the last two recitals and I’m co-captain on the cheer squad.”

Now it was my turn to be upset; it’s only been a few days since I left, but I could tell that Kelsey was struggling to hold herself together. I wanted nothing more than to go up and tell her who I was, but I knew it wasn’t the right time for that. After that, we all introduced ourselves before we got down to doing some exercises.

***********************


I was standing up against the wall, a short time later practicing standing on my toes, when Kelsey came up behind me. “You’re
doing a very good job, Sophie; but you might want to work on strengthening your legs.”

“Thank you, Ms. Scott.”

“Please, call me Kelsey.” Looking at me, she said, “Aren’t you the little girl with the two moms?”

“Uh-huh.”

“I thought you looked familiar.” Kneeling in front of me, Kelsey said, “You remind me a lot of myself at your age; I was a natural at ballet.”

I’m sorry you’re hurting, Kelsey; I’m right here. As I looked at her, I found it difficult not to just come out and say that I was her brother. But, once again, I knew the time wasn’t right.

**************************


Once class ended, Kelsey walked me over to Mommy Leslie and said, “Ma’am, you’ve got a wonderfully talented little girl here.”

“That’s wonderful of you to say.” Smiling, Mommy Leslie said, “She was very nervous about starting this class, but I’m glad to see it was all for nothing.”

Getting bored with the conversation, I said, “Mommy, can we get ice cream on the way home?”

“I’m afraid not, sweetie; Mommy Grace and I have plans with some friends tonight, so we need to get home.” Pausing, Mommy Leslie said, “It’s kind of last minute, so I hope I can find a babysitter.”

Those words had barely left Mommy Leslie’s mouth when Kelsey said, “I can babysit.”

Surprised, Mommy Leslie said, “Really?”

“There’s something special about your little girl, ma’am; something I can’t quite put my finger on.” Sighing, Kelsey said, “Besides, I’m not exactly looking forward to going home right now; my mom’s been pretty depressed the last few days.”

I was torn; between wanting to spend time with Kelsey, and not wanting to. Before I could make my opinion known, Mommy
Leslie said, “Okay then; call your mother and let her know, then I’ll bring you both to the house.”

“Awesome, I’ll be right back.” Tousling my hair, Kelsey said, “We’re going to have fun, Sophie.”

After Kelsey ran off, Mommy Leslie looked at me and said, “What’s wrong, sweetie?”

“Kelsey was my twin sister.”
11111111111111111111111111.title: Ballet

111111111111111111111111111.content:
"We should be back by 9:00, Kelsey," Mommy Grace said, "so you can tell your mom to pick you up then. Sophie's bedtime is 8:30, anyway."

"Will do, Mrs. Cummings," Kelsey said. "Any medical issues I should know about? Y'know, like food allergies?"

"Nary a one," Mommy Leslie said. "You've got our phone number, in case of an emergency. There are frozen dinners in the freezer. And don't let her play with the tablet for more than an hour." She turned to me. "You'll be a good girl for Kelsey?"

"Yes, Mommy." What Kelsey didn't know was that being a good girl included not telling her that I used to be the twin brother she was mourning. If she figured it out for herself, that was okay, but I wasn't supposed to lead her to that.

I got a hug and a kiss from each of my mommies, and then they said goodbye.

Once they were gone, Kelsey asked, "What do you want to do first?"

"Wanna see my room?"

"Sure."

I led her to my room and showed her around. "This is my dresser. I got most of my clothes in here. This drawer is for my ballet things."

"Nice. I keep my ballet things apart from my other clothes, too."

Of course, I already knew that. It was where I got the idea. But I didn't say so. "Sometimes I come in this corner to read one of my books, or play on Mommy's tablet. And sometimes, I have tea parties with Anna. That's her right there."

"Hello, Anna. Pleased to meet you."

"My dress-up clothes are in the closet, for if I'm going to a party, or if I feel like being a princess."

"Smart."

"This is my toy chest. This on top is my new baby dolly. She drinks, cries, and wets. I got her for if I get bored when my mommies have to take care of my baby brother."

"With your mommies as examples, I'm sure you'll be a wonderful mommy, yourself."

This brought us to my bed, with my Frozen 2 pajamas laid out for me. "This is Teddy. He sleeps with me."

"Delighted, Teddy." She reached for the table drawer, where I kept the pictures she gave me before I became Sophie. "What's in here?"

I pushed the drawer shut again. "That's mine."

"Sorry," she said, backing away. "I didn't mean to pry."

"I forgive you. So, that's my room. What do you want to do now?"

"Well, it's about an hour before your supper. I'll let you play with the tablet, then call you when supper's ready. Okay?"

"Okay!"

Sure enough, when she called me to supper, I saw that an hour had gone by. I gave her the tablet (no gadgets at the table, anyway), and sat down for my supper, which was chicken nuggets and macaroni and cheese.

After supper, we watched a movie. Well, I watched the movie. Kelsey did her homework. When the movie was over, Kelsey played Candy Land with me.

After a while, Kelsey said, "It's getting close to your bedtime. We'd better give you a bath."

As Kelsey washed me, I said, "I had fun today."

"I'm glad you did," she said. "My twin brother stopped having fun a while back, and he got really sad from it. I wouldn't want you to be sad like that."

"You're a good ballet teacher."

She kissed my forehead. "Thanks."

Once she dried me off, I put on my pajamas and got into bed. Kelsey tucked me in, then she read me The Little Engine That Could.

"Goodnight, Kelsey."

"Goodnight, Sophie."

I slept for a little while, until my mommies came in, and they kissed me goodnight.
111111111111111111111111111.title: My Sister, My Babysitter

choices: The Cat's Out of the Bag
1111111111111111111111111111.content:
In the first week of school, Amelia, Scott, and I became good friends. I introduced them to both my mommies when either one would come pick me up. They introduced me to their parents, and the parents started talking about a playdate for us.

I didn't get along at all with Danny Maher, though. That was clear in the second week of kindergarten.

Mrs. Detweiler had us drawing pictures with crayons, and I was drawing a picture of my family. I was really focused on my picture, and I barely heard when Mrs. Detweiler said, "Danny, back to your picture."

I did notice, though, when Danny pulled my hair. I swung out the back of my hand, and definitely hit him. Mrs. Detweiler separated us before it got any further, and took Danny to the principal's office. I figured that was the end of it, and went back to my picture.

Imagine my surprise when Mrs. Detweiler came to me and said, "The principal wants to talk to you, Sophie. Your moms are on their way."

******************************


I couldn't understand why I was in the principal's office. Danny Maher started it. Why was I in trouble?

Then I started worrying about what my mommies would do. Would they take away my toys? Maybe decide I couldn't be in ballet anymore?

My mommies finally came. "Good afternoon, ladies," Principal Pasternak said. "I'm sure you're wondering why I called you. Your little Sophie has gotten herself into an altercation with another student."

"How did it happen?" Mommy Leslie asked.

"He pulled her ponytail, and she hit him."

"I don't understand," Mommy Grace said.

"Where did I lose you?"

"You said Sophie got herself into trouble. Then, you told us a story where she defended herself. Draw me a map from the one point to the other."

"Mrs. Cummings, we teach non-violence in this school."

"And that's a laudable goal, but Sophie is the victim. She should not be treated as if her actions are equal to those of the boy who attacked her."

I sighed with relief. Mommy Grace understood.

"Mrs. Cummings,... "

"I'm sure you're aware of the statistics linking childhood bullying and abusive relationships later in life. Don't you want to protect your students from that situation?"

Principal Pasternak sighed. Mommy Grace had him boxed in. "Perhaps I overreacted in this case." Turning to me, he said, "I'm sorry, Sophie." Turning to Mrs. Detweiler, he asked, "Can she return to class?"

"We're about to dismiss for the day."

"You're dismissed, Sophie."

******************************


"I tried to tell him that," Mrs. Detweiler said, as she walked us back to kindergarten. "But he insisted it was the principle of the thing. No pun intended."

Mommy Leslie chuckled.

"I dealt with my share of guys like that in the army," Mommy Grace said. "Between that and the reading I've been doing getting ready for the baby, I was ready for him."

"Well," Mrs. Detweiler said, "if he thought that Sophie was starting trouble, he should've seen me growing up. I was quite the little hel - I mean, troublemaker as a little girl."

"No kidding," Mommy Leslie said. "I still remember the time you decided to cut a girl's hair with safety scissors."

Mrs. Detweiler stopped. "Where did you hear about that?"

Mommy Grace bent down to me. "I think Mommy just put her foot in it."
1111111111111111111111111111.title: I Get in a Fight

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
Mommy Leslie sighed. "Have you heard of a company called New Horizons?"

"They're those people who change other people, aren't they?"

"The same. I work in the Life Design department. Before I went to work for them, I was a client." She put her hands on Mrs. Detweiler's shoulders. "Sara, I... I used to be your father."

"You... " She looked at Mommy Leslie's face, then her belly. "How is this possible?"

"We do good work." Mommy Leslie took a breath. "I did a lot of soul-searching after that fight we had, and I knew everything had to change. So I changed it all."

"Did you do this to follow me?"

"No, Sara. You had your life to live, and I wanted you to live it. I was totally surprised when your wife and I wound up in the same Lamaze class with you, and I had no idea you would be Sophie's teacher. I wanted to see the world the way you saw it, but I didn't think I had earned the right to ask anything of you. But now it's all out in the open, so I guess I have to ask: What do you want to do now?"

Mrs. Detweiler was quiet for a while, just looking Mommy Leslie in the eyes. Finally, she walked over and gave her a hug. "I can't forget the things you said and did," she said. "But, for the sake of my child, and your children,... I can, and I do, forgive you."

Mommy Leslie kissed Mrs. Detweiler on the cheek. "Thank you, Sara. Thank you."

The both of them cried for a while, with Mommy Leslie taking longer to stop, because of the baby.

When Mrs. Detweiler stopped crying, she turned to Mommy Grace and asked, "Did you go to New Horizons, too?"

Mommy Grace shook her head, and held up her tattooed arm. "This is the only customization I've undergone."

"I went," I said.

Mrs. Detweiler knelt in front of me. "You, Sophie?"

"I wanted to start over. Mommy Leslie helped me design my body, and then she and Mommy Grace adopted me."

"Well, I never would have guessed it, Sophie. Your mommy did a good job."
11111111111111111111111111111.title: The Cat's Out of the Bag

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Mommy Leslie invited Mrs. Detweiller to come by the house and talk; something which Mommy Grace didn’t think was a very good idea. The whole ride home, she was saying how it was a bad idea. “The only reason she reacted that way, back there, was because we were in public.” Sighing, she said, “What’s to stop her from blowing up on you when we get home?”

“I know my daughter, Grace; Sara...she won’t do anything like that.” Sitting the passenger seat, Mommy Leslie said, “I mean, sure
she handled it better than I expected but I don’t think she’ll react negatively once we’re home.”

“Put yourself in her position, babe; you just learned that a pregnant woman in your Lamaze class was, in fact, your father.”
Coming to a stop, Mommy Grace said, “You alienated her because of her sexuality; now, 5 years later, you’re in a lesbian relationship of your own.”

“What did you want me to do, Grace?” getting frustrated, Mommy Leslie said, “You know how torturous it’s been for me, sitting
next to her and Emily every week for the last 2 months.”

“I would’ve preferred you not acted impulsively, without thinking about what this would do to me and our daughter.” Sighing, Mommy Grace said, “But then again, we wouldn’t be in this situation had you not acted impulsively 5 years ago.”

“I can’t believe you just said that.” Her face turning red, Mommy Leslie said, “You know full well I didn’t do this on impulse; I had a very good reason for doing so.”

Full of regret, Mommy Grace said, “I-I’m sorry, babe; I didn’t mean to say that.” Looking at Mommy Leslie, she said, “I know you didn’t act impulsively; and I’m glad you were willing to make such a drastic change. I love you more than anything in the world.”

“I love you too, Grace.” Sighing, as she calmed down, Mommy Leslie said, “But if you ever say anything like that again, I’ll divorce you right then and there.”
111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Tense Ride Home

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once we were home, Mommy Leslie said to me, "This is our first time with houseguests since you came into our lives, Sophie, so I want you to know how to get our attention without interrupting. You know, because that would be rude. Put your hand on my wrist."

When I did, she said, "Okay. If that doesn't get a response, just tap my wrist. Now, if I'm not in a conversation, I'll talk with you right away. If I'm talking to someone, I'll put my hand on top of yours. That means I know you're there. Just be patient, and I'll talk with you just as soon as this conversation is over. Okay, sweetie?"

"Okay, Mommy."

The doorbell rang, and Mommy Grace let in Mrs. Detweiler and her wife, who was as big as Mommy Leslie. "Welcome to our home," Mommy Grace said. "You're looking well."

The pregnant Mrs. Detweiler didn't say anything, but my teacher said, "Thank you. The place is lovely."

"Can I get you anything?" Mommy Grace asked. "Bottled water? Juice?"

"A bucket," said the pregnant woman, glaring at Mommy Leslie. "I'm going to throw up."

"Emily," my teacher said, "we discussed this." Turning to Mommy Leslie, she said, "So, how have you been doing, since you changed?"

"Well, a friend from work fixed me up with Grace. I was a total nervous wreck, and blabbed everything to her. Darn near scared her off. But she gave me a second chance, and we haven't looked back since. I'm so lucky."

"Yeah, lucky's the word, alright," Emily said. "Sara had a rougher time of it. I know: I was one of the EMTs who rescued her."

"Rescued?" Mommy Leslie looked like she was going to be sick. "Sara?"

I started to cry.

"Emily," Sara said, "ix-nay in front of the ild-chay."

"Almost the whole bottle," Emily said, paying no attention. "That's what you did to her. You want to know what it was like for her? I wish I had a bottle of them right now, so I could - "

"That's enough!" both Mommy Grace and Sara said.

It got quiet for a while, except for me and Mommy Leslie crying.

"Come on, Sophie," Sara said. "Why don't you show me your room?"

"Go ahead, honey," Mommy Grace said. So I led her to my room.

Instead of showing her around, though, I just climbed onto my bed and cried. Sara didn't say anything, she just rubbed my back.

When I finished crying, she said, "I'm sorry Emily was like that. I guess it was a little more raw for her than I thought."

"What was in the bottle?" I asked.

"Pills. I was in a bad place inside. The only parent I'd ever known said he didn't love me anymore, so I felt like nobody loved me. After... after that, I realized that I didn't really want to die, so I called for help. Emily came, I got therapy, and the rest is history. Do you understand?"

"Uh-huh. My mommy from before and my twin sister, they were ascared that I was going to a bad place. So they took me to New Horizons."

"That's right. I forgot you told me about that." She gave me a side hug. "I just thought of something: My dad is your mommy, right? That kind of makes me your big sister, doesn't it?"

"I guess so."

"But we can't let anybody else know about this. That would mean your mommy's privacy, and my job. So, during school, I'll be Mrs. Detweiler, and, when school is out, I'll be Sara. Okay?"

"Okay!"

We went back to the living room, where Mommy Grace was holding Mommy Leslie, and Emily was looking like she knew she did something wrong.

Sara sat down next to Mommy Leslie. "My therapist told me something very clever," she said. "He said I should write a letter to you, detailing everything you did that I didn't like. Then, I should take the letter and burn it. It worked, too: I realized that the reason those feelings haunted me was because I was carrying them. Once I put them out and let go of them, they didn't have any power over me. I was free to build my life, the way I wanted. I actually heard the chains breaking, and I knew I could be a better person."

"I'm sorry I hurt you, baby," Mommy Leslie said.

"I'm sorry for what I said," Emily said, coming closer to us. "I'm sorry, to all of you."

"I'm sorry I threatened to leave you, Grace," Mommy Leslie said.

"I'm sorry I accused you of rushing into everything," Mommy Grace said.

We all stood there, hugging each other, until it was time for Sara and Emily to go.
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Contentious Visit

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was finally the weekend; which meant that Amelia, Scott, and I were having a play date. I was a little nervous about having them over; because this would be the first time they saw me in something that wasn’t a dress. I remembered telling Mommy Leslie that I wanted to both girly and a girl who didn’t mind getting dirty. I just hoped that Amelia and Scott would understand.

Mommy Grace had one of our neighbors come over the day before and put together some play equipment in the backyard. He did that even while I pestered him with questions; which he took in stride. I was outside playing on the swing when I heard Mommy Leslie’s voice calling me from inside the house.

Jumping off the swing, I ran inside to find Amelia and Scott standing in the doorway with Amelia’s mommy standing behind them. *I’d later find out that Amelia’s mommy was dating Scott’s daddy.* All my concerns about how they’d react to seeing me in overalls evaporated when I saw them both wearing the same thing.

After we hugged each other, we ran excitedly ran out to the backyard to start playing. As I ran through the house behind them, I couldn’t help but wonder if these two would become my life-long friends as Kyle and David had been for Kevin.
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Weekend

111111111111111111111111111111112.content:
Amelia, Scott, and I had fun for about an hour, until Mommy Grace said, "Alright, little ones. I think we can talk Leslie into maybe fixing up some treats for us, but only if our hands and faces are nice and clean."

We went back inside, and were greeted with the smell of fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies. The three of us scrubbed ourselves, and were rewarded with cookies and milk at the breakfast table. "Thanks for having us, Mrs. Cummings," Amelia said. "Most of the kids I play with, their moms won't let girls get dirty."

"That's a shame," Mommy Grace said. "You can learn a lot by getting dirty sometimes. And that's what we want for Sophie. When she grows up, she could work in the sciences, just like her mom."

"Or," Mommy Leslie added, "she might join the army, just like her mom. Or maybe she'll be a ballerina. Or anything else. But she'll only find what she wants to do by trying different things. Our job as parents is to help her and support her. Trust me, kids, you don't want your children to grow up and think you don't support them."

After milk and cookies, we watched a movie, and Amelia and Scott thanked both my mommies before they went home.
111111111111111111111111111111112.title: Later On

1111111111111111111111111111111121.content:
A week had passed since school had started; I was quickly getting into the swing of things. I'd had two more ballet classes; in which I found out that I was a quick learner. I spent most of my time at school hanging out with Amelia and Scott; the three of us had quickly become inseparable.
