Mommy Grace was busy with something from school, while Mommy Leslie had dinner plans with Mrs. Detweiller; so I wasn’t surprised when I got off the bus to find Kelsey waiting for me at the bus stop. I quickly ran up and hugged her, yelling, “Kelsey! Kelsey!”

“Hey there, kiddo.” Kneeling in front of me, Kelsey said, “How was school today?”

“It was fun!” holding up a piece of paper, I said, “I drawed a photo of my mommies and me.”

“Well then, we should put that on the fridge for them to see, shouldn’t we.” Taking my hand, Kelsey said, “I’ve got some snacks waiting for you at home.”

As we walked up the street to my house, I found myself thinking about how much my relationship with Kelsey had changed – we’d gone from being twins to me being a little girl that she babysat for. Of course, it helped that she didn’t know that I had been her brother. Mommy Leslie had emailed Kelsey and her mommy a few days earlier; telling them that I was safe and happy with my new family – while not going into too much detail.

********************************


It was shortly after 4:30 and I had just come in from playing in the backyard; all covered in dirt and mud. Kelsey was sitting at the kitchen table, working on homework, when she saw me standing there. “We should probably get you cleaned up, don’t you think?”

What followed was a bath where a fair amount of water ended up on the bathroom floor; thanks, in large part, to Kelsey and me splashing each other. Once we were both dried off, she carried me down the hall to my bedroom.

It was then that I felt a lump in my throat; the drawer where I kept my photos was wide open. It wouldn’t have been a problem had the drawer not been next to my dresser, where Kelsey was rummaging to find an outfit for me to wear. After choosing a pair of shorts and a Paw Patrol shirt, Kelsey was closing the dresser drawers when she noticed the photos.

I started to panic as she placed my clothes on the bed and took out the photos. Looking them over for a moment, she looked at me and said, “Where did you find these, Sophie?”

I’d be lying if I said I’d given a lot of thought to what I would say in this situation. At that moment, I was terrified – both because I’d been caught and because I was afraid of how Kelsey would react. As I started tearing up, I looked at her and said, “You gave them to me.”

Kelsey just stared at me in silence for a moment; her mouth agape. After a few moments, all she could manage to say was, “Kevin?”
1111111111111111111111111111111121.title: Kelsey Babysits Again

11111111111111111111111111111111211.content:
"I don't believe it," Kelsey said, as I got dressed. "This whole time, you've been pretending to be 5?"

"I'm not pretending," I told her. "Just like I'm really a girl, I'm really a little kid."

"How much do you remember from before?"

"I 'member you, and my first mommy, and Kyle, and David. I 'member how sad I was. But I don't 'member school, so don't ask me to help with your homework."

She laughed. "I helped you, silly." She put her hand on my shoulder. "They really changed you, didn't they?"

"Uh-huh."

"I should have guessed, since they changed so much about you. They even made you left-handed, like me."

I smiled. I hadn't been thinking of Kelsey when I picked being left-handed, but, now that I was reminded, it kind of made us a little closer.

"At least they didn't give you back your speech impediment. The way you used to say T-R sounds like F sounds." She laughed again. "The way Santa looked at Mom when you tried to ask for a truck."

"Did I get it?"

"I think so, yeah."

We sat in the living room and played games. As we played, things changed between us: We weren't a kid and her babysitter anymore, we were more like sisters.

Mommy Grace came home. "How was Sophie?"

"Terrific," Kelsey said. "She's learning quick at ballet, and she's loads of fun to look after." She took a breath. "Mrs. Cummings, I know who Sophie is."

"I see. And how do you feel about it?"

"I'm glad she's happy. That's why we took Kevin to New Horizons."

Just then, the doorbell rang. Mommy Grace answered it.

"Hello again," Mommy Abigail said. "I'm just here to see if Kelsey is ready." As soon as she saw me, she dropped to one knee. "You must be Sophie. Kelsey's told me so much about you."

"And there's more to tell," Kelsey said. "Mom,... Sophie used to be Kevin."
11111111111111111111111111111111211.title: Continue

111111111111111111111111111111112111.content:
It took a few moments for Mommy Abigail to fully grasp what Kelsey had told her. But once she did, she knelt to my level and said, “Kevin? Is that really you in there?”

“Don’t call me Kevin.” Looking at her, matter-of-factly, I said, “My name’s Sophie Cummings.”

Before I could do anything, Mommy Abigail pulled me in for a big hug; squeezing me quite hard in the process. “After we got that email about you being a young child, I feared that I’d never get to see you again.” Releasing me from the hug, she said, “But here you are; a sweet, precious little girl.”

For the first time ever, I was frightened by Mommy Abigail; so I quickly ran behind Mommy Grace and grabbed hold of her leg. All three of them looked at me in shock, as Mommy Grace knelt down to my level. “Sophie, sweet-heart, are you alright?”

Before I could answer, Mommy Abigail said, “She probably just needs her mother.” With a smile, she said, “Come here Sophie, come to mommy.”

I clung even tighter to Mommy Grace as a result; causing her to say, “She’s here with my, Abigail; I’m her mother.”

“Okay, well I was her mother long before you.” Getting to her feet, Mommy Abigail said, “I think I know what makes her tick.”

“You know nothing about Sophie; because you were never her mother. She’s not at all like that sullen, depressed, young man you brought to New Horizons; she’s a happy and vibrant little girl.” Going into much the same mood as she had in the principal’s office, Mommy Grace said, “I guess all she needed to be happy was a stable home; not some single parent whose child desperately wanted a new life.”

I scrambled over to Kelsey, clinging to her while our mommy’s argued in front of us. “How dare you speak to me like that?”

“How dare you presume to know my daughter better than me?” glaring at Mommy Abigail, Mommy Grace said, “Now I suggest you take your one remaining child and leave; or else I’m calling the cops.”

Mommy Abigail was probably looking to say something else, but she stopped herself. Forcibly grabbing Kelsey’s hand, she pulled her towards the door. “Come along, Kelsey; let’s leave Sophie to her happy life.”

Kelsey and I both looked at each other with sadness in our eyes; it was clear we both thought we weren’t going to see each other again.
111111111111111111111111111111112111.title: A Family Dispute

1111111111111111111111111111111121111.content:
I was still pretty shaken up when Mommy Leslie came home 45 minutes later; walking into the house with an annoyed look on her face. I was playing with some toys in the family room, while Mommy Grace was working on her computer. Coming into the room, holding her phone, Mommy Leslie said, “Would you mind explaining why I just had a very loud and expletive-filled phone call with Kelsey’s mother?”

I perked up, ever so slightly, at the mention of Kelsey; Mommy Grace, for her part, put her laptop down and stood up. “She came by to pick Kelsey up; Kelsey discovered the truth about Sophie and told her mother.” Mommy Leslie gave me an annoyed look while Mommy Grace continued, “She told her mother, who immediately tried to jump back into her role as Sophie’s mother. I reminded her that Sophie wasn’t her child anymore; that she gave up that right when she brought Kevin to New Horizons.”

Calming down, ever so slightly, Mommy Leslie said, “I guess that explains her threat to sue us for custody.”

I may not have remembered most of my former knowledge, but I remembered that and knew it wasn’t good. Jumping to my feet I ran over and wrapped my arms around Mommy Leslie. “Don’t let her take me, Mommy; I want to stay with you.”

Both Mommy Grace and Mommy Leslie exchanged sad looks before Mommy Leslie got down on her knees. “You don’t have to worry about that, sweetheart; no judge will give her custody over you since you’re no longer related to her.”

I wasn’t sure why, but at that moment I was fairly certain this entire situation was my fault. I started crying and went on like that for a few moments while Mommy Leslie and Mommy Grace tried to calm me down. Once I eventually stopped crying, Mommy Grace looked at me and said, “What’s wrong, sweetie?”

“I’m sorry, mommy.” Looking at them both, sniffling, I said, “If I’d hidden the pictures better then Kelsey wouldn’t have seen them and none of this wouldn’t have happened.”

Both of them got to their knees and hugged me; with Mommy Grace said, “Sweetie, none of this is your fault.” Sighing, she said,
“It was only a matter of time before they found out the truth; especially if, down the line, Kelsey’s mother asked to see you in person.”

Wiping tears from my eyes, I said, “What’s going to happen now?”

Mommy Leslie took one look at me and said, “Well, how about we go see that new Disney movie like you’ve been asking?”

“Okay!”
1111111111111111111111111111111121111.title: Later On (Leslie Returns)

11111111111111111111111111111111211112.content:
Today was Saturday and the weather was nice, so Mommy Grace decided that it would be a great day to have a picnic at the park. It made me feel better after a nightmare I’d had the night before where Mommy Abigail came to take me away.

We found a shady spot underneath a tree near the pond; Mommy Leslie was sitting there reading a book while Mommy Grace was nearby teaching me how to ride my bike. I fell and scraped my knees a few times; which only served to get me more frustrated about my inability to ride my bike.

After one particularly bad scrape, which necessitated the use of a band-aid, I angrily pushed my bike to the pavement. “Stupid bike.”

“You’re doing so much better than this morning, sweetheart.” Coming to pick the bike up, Mommy Grace said, “You don’t have to rush things.”

“But I used to be able to ride my bike!” tearing up, I said, “I used to be able to do a lot of stuff, but I can’t anymore because I’m a stupid girl!”

Ever since my encounter with Mommy Abigail, I’d been second-guessing my decision to become a little girl. Maybe it would have been better if I chose one of the other options. Getting down on one knee, Mommy Grace looked at me and said, “You will learn to ride your bike, Sophie; that’s not an order but rather a prediction.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, she said, “Don’t be in such a hurry to grow up again; you’ll relearn everything in time. Everyone keeps telling me how incredibly bright you are for your age; give yourself a chance to see the Sophie that they’re talking about, the most amazing little girl I know.”

Mommy Grace was right, I shouldn’t be in a hurry to grow up again; I didn’t want to make the same mistakes that Kevin did. Hugging her, I said, “Thanks, Mommy.”

Mommy Leslie walked over at that point; looking at me, she said, “Sophie, sweetie, I saw Amelia’s mother over by the softball field.”

“Amelia’s here!?” getting excited, I started jumping up and down, “Can I go see her?”

“Of course you can, sweetie,”

I ripped the helmet off and ran to the softball field; getting there just in time to see a boy, wearing a softball uniform and helmet, walk up to Amelia’s mommy. That’s weird, I thought to myself as I got closer, Amelia never mentioned having a brother.
Walking up to Ms. Doherty, I said, “Hi Ms. Doherty.”

Both Ms. Doherty and the boy looked worried as they looked at me; the boy fidgeting with his shirt while Ms. Doherty said, “Hello Sophie.”

I turned my attention to the boy; there was something familiar about him but I couldn’t place it. He looked like a male version of Amelia, but she never mentioned having a twin brother. Putting my hand out, I said, “Hi, my name’s Sophie.”

The boy hesitated for a moment before taking my hand, saying, “H-Hi, m-my name’s E-Evan.”

I was surprised to see that he even sounded like Amelia, but I didn’t dwell on that for too long. “How come I haven’t seen you at school?”

“I...uh…”

Evan looked at Ms. Doherty with a look of utter terror in his eyes. She turned to me and said, “Evan has a condition that requires him to be homeschooled.”

“Oh.” Smiling, I said, “Perhaps you could come over with Amelia the next time I see her?”

“I-I don’t know...”

Ms. Doherty looked at me and said, “I’m sorry Sophie, but we should be going. I’ll tell Amelia you said hi.”

After saying goodbye to Ms. Doherty and Evan, I started walking back towards the picnic blanket. I stopped in my tracks when I heard Evan’s voice behind me, “Sophie, wait!”.

Turning around, I was surprised to see Amelia running towards me; wearing Evan's uniform and holding his helmet in her hands.
11111111111111111111111111111111211112.title: A Picnic at the Park

111111111111111111111111111111112111121.content:
I looked at Amelia in confusion; why was she dressed like a boy and calling herself Evan? “Amelia, what’s going on?”

Looking at me with their sense of confusion in their eyes, my friend said, “It’s kind of hard to explain.”

“Can you at least try?”

With a sigh, my friend said, “My doctor says that I’m trans.”

I turned to Ms. Doherty and said, “What doctor?”

Taking a quick look at her child, Ms. Doherty knelt in front of me. “Sophie, my child came to me about a month ago and said that even though everything said he was a girl, deep down he felt like he was a boy.” Sighing, she said, “I took him to a special doctor who explained that although I’d been told I had a little girl, I actually had a little boy. Do you understand?”

It sounded familiar; like it was something I learned about back when I was Kevin, but I couldn’t remember more than that. I wasn’t sure what to say, so I simply nodded before turning my attention to Evan. “I was going to ask if you wanted to have a tea party at my house tomorrow; but you don’t like tea parties, do you?”

Shaking his head, Evan said, “Not really, no.”

I was disappointed for a moment until I remembered what we had done during our last playdate. “How about we play in the backyard? You seemed to like that last time.”

“That sounds like fun.” A smile on his face, Evan said, “What will your mommies say?”

“Let’s go find out.” Taking Evan’s hand, I started pulling him back to where my mommies were. "Mommy Grace, Mommy Leslie, this is Evan; we all thought he was a girl named Amelia, but he’s not. Can he come over tomorrow?"

“Of course, sweetie.” Looking at Evan, Mommy Leslie said. "We'd be delighted to have you, Evan."
111111111111111111111111111111112111121.title: A Surprise

1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.content:
The ride home was unusually lively; I was sitting in the backseat playing with one of my many car toys while Mommy Leslie and Mommy Grace were discussing something up front. Whatever they were discussing, it sounded like they weren’t agreeing on something. “I don’t think that’s a very good idea, Grace; she’s only 5 years old.”

“You’re not giving her enough credit, Leslie; she’s smarter than most kids her age.” Sighing as she stopped at a light, Grace said,
“Maybe there’s still something of Kevin left in her; but I think she’d understand it.”

I perked up when I heard Kevin’s name mentioned; neither of them had said that name since Mommy Abigail came to visit. Mommy Leslie was silent for a moment, until she said, “Okay fine, we’ll do it your way.” Turning to look at me, she said, “Sophie, sweetie, did Evan tell you anything about being trans?”

“Nope, but his mommy did; he told her that he felt more like a boy than a girl.” Looking up at them, idly fidgeting with the toy in my hand, I said, “She took him to a doctor who said he was a boy, so now his name’s Evan.”

“That’s right, sweetie; he looks like a girl, but he’s really a boy.” Giving Grace an apologetic look, Leslie said, “Do you have any questions?”

Purely by coincidence we drove by a brand-new billboard advertising New Horizons. Looking back at Mommy Leslie, I said, “Was I trans before New Horizons changed me?"

“No honey; you wanted to make a change, so we changed you.” Reaching back to hold my hand, Mommy Leslie said, “If you hadn’t chosen to be a girl, we simply would’ve made you someone else. Evan has always been Evan.”

“Can Evan go to New Horizons?”

“Not yet, sweetie; the procedure is too risky for someone your age; we can turn people into children, but we can’t change children.” Smiling, Mommy Leslie said, “But, if he wants it, we can help him when he’s older.”

The thought of Evan being his true self made me smile; I wanted him to be happy. “I’d like that for him, Mommy.”

*****************************


We got back to the house a short time later; turning the corner as Mommy Leslie was on the phone with someone, she kept calling Dad. “We’re almost home now, Dad; so why don’t you guys come over in an hour or so.” Smiling, Mommy Leslie said, “I’m sure Sophie will be excited to meet you once I tell her.”

After hanging up the phone, Mommy Leslie turned back to look at me. “Sophie, sweetie, how would you like to meet your grandparents?”

“Yes!”

With a smile on her face, Mommy Leslie said, “Well that’s settled then.”

As we approached the house, I noticed a strange car parked out front. Mommy Grace and Mommy Leslie were confused; especially once a man got out and started walking towards them. Rolling down the window, Mommy Grace said, “Can I help you?”

“That depends, I’m looking for Leslie or Grace Cummings.”

“I’m Grace Cummings, Leslie is my wife.” Pausing, she said, “What’s going on?”

Handing an envelope to Mommy Grace, the man said, “You’ve just been served.”

Mommy Grace was silent as the man walked back to his car, while Mommy Leslie grabbed the envelope and looked inside. After a few seconds of silence, she said, "That stupid bitch!"

I gasped in shock at the harsh language Mommy Leslie used, while Mommy Grace just looked at her. "Leslie, language!"

"Sorry, I'm just angry." handing the envelope to Mommy Grace, Mommy Leslie said, "Abigail is suing us for custody of Sophie."
1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.title: The Car Ride Home

1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.content:
The letter from the lawyer had my mommies concerned; so much so that when the doorbell rang 30 minutes later, they were worried. While Mommy Leslie and I snuggled on the couch, Mommy Grace went to answer the door. “God, what now?”

I didn’t know who was at the door, but I figured it was someone nice when she breathed a sigh of relief. Leaning against the back of the couch, I saw four people step inside the house: two older people, a woman about my mommies age, and a teenage boy. With a smile on her face, Mommy Leslie got to her feet and walked over to hug them. “Hey guys, I totally forgot you were coming.”

Looking at Mommy Leslie, concerned, the older woman said, “We spoke about it earlier, sweetheart.”

Taking a deep breath to compose herself, Mommy Leslie said, “I know, Mom; it’s just been a crazy morning.”

Upon hearing that, the man looked at Mommy Leslie and said, “What’s wrong, honey?”

Walking over to retrieve me from the couch, Mommy Leslie said, “Sophie’s birth mother is suing is for custody.”

Taking one look at me, the woman turned her attention to Mommy Leslie, “Is this her?”

“Oh right, I’ve had the worst memory lately.” With a smile, Mommy Leslie said, “Everyone, this is Sophie. Sophie, I’d like you to meet Stan and Joanna Simmons, my parents since becoming a woman; my older sister, Heather; and my kid brother, Duncan.”

After the introductions had been made, I turned my attention to Mommy Leslie’s parents. “If you’re my mommy’s parents, does that make you my grandparents?”

With a smiling on her face, Grandma said, “That’s right, little one.”

Turning my attention to the others, I said, “And you’re my aunt and uncle, right?”

“That’s right, Sophie.” Smiling, Heather said, “I’m your Auntie Heather.”

Although I’m sure it was only an act, considering I knew how teens could be, Duncan looked less than thrilled to be here. Looking at me, putting a smile on his face, he said, “I guess that makes me your Uncle Duncan.”

The family adjourned to the family room as Mommy Grace returned with drinks for everyone. While Heather and Duncan joined me in my play area, Grandma and Grandpa sat on the couch with my mommies. “Don’t you two worry about this custody thing; I’ll put you in touch with a lawyer friend of mine, he’ll take care of you.”

“Thanks, Dad.” Sighing as she sipped her lemonade, Mommy Leslie said, “Do you have any other tips for us?”

“Yes; don’t discuss anything around Sophie.” Pausing to look at me, Grandpa said, “Her chances of winning are slim; but this woman will stop at nothing if she thinks you’re poisoning Sophie’s mind against her.”
1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.title: Meeting My Extended Family

1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.content:
"Mommy Leslie and Mommy Grace wouldn't poison me," I said.

"That's not what it means, honey," Mommy Leslie said. "Grandpa is just warning us not to make you think nasty things about Abigail. We're not happy about the things she's doing to us, but you should make up your own mind how you feel about her."

"You let her call you by your names?" Grandma asked.

"No, she calls us Mommy," Mommy Grace said. She just uses our names to differentiate between us."

"Still," Grandma said, "it might be seen as disrespectful. You might want to look for a different way for her to let you know who she's asking for."

Well, I didn't want to be disrespectful, especially not to my mommies. So I gave it some thought, then I walked up to them. "You're Momma," I said to Grace.

Then I turned to Leslie. "You're Mommy. And Abigail is my auntie."

Grandpa chuckled. "You figured that out, all by yourself, huh, Precious?"

"She's a smart girl," Momma said, patting my head.
1111111111111111111111111111111121111211.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111121111212.content:
When we got home, Mommy Leslie asked me, "How much did Evan tell you about being trans?"

"It was his mommy," I said. "She said he told her he felt more like a boy than a girl, so she took him to a doctor, and the doctor said he was a boy, so now his name's Evan."

"That's right," Mommy Leslie said. "He looks like a girl, but he's really a boy. Do you have any questions?"

"Was I trans before New Horizons changed me?"

"No, honey. You wanted to make a change, and we changed you. If you hadn't chosen to be a girl, we would have made you someone else. Evan has always been Evan."

"Can we take Evan to New Horizons?"

"Not yet, sweetie. We can turn our clients into children, but we can't take children as our clients. We can help him when he's older, though."

"I'd like that for him, Mommy."
1111111111111111111111111111111121111212.title: Reader's choice

111111111111111111111111112.content:
"We shouldn't be later than 9:00," Mommy Grace said to Kelsey, "so you can tell your mom to pick you up then. Sophie's bedtime is 8:30, anyway."

"Alright, Mrs. Cummings," Kelsey said. "Any medical issues I should know about, like food allergies?"

"Nary a one," Mommy Leslie said. "Just don't let her play with the tablet for more than an hour."

Both my mommies kissed me goodbye, and then they left me with my former sister. Mommy Leslie told me not to tell Kelsey that I used to be Kevin. If she figured it out for herself, then it was okay, but I should keep it a secret until then.

"So, Sophie," Kelsey asked, "what do you want to do?"

"Wanna see my room?"

"Alright."

So I brought her to my room. There wasn't much there that would tell her who I was, and I could keep her away from those. "This is my dresser," I said, "where I keep most of my clothes. This drawer is for my ballet things."

I showed her the corner. "Sometimes I read here, and sometimes I have tea parties with Anna. Anna says hello."

"Hello, Anna," Kelsey replied.

"My dress-up clothes are in the closet," I said. "For parties, or if I wanna be a princess."

"Good idea," Kelsey said.

"This is my toy chest. I just got a new baby dolly. She drinks, cries, and wets. It's something to do for when they're busy with my baby brother."

"Sounds good."

I showed her my bed. "This is Teddy. He sleeps with me."

"Delighted, Teddy." She reached for the table drawer where I kept the pictures she gave me. "What's in here?"

I pushed it shut. "That's mine."

"Okay," she said, backing away. "I didn't mean to pry. Is that everything?"

"Uh-huh. What you wanna do now?"

"Let's fix supper in the microwave." She fixed me chicken nuggets and macaroni and cheese.

After supper, we watched a movie, then we played Candy Land.

When it was almost bedtime, Kelsey gave me a bath. Then she put me in my pajamas, tucked me in, and read me The Little Engine That Could.

I fell asleep for a bit, but I woke up when my mommies came in to kiss me goodnight.
111111111111111111111111112.title: Later On

1111111111111112.content:
I was abruptly awakened the next morning by a loud noise. Sitting up in the bed, I barely had time to process where I was before I saw a bright flash outside followed by another loud noise that made me scream.

In hindsight I should’ve figured I wasn’t alone in the room; I mean who would leave a 5-year-old girl alone in a hotel room. But at that moment I was still frightened by the loud noise, which I quickly realized was thunder; so much so that I screamed again when the bedroom door opened.

Once I calmed down, I turned to see Mrs. Cummings rushing into the room wearing pajamas that were just a tad small on her. Running over to the bed, she said, “Sophie, sweetie, are you alright?”

“No.” shaking my head as I clung tightly to the covers, I said, “The thunder is scary.”

With a caring look on her face, Mrs. Cummings sat next to me in bed. “It’s okay, sweetie.” Holding me close, Mrs. Cummings said, “The thunder won’t hurt you.”

As I heard another clap of thunder outside, I said, “Kevin wasn’t ascared of thunder, why am I?”

“How do I explain this so a 5-year-old will understand it.” Mrs. Cummings looked me for a moment, before saying, “While the little machines were busy turning you into an adorable little girl, the computer was busy changing your mind. You wouldn’t want to be a little girl with the mind of a teenager, would you?”

I of course remembered all this from yesterday, but I decided to play along and listen. I couldn’t help but grimace at the thought of being a little girl with a teenager’s mind. Looking at Mrs. Cummings, I said, “So my fear of thunder is because of the computer?”

“That’s it exactly.” Smiling, Mrs. Cummings said, “It gives people random fears; for example, I’m deathly afraid of pelicans now.”

*****************************


Once I was feeling a little better, Mrs. Cummings and I went out to the private patio to watch the storm come through. While we were out there, she told me how she volunteered to stay the night because she knew what I was going through. “I thought that you would be more comfortable with someone who went through the same thing.” Pausing, Mrs. Cummings said, “My wife, Grace, wanted to come but she got called into work at the last minute.”

Hopping off my chair, I walked over and hugged Mrs. Cummings. “Thank you, Mrs. Cummings; for everything.”

“You’re very welcome, sweetheart.” Running a hand through my hair, she said, “But please call me Leslie, alright?”

After talking a little more, Leslie suggested that I get dressed and she’d take us out for breakfast. Suddenly filled with energy, I ran back into the room and found a bag full of clothes sitting at the foot of the bed. Rummaging through it, I found a pair of overalls that looked cute.
1111111111111112.title: A New Day

choices: After the Movie (Leslie receives bad news)
11111111111111121.content:
There was a nice little café on the boardwalk a short distance from the hotel; so that’s where Leslie and I went for breakfast. With everything that’s changed, I figured my favorite foods had changed as well. I was, however, happy to discover that I still liked pancakes.

I was so hungry that I ended up asking for a second helping of pancakes. Once they’d been delivered, apologetically, I looked at Leslie and said, “Sorry, I guess I’m just hungry.”

“It’s okay, sweetie; it’s a side effect of the procedure.” Leaning closer, so no one else could hear, Leslie said, “After I changed, I was hungry that I ordered three omelets from room service.”

It was still drizzling as Leslie and I left the café, so we both stopped under a nearby tree to figure out what we wanted to do. I spotted a movie theater in the distance and, excitedly, said, “Can we go to the movies?”

“Sure, why not.” With a smile, Leslie said, “I could stand to get off my feet for a couple hours.”

As we got closer to the theater, I saw the only age-appropriate movie was Onward. While a big part of me was excited to see the movie, another part was realizing just what it meant to be a little kid again. No more late nights, no more scary movies, no more doing anything without an adult around. But, I thought to myself, that’s price I’m paying for happiness.

After paying for the tickets Leslie and I walked into the theater, where we were approached by a woman a few years older than my former mommy. I grew anxious at the way she was staring at us, while Leslie seemingly ignored it; until the woman said, “You have an adorable little girl there; does she take after her father?”

“I wouldn’t know.” Holding me close, Leslie said, “I’m not her biological mother.”

That seemed enough to satisfy the woman, as she walked out of the theater a moment later. While we waited in line for the concession stand, I looked up at Leslie and said, “Who exactly am I related to, now?”

“I’m not sure I’m qualified to answer that, honey.” Looking down at me, Leslie said, “But that’s not something a girl your age needs to worry about.”

I wasn’t completely sold on that answer, but I didn’t want to press my luck. “Okay.”
11111111111111121.title: Spending Time With Leslie

choices: A Few Days Later (Meeting the new family)
111111111111111211.content:
I don’t know if it was because I was little girl now; but I found myself getting into the movie more than I would’ve had I watched it as Kevin. I even started crying at the end because Ian missed his one chance to see his dad. Once the movie was over, Leslie led me to the bathroom to clean my face as it was covered in popcorn crumbs and bits of chocolate. “Good Lord,” wiping my face, Leslie said, “Were you this messy as a teenager?”

“Not really; but I was big enough to wash myself.”

Leslie must’ve sensed the emphasis I’d put on the word was; because she looked at me and said, “You’ll get there eventually, Sophie; you shouldn’t be so anxious to grow up.” Looking around to ensure the coast was clear, Leslie knelt in front of me and said, “I must admit that I’m a tad jealous; you’re getting to experience something that I never did.”

I honestly had no idea what Leslie was talking about; as we’d both used New Horizon’s services. “What do you mean?”

“You get to grow up as a girl; while I skipped all the important parts.” With a weak smile, Leslie said, “I’ll never get to experience what it’s like to experience a first period or getting my first bra.”

Looking at Leslie, I couldn’t tell if she was being serious or not. “Uh; you experienced every single one of those things.” Placing my hand on her belly, I said, “You’re even experiencing what it’s like to be pregnant.”

“I guess you’re right; but it’s not exactly the same.” Sighing as she ran a hand through her hair, Leslie said, “Each of those is a milestone in a girl’s life; I kind of cheated my way past them.”

After taking a few minutes to use the bathroom, Leslie and I left the theater. It wasn’t raining now, but I could tell a shower had recently come through. Turning my attention to Leslie, I said, “So, uh, what happens now?”

Leslie’s cellphone started ringing before she had the chance to respond; she went off to answer it after ensuring that I stayed where I was. I couldn’t hear the conversation, but I could tell from Leslie’s body language that it wasn’t going well. Leslie returned a few minutes later, looking upset about something. “Well that didn’t go the way I’d hoped.”

Looking at Leslie as we started walking, I said, “What didn’t?”

Stopping in her tracks, Leslie turned to me and said, “That was the Corporate Office; I’d called the Legal department yesterday to inquire about the possibility of adopting you.” Taking a deep breath, Leslie said, “They just got back to me and said it wasn’t possible; that it would be a breach of my employment contract.”

I’d been so focused on adjusting to my new life that I hadn’t given any thought to where I’d end up. The thought of going to live with Leslie was a nice one; but that wasn’t possible anymore. Looking at her, I said, “What’s going to happen to me now?”

“We’ve got several families that I’m sure would love to adopt you.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Leslie said, “Don’t worry; you’ll have a loving family soon enough.”
111111111111111211.title: Leslie Receives Bad News

1111111111111112112.content:
Two days had passed since I learned of Leslie’s failed attempt to adopt me. I spent most of the intervening time either playing with kids at the pool or lounging around the room watching cartoons. It’s been almost 5 days since my procedure and, in that time, I had slowly adjusted to my new life. I realized that I should enjoy my freedom while I could, because everything would change once I was adopted.

I was full of energy today; excited by the prospect of meeting my new family. Leslie had tired herself out trying to wrangle me into a dress she’d bought for the occasion. But eventually she got it on me and lay on the bed while I looked at myself in the mirror.
“God, I think you would’ve given my daughter a run for her money at that age.” Feeling winded, Leslie said, “I just hope my son isn’t that hyper.”

I was too caught up in my appearance to pay attention to what Leslie was saying - the dress I was wearing was probably something one would normally wear to church. I found myself spinning around to get a better look. Once I got tired of that, I turned to Leslie and said, “Thanks for the dress, Auntie Leslie.” With a giggle, I climbed up on the bed next to her and said, “I like how pretty it makes me.”

Leslie looked at me for a moment; eventually saying, “Sometimes I find myself forgetting that you used to be a teenage boy.”

“Yeah, well now I’m a pretty girl!” giggling, I said, “One that’s excited to meet her new family.”

Checking the time on her phone, Leslie said, “Speaking of which; we should probably head downstairs to meet them.”
After helping me with my shoes, Leslie and I ventured down the hall to the elevator. The closer we got to the lobby, the more anxious I got. Looking up at Leslie, I said, “I hope this family likes me.”

“I’m sure they will, sweetie.” With a smile on her face, Leslie said, “They weren’t vetted by New Horizons, but a local agency referred them to us.”

I wasn’t sure what vetted meant, but I didn’t care. “Do they have any other kids?”

“Yes; a 6-year-old girl and a 4-year-old boy.”

I was excited by the prospect of having an older sister; but I was less than thrilled by the prospect of having a younger brother. Having been on that side of the fence, I knew all too well what boys were like at that age. But, as the elevator reached the lobby, I told myself that it wouldn’t be a problem.

Leslie and I stepped out of the elevator to find a family waiting nearby; the looks on the adults faces telling me they were waiting for someone. The father was tall and dressed in a suit, the mother was petite, while the kids looked like younger versions of their parents. Taking my hand in hers, Leslie walked over and said, “I’m Leslie Cummings; are you the Petersons?”

“That’s us.” Looking at me, the woman said, “Is this her?”

“Yes.” Gently pushing me in front of her, Leslie said, “This right here is Sophie.”
1111111111111112112.title: Meeting the New Family

choices: After the Story (Designing my new life)
1111111113.content:
I took a fair amount of time to come to a decision; after all, the life I chose would be mine for the rest of my life. After what seemed like an eternity, but was only 5 minutes, I looked at Dr. Willard and said, “I think I’ll go with Option C.”

“Congratulations Kevin, you’ve just made one of the biggest decisions in your life.” Marking it down on my file, Dr. Willard looked at me and said, “You don’t seem too happy about that.”

I was very happy; but because I’d had a resting sad face for so long, I was finding it difficult to show it. “I’m very happy, Dr. Willard; it’s just...is it weird that I decided to become a woman?”

"It's perfectly normal to want to be a different sex, Kevin; you’d be surprised how many of my colleagues were born one sex and became another.” Smiling, Dr. Willard said, “In fact, one of them works in Life Design; perhaps we can get her to open up about her life.”

With that said Dr. Willard grabbed my file and walked out of the room; followed closely by me. We walked down the hall and entered a doorway that said Life Design. I saw that the only person in the room was that pregnant woman I saw earlier. She looked to be in the middle of eating her lunch; which she hurriedly closed when she saw Dr. Willard and me standing there. “Oh my god, I-I’m so sorry, Dr. Willard; I didn’t know you were there.”

“It’s no problem, Leslie.” Looking at her, Dr. Willard said, “Why aren’t you out with Carrie and Erin?”

“Going for a walk at the park in 80-degree weather, while pregnant, isn’t my idea of fun.” Cleaning up her mess, Leslie said, “I figured I’d come back here and eat my lunch in the air conditioning.”

“I’m sorry to cut your lunch short, but I’ve got a new project for you.” Gesturing to me, she said, “This is Kevin Scott; and he’s decided that he wants to be a woman.”

“It’s nice to meet you, Kevin; I’m Leslie Cummings.” Taking my file from Dr. Willard, she said, “You might be interested to know, I used to be a man.”

“We were talking about that in my office; if you’re okay with it, perhaps Kevin would like to know your history.”

Taking a seat behind her desk, Leslie said, “I don’t see why not; perhaps I can pass on my knowledge, one former man to another.”

“It was a pleasure meeting you, Kevin.” As I took a seat, Dr. Willard said, “I wish you nothing but happiness in your new life.”

After Dr. Willard left the room, Leslie and I looked at each other for a few moments; until I said, “So you used to be a guy, huh?”
1111111113.title: I'm Going to Be a Woman

11111111131.content:
Leslie spent about 20 minutes telling me about how she came to be where she was. She used to be a man in his mid-40s; a staunchly conservative man who was against abortion and gay marriage. All that changed when his 22-year-old daughter came out to him. “I’d never felt more conflicted about anything in my life; would I let my faith get in the way of my love for my daughter?”

“I’m the last person who should be saying this, especially given what I came here for.” Looking at her, I said, “But what does you being a young woman have to do with your daughter being a lesbian?”

“I loved my daughter very much; but I knew almost nothing about her lifestyle, except that the bible said it was wrong.” Taking a deep breath, Leslie said, “So I did the only thing I could think of; I went to New Horizons and had them turn me into a 22-year-old lesbian.”

“You’re a lesbian?” looking at her belly, a part of which was peaking above the desk, I said, “I’m sorry, I thought you were...”

“Don’t worry; a lot of clients make that assumption.” Grabbing a framed photo behind her, Leslie said, “This is me and my wife on our wedding day; 3 years ago next month.”

I gently took the photo from Leslie; seeing her and another woman, wearing what looked to be an Army dress uniform, kissing on the beach. “Your wife’s in the Army?”

“She was in the Army; her enlistment came to an end about 2 months after the wedding.” Smiling, as she took the photo back, Leslie said, “She’s using her GI Bill to go to Med School.”

“Does she know the truth about you?”

“We were introduced via a mutual friend.” Leslie let out a chuckle, before continuing. “I was so nervous on our first date that I ended up telling her everything. I was so worried that I scared her off; until she kissed me and asked me on a second date.”

“Well, it certainly looks like you two are happy.” Smiling, I said, “I know New Horizons doesn’t exactly allow clients much contact with their former families; but does your daughter know?”

Leslie’s smile quickly turned to a frown; as she said, “I’ve wanted to tell her for the last two years, but I never had the courage to do it.” Looking at me, she said, “She thinks I died in some tragic car accident.”

I couldn’t help but feel terribly for this woman I just met. “Leslie, I’m sorry.”

“Don’t be, I brought this all on myself.” Sighing, with a tinge of remorse in her voice, Leslie said, “Besides, I get to see her once a week; even if she doesn’t know it’s me.”

“I’m sorry; I’m still trying to process everything that’s going on.” looking at her, feeling somewhat confused, I said, “How do you see her every week?”

“Cassie and I signed up for Lamaze classes a couple of months ago; you know, to help me prepare to push something the size of a watermelon through something the size of a grape.” Grabbing some tissues, Leslie said, “Imagine my surprise when Grace, my daughter, came into the classroom with a pregnant woman. We got to talking; and long story short, she got married 2 years ago; after which she and her wife decided to have a baby.”

“That must have been awkward for you and your wife.”

“Not as much as you’d think; being the only two lesbian couples in the class, we’ve managed to strike up a friendship.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “Amy keeps trying to convince me to come out to my daughter, but I’m not sure I’m ready to do that yet.”

“However it happens; I hope it works out for you.”

“Thanks.” Looking at a clock on her desk, Leslie gasped and said, “Oh wow; that took way longer than I expected. We should probably get to work designing your new life, don’t you think?”

I didn’t mind talking with Leslie; I felt a sense of kinship with her, seeing how we both used to be men. Look at that, I’m not even a woman yet and I’m already talking like that. “I suppose now’s as good a time as any.”

“Okay then, let’s get to it, shall we?” Turning to her computer, a faint smile on her face, Leslie said, “First things first; what do you want your new name to be?”

I’d been thinking about that on and off since my decision; struggling with several good possibilities. I wanted to make a good choice because this would be my name for the rest of my life. After a few more seconds of thinking, I said, “I’ve decided on Amelia Webber.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Amelia.” Her smile getting bigger, Leslie said, “I always make this little comment to the new women that come through here; “The Bible says God created man before He created woman. Everybody knows the second draft is better than the first.”
11111111131.title: Leslie's Story

111111111311.content:
So begin the lengthy, and sometimes arduous task of designing my life as Amelia Webber. I suppose I should’ve realized how much work was involved in something like this, but I was still thrown off guard.

The first parameters that we worked on revolved around my basic body shape. I’d already settled on being a Caucasian woman, so we continued from there. I didn’t want to go overboard, but I let Leslie talk me into some otherwise objectionable decisions – for example, I didn’t want huge breasts but Leslie still managed to convince me otherwise; so instead of the 34C I was leaning towards, we went with 36D.

When I asked why Leslie was so insistent about that, she said, “I’ve always had a thing for well-endowed women.”

“Hey, I don’t mind the occasional input; but this is my body we’re talking about here.” Looking at her, I said, “I don’t want you turning me into your dream girl.”

“Girl, you’re no fun; but I suppose you’re right.” Turning back to her computer, Leslie said, “Next on the list is height; what are you now, about 5’9”?”

I chuckled to myself; amused that Leslie was already treating me like a woman. I suppose it was something the company did; to help clients get used to their new lives. If I’d chosen to be a little girl, I’m sure she would have talked to me like I was a child. Thinking about her question, I leaned back and said, “I’m just shy of six feet, actually; I just slouch a lot.” Pausing, I said, “This time around, I’m thinking I’d like to go shorter; somewhere around 5’6,”

“Good choice, you could always get a decent pair of heels to look taller.” Inputting the information, Leslie said, “How about hair color and length?”

“I’ve always had a thing for girls with dark blonde hair; so how about that, maybe an inch past my shoulders.” Looking at Leslie, I said, “I’m curious, how exactly will I be transformed?”

“The specialists will use the criteria we’re creating to program nanites; which they’ll inject into your body. The procedure only takes about 15 minutes; but as someone who’s gone through it, I can tell you that it’s physically taxing. Don’t be surprised if you sleep for a few hours afterward.” Glancing at the screen, Leslie said, “We’re all set with the physical parameters; the computer is coming up with a representation of what you’ll look like. After that’s done, we can move onto actually figuring out exactly who Amelia Webber wants to be.”

“Before we get to all, I’ve got a question; how exactly will they alter my personality?”

“I’m not well versed in the science behind it, but I know they use some machine to rewrite your brain to fit the new personality.” Chuckling, Leslie said, “How else would they turn a bible-thumping conservative into a proud lesbian?”

“It all sounds so complicated; what’s to keep them from accidentally erasing the memories from my old life?”

“We’re forbidden from doing that without a court order.” Pausing, Leslie said, “Don’t worry, you’ll be Amelia Webber but you’ll still remember your life as Kevin Scott.”

Suddenly the computer beeped, and I saw a grin form on Leslie’s face. Looking at me, she said, “Damn girl; you’re going to be one attractive woman.”

I blushed a little at that; if Leslie thought I was attractive, then I suppose I made the right decisions. “This is going to be the new me; I just wanted to look good, is all.”

“Trust me, honey; if you decide to be lesbian or bi, I’d be begging my wife to either let you move in with us or to let us move in with you.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “Are you ready to see the new you, Amelia?”

I was getting butterflies in my stomach. Fidgeting a little bit, I said, “I-I’m ready.”

With that, Leslie turned the monitor towards me; and I got my first look at the woman I would soon become. To say I was floored would have been the understatement of the century; I was stunned by what I saw on the screen before me. The woman looking back at me was downright gorgeous, exactly as I’d pictured her as I answered Leslie’s questions.
111111111311.title: Designing Amelia, Part 1

1111111113111.content:
After I spent a few minutes looking at images of what I would soon look like, Leslie and I got to work figuring out my new personality and what kind of life I wanted to have. I won’t bore you with the details; but suffice it to say, I was going to be a straight woman who liked yoga, jogging, and hanging out with friends.

I was also going to have a professional demeanor at work; dressing in a skirt or pantsuit. When not at work I’d dress casually, but wasn’t above dressing up for dates or girls nights. Leslie was finalizing that information when two women, who I assumed were her coworkers Erin and Carrie, walked into the room. As they sat at their desks, one of them said, “Girl, why are you always working through lunch?”

“Last minute assignment from Miranda.” Gesturing to me, Leslie said, “Erin King, Carrie Miller; let me introduce Amelia Webber, formerly Kevin Scott.”

After the introductions were made Erin came behind Leslie’s desk and casually looked at the monitor. “Damn honey, you’re going to be gorgeous.”

“Thank you.” Blushing from embarrassment, I said, “Some of that was Leslie’s idea.”

“I can see that; she always tries to persuade new women to get bigger breasts.” Glancing at Leslie, who was blushing deeply, Erin said, “I’m glad you didn’t take too much of her advice.”

“Do you ladies mind?” getting frustrated, Leslie said, “Amelia and I were just about to finalize her career and education when you came in.”

“My apologies, we’ll let you ladies get back to work.” Looking at me, Erin said, “It’s nice to meet you, Amelia.”

I silently nodded as Erin and Carrie went back to their desks. Once they were gone, I turned to Leslie and said, “There’s one thing that I don’t quite understand; you said that I’ll be given whatever knowledge I’ll need to live my life. But how will I start a career if an employer finds out that my resume is a lie?”

“Don’t worry, honey; we’ve got contacts in colleges all over the country.” Pausing, Leslie said, “With one call, I can get you a degree from any one of them. I can even get you into a sorority if you wanted to.”

“Oh, well I suppose that makes sense.” Looking at Leslie, I said, “I never realized just how complicated this all was.”

“We’re creating a new life for you from scratch; things like that aren’t easy.” Turning to her keyboard, keeping one eye on me, Leslie said, “So the first question; what kind of career would you like to have?”

That question gave me pause, as I tried to figure out an answer to it. After a moment, I said, “My Aunt, or rather Kevin’s Aunt, has made a pretty successful career as a financial executive in New York.” Pausing, I said, “I always thought that would be a fun career to have, but I was never good with math.”

Doing some work on her computer, Leslie said, “I’ve found several possible job openings with companies that we’ve deemed safe for our clients.”

Leslie, once again, turned her monitor to let me see the possible job opportunities:

Option 1: Executive Assistant; Innovative Talent Agency, Los Angeles
Option 2: Customer Service Representative; Boeing, Chicago
Option 3: Human Resources; Verges Financial Group, NYC
Option 4: Paralegal; Law Offices of Dennard & McShane, Washington, DC
Option 5: Office Manager, Target Corporate Offices, Minneapolis

After giving it some thought, I sat back and looked at Leslie. “I think I’ll go with _____.”
1111111113111.title: Designing Amelia, Part 2

choices: First Day of the Rest of My Life
11111111131111.content:
After giving it quite a bit of thought, I sat back and looked at Leslie. “I think I’d like to go with the executive assistant position.” Smiling, I said, “Something about working at a talent agency in LA; sounds like it will be fun.”

“That’s a good choice; I think you’ll be a great boon for them.” Putting everything on a thumb drive, Leslie stood up and said,
“Follow me; it’s about time that the world meets Amelia Webber.”

My pulse was racing as we walked down the hallway; with each step, I grew closer to my new life. We stopped outside a door marked Transfigurations. After knocking twice on the door, Leslie opened it.

Inside was a woman about the age I’d soon be; professional except for her bubblegum pink hair. “Amelia, this is Dr. Lizzie Weintraub; the head of Transfigurations here.” Handing the woman the drive, Leslie said, “Liz, this is soon to be Amelia Webber.”

“It’s a pleasure to meet you, Amelia; I’m glad I can be of service to you.” Plugging the drive into a computer, she said, “I imagine that Leslie told you what you can expect from this?”

“Yes, Dr. Weintraub; she mentioned sleeping for hours after it was finished.”

“We’re all girls here, Amelia; you can call me Liz.” Gesturing towards a nearby door, she said, “Follow me, please.”

After thanking Leslie for everything, I followed Liz through the door into a room whose main feature was a chair. It resembled a reclining chair that was stuck in the reclined position. As she handed me a hospital gown, Liz said, “I’ll give you a few minutes; I’ve found that clients like to say one last goodbye to their former lives.” Pausing, she said, “Once that’s done, take off all your clothes; including socks and underwear. After you put the gown on, you’ll lie back on the chair.”

“If you don’t mind, Liz; I’d like to get started right away.” Sighing, I said, “I’ve already said my goodbyes to every aspect of my life as Kevin.”

Liz nodded silently as she left the room; giving me privacy while I got undressed. Once I settled onto the chair, she came back into the room. Putting my clothes in a bag, she said, “Is there anything in here that you’d like to keep? Otherwise, we’ll return it to Kevin’s family.”

Remembering the photos, I said, “My sister gave me an envelope with some photos, I’d like to keep that.”

She quickly found the envelope and placed it in a plastic container by the door. “Would you like a sedative before the nanites are administered? Some of our clients don’t wish to watch their bodies changing.”

“A sedative would be fine.”

Liz quickly ran an IV into my room; followed by a syringe of what I assumed was the nanites. As she attached some wires to my head, she said, “When you wake up, it’ll be Amelia Webber’s birthday.”

After giving me a quick peck on the cheek, she dimmed the lights and left the room. I then closed my eyes and let the sedative do its work, so the nanites could do theirs.
11111111131111.title: Heading to Transfigurations

111111111311111.content:
I dreamt that I was hanging out in my living room with Kelsey, Kyle, and David; the four of us were watching a movie and eating popcorn.

When a popcorn kernel fell out of my hand and down my front, I figured I’d have to pull it from between my legs like I usually did. Instead, I found that I had to dig it out of my cleavage. Did I have cleavage when I sat down?

Once the movie was over, Kelsey and I went into the bathroom to freshen up. I took a moment to admire myself in the mirror; I was a good-looking young woman.”

“Do you think my books will be like yours when I'm your age?”

Looking at Kelsey, smiling, I said, “Just take a look at your mother, that’ll tell you.”

Suddenly I dawned on me; weren’t Kelsey and I twins? Why I would be talking about her mother as if she weren’t mine? Then I realized how absurd that sounded; we couldn’t be twins because I was a good 10 years older than her.

I left the bathroom to find that Kyle and David were gone. Where did they go? Then I realized, they would’ve hung out with Kevin; but I wasn’t Kevin Scott anymore.

I was Amelia Webber.

********************************


When I woke up again, the first thing I realized was how sensitive my skin was; a wave of pleasurable sensations washed over me as I moved around in the bed. Opening my eyes, I was confronted with a few strands of hair blocking my view; so I pushed them aside while thinking – I’ll have to get used to that.

Sitting up in bed, I found that I was inside a well-appointed hotel room; more than likely a suite from what I could see in the bedroom. “Damn, they go all out for their clients.”

I paused; as that was the first time I’d heard my new voice. It sounded lovely; not too high pitched and almost melodic. I then got it in my head to check out my new body, so I pulled the sheets off and made my way into the bathroom.

My face was just as it had been on Leslie’s screen; only seeing it on a screen didn’t compare to seeing it in person. Damn girl, you look good. I was still wearing the hospital gown, so I couldn’t see what I looked like underneath. Of course, I’d already seen computer images of that, but nothing can beat the real thing.

I was about to disrobe and examine myself when there was a knock at the door. Quickly fixing the gown, annoyed at the interruption, I walked through the room to the door. Smelling a faint scent of smoke outside, I first thought perhaps there was a fire in the building. Looking through the peephole, I saw Dr. Harris holding a small cake while Dr. Willard, Leslie, and Liz stood behind her.

My memory still a little hazy, I opened the door. Before I could say anything, all four women started singing “Happy Birthday” as they walked into my room.
111111111311111.title: First Day of the Rest of My Life

choices: Skip to Meeting My New Parents
1111111113111111.content:
Once everyone was inside, I closed the door and walked over to them. “What’s going on?” confused, I said, “My birthday’s not for another two months.”

“That might’ve have been the case for Kevin.” Placing the cake on the table, Dr. Harris said, “But Amelia Webber has just come into existence; and we celebrate that day as her birthday."

Adjusting the gown a little, I said, “I suppose that makes sense.”

After I blew out the candles, Dr. Willard handed me two small books; no larger than a kindle. “We’ve got gifts for you, as well.”

My curiosity peaked, I opened the first one; and saw that it was a Bachelor’s degree in Public Relations. Opening the second one, I saw that it was a Master’s degree in Business Administration. Looking closely at them, my jaw dropped. “How did you guys get me degrees from Dartmouth?”

“I told you, we have our ways.” Smiling, Leslie said, “Hold your head up high, girlfriend; you’re the first one in your family to go off to college.”

“Well, what do you know?” chuckling, as I put the diplomas next to the cake, I said, “I don’t suppose you got me violin lessons, did you?”

“No we didn’t, but then again you didn’t ask for that.” Looking at me, silently recording everything until now, Liz said, “There are, however, some other matters to attend to. You’re due to leave for Los Angeles in three days; so we’ve got that time to teach you about makeup, heels, and everything else we women have to deal with.”

“Yeah, and that’s not all.”

Feeling overwhelmed, I looked at Leslie and said, “What more can there possibly be?”

“We thought you’d like to meet your parents.”

Surprised, I said, “My mom’s here?”

“No, not Kevin’s mom; Amelia’s parents.” Smiling, Leslie said, “They’ll be here tonight; they want to take you out to dinner.”
1111111113111111.title: Happy Birthday, Amelia

11111111131111111.content:
Before too long Eliza (Dr. Harris, Miranda (Dr. Willard), Leslie, Liz, and I were talking like we were old friends. We were talking about basically anything that we could think of. I always wondered how my mom could find herself drawn into such ideal chit-chat; now that I was a woman, I realized just how easy it could be.

Everyone but Leslie left about an hour later; saying that they had to get back to work. After saying goodbye to them, I closed the door and walked back into the room. Looking at Leslie, sitting on the couch, I said, “Don’t take this the wrong way, Leslie; but why are you still here?”

“We all decided that I’d be the one to train you in how to be a woman.” Leaning back against the couch, Leslie said, “Seeing how I know firsthand what you’re going through, they thought it would be easier.”

“I see.” Sitting next to her, pretending to be a little sad, I said, “Here I thought it was because you liked me.”

“I do like you, Amelia; which is funny to say since we just met this afternoon.” Getting up from the couch, Leslie said, “Now follow me, we need to get you dressed; because that hospital gown is doing nothing to hide your figure, and it’s driving me crazy.”

**************************


The closet in the room had a small assortment (3 outfits) of clothes to choose from. Even though I was now a woman both physically and mentally, I wasn’t ready to wear the dress or the business suit.

After settling on the final option, capris pants, and a blouse, I went into the bathroom to get dressed. I was a little worried about working the bra but found that I was able to put it on without a problem. Duh, they probably gave me the knowledge to do that.

Once I was satisfied, I walked back into the bedroom to find Leslie sitting on my bed. Looking at me, with a weird expression on her face, Leslie said, “Wow, you fill out that bra.”

Up until now, I’d taken her remarks with a grain of salt, figuring she was just being complimentary. But now I was starting to get a little annoyed by what Leslie was saying. “Do you mind if I ask you something, Leslie?”

“Whatever it is, the answer's yes.” Her weird expression turning into a big smile, Leslie perked up and said, “A thousand times yes.”

“That, right there, is what I want to ask you about.” Sitting next to Leslie, I said, “Ever since I woke up, you’ve been acting strange around me. Hell, you were practically drooling over my pictures of the office.”

Her smile turned back into a frown; she probably expected me to have said something else. “Oh right, that.” Composing herself, Leslie said, “Sorry if I made you uncomfortable; it’s just this pregnancy has thrown my hormones completely out of whack. I thought I could handle myself better since my period mood swings weren’t bad, but pregnancy is a whole other ballgame.”

Realizing that I had overreacted a bit, I looked at her and said, “Hey, I’m sorry; I-I just thought...”

“I love my wife, Amelia; she’s the best thing that’s ever happened to me.” Turning serious, Leslie said, “I’d never do anything to hurt her, especially not after the pain I caused my daughter.”

After we both sat in silence for a few minutes, I said, “Shouldn’t we be getting started?” chuckling, I said, “We’ve only got a few days before I leave for LA; not to mention my dinner with my parents tonight.”

Her eyes going wide, Leslie said, “Oh right, I completely forgot about that; guess I had a case of pregnancy brain for a moment.” Standing up, Leslie said, “Follow me into the bathroom; I’ll teach you how to do your hair and makeup.”
11111111131111111.title: Lessons With Leslie

111111111311111111.content:
The first thing Leslie taught me was how to apply my make-up properly. She didn’t think I wanted to look like Mimi from the Drew Carey Show; and, after seeing a picture of her, I agreed with her. To her surprise, I didn’t need much in the way of lessons.

“Forgive me for asking, but wasn’t Kevin one of those manly guys?”

“I, rather he, wasn’t exactly manly; but he wasn’t feminine either.” Gently putting on some mascara, looking at Leslie in the mirror, I said, “Why do you ask?”

“It’s just that you’re already surprisingly good with the make-up.” Looking at me, quizzically, Leslie said, “I was just curious, is all.”

“When Kelsey and I were 10 years old, we both got mono and were stuck at home for a month.” Looking over at Leslie, I said, “She was going through one of those girly phases and wanted to use me to practice with make-up. Being the kind, older brother; I had no choice but to oblige. I got pretty good at doing it myself.”

“Your sister must’ve been a very good teacher because you’re doing better than me when I first changed.”

“I might be insulted by that; if it wasn’t for the fact that I’m a woman now.” Looking at the three choices of lipstick on the counter, I said, “The only thing she didn’t teach me about was lipstick; because Mom wouldn’t let her have any at that age.”

“Can’t say I blame her.” Sitting on the closed toilet, Leslie said, “I was the same way with my daughter when she was growing up. Part of it was because of my conservative upbringing, but I forbade her from wearing anything too revealing and she only wore a small amount of make-up.”

After Leslie gave me the color she thought would go well with my outfit, I said, “If you don’t mind me asking; what was your previous life like?”

“I had your typical southern Catholic upbringing; gays and abortion were evil, that sort of thing. I can only imagine what my folks would think of me now; being in a lesbian relationship with a baby on the way.”

“Considering your upbringing, I assume you were married at some point?”

“Ellen was a lovely woman; a great wife and a loving mother.” Sighing, Leslie said, “If she hadn’t died from cancer, she probably would’ve divorced me because of the way I treated my daughter.”

Seeing that Leslie was starting to get emotional, I said, “If you don’t want to talk about this, you don’t have to.”

“No, it’s alright; it’s good to let it out now and then.” Wiping some stray tears from her eyes, Leslie said, “Of course, being pregnant makes it that much easier to start crying without much notice.”

***************************


After another hour or so, Leslie was satisfied that I knew more than enough. The hardest part was walking in the heels; they’d given me the knowledge to walk in them, but Leslie said I needed to get used to walking in them to get some muscle memory.

I gave myself a quick once over, touching up my make-up and putting my hair into a bun. Walking out of the bathroom, I said, “How do I look?”

“Like a woman after my own heart.” Wincing, Leslie said, “Don’t mind me; it’s the pregnancy hormones.”

As we walked out into the main room, I said, “I suppose it’s time to go meet my parents?”

“Yeah, they texted me a few minutes ago to let me know they were downstairs.” Pausing, Leslie said, “Let’s grab your purse, and then we’ll – oh!”

I suddenly grew concerned as Leslie sat down on the couch. “What is it?” running over to her, I said, “Are you okay?”

Leslie didn’t say anything; instead, she took my hand and held it to her belly. Soon after, I felt a powerful kick from the baby. “Oh my.” I’d always had an interest in pregnant women, nothing perverted mind you. Now I found myself imagining being pregnant myself; which, thanks to the nanites, was possible.

“I thought you might like that.” Slowly getting to her feet, Leslie said, “This little guy drives me crazy sometimes; especially when he uses my bladder as a drum set. But then, when I’m feeling depressed about something, I feel him kick and it reminds me that I’ve got a person growing inside me.”

“It’s a boy, huh?” smiling, I said, “How about that?"

“We’re going to do a better job raising him than my parents did.” Pausing, Leslie said, “Someday, if one of his kids happens to be gay maybe he won’t repeat my mistakes.”

“I’m sure you’ll be a great mother, Leslie.” Smiling, I said, “And I hope I get a chance to meet the little guy someday.”

“Are you kidding?” chuckling, Leslie said, “I’m calling you as soon as I go into labor; I don’t care if you have to get a red-eye flight from LA, I want you here when I have the baby.”

Grabbing a purse that Liz and the others had left for me, I said, “I think we’ve kept my parents waiting long enough, don’t you?”
111111111311111111.title: Lessons & Friendly Chatter

1111111113111111111.content:
I was feeling anxious as the two of us took the elevator down the lobby. Looking at Leslie, I said, “How will we recognize them once we get down there?”

“I know them through their daughter Heather; she’s a former co-worker who set me up with my wife.” Looking straight ahead, with the occasional wince breaking her concentration, Leslie said, “They also have a 14-year-old son they adopted; he went through the program about 5 years ago, shortly before I did.”

“Forgive me; but if they already have two children of their own, why are they pretending to be my parents?”

The elevator stopped briefly on the 6th floor but no one got on. As the doors closed, Leslie said, “My wife and I had dinner with them a few months ago; where they talked about wanting to join the Host program.” Turning to look at me, she said, “They said they wanted to do it in memory of their eldest daughter, Deanna, who died from brain cancer last year.”

I noticed Leslie was tearing up a little; and figured that she must’ve been close to Deanna. “Were the two of you close?”

“I had no family left after what happened with my daughter; and my surviving relatives would probably slam the door in my face if I ever went to visit.” Looking at me, wiping tears from her eyes, Leslie said, “Heather and her family took me in; gave me a home when I had none. When it came time for my wedding, you can probably imagine how hard it was for me to choose between them to be my maid of honor.”

“You mentioned something about them adopting another New Horizons client, what’s he like?”

“Duncan’s an amazing kid, nothing like how he was before he entered the program.” Looking at me, as the elevator finally arrived at the lobby, Leslie said, “It’s not my place to go into detail, but let’s just say he didn’t have the best life before New Horizons.”

As the two of us stepped out in the lobby, I turned to see Leslie wincing again. “Hey, are you alright?”

“I’m fine; it’s just the baby is alternating between kicking my bladder and sitting on my sciatic nerve.” Wincing, Leslie said, “Every time he moves it’s like someone’s jabbing a hot needle in my leg.”

After giving Leslie a moment to let the pain subside, the two of us walked through the lobby towards the restaurant. It wasn’t long before we spotted a middle-aged couple waving at us in front of the restaurant. As the two of us walked over, the woman quickly hugged Leslie and said, “It’s so good to see you, sweetie.” With a smile, she turned her attention to Leslie’s belly and said, “You can’t have that much longer to go; how are you feeling?”

“Two months to go; and I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t counting the days.” Turning to me, Leslie said, “Stan and Joanna Simmons; allow me to introduce Amelia Webber, your daughter.”

******************************


There was a 20-minute wait before we were able to get a table, so the four of us sat at the bar while we waited. We passed the time by getting to know each other; they were polite and didn’t ask a lot of personal questions. But I didn’t want to be impolite so I told them what I was comfortable with.

After we were brought to our table and drinks had been ordered, Joanna dug through her purse and pulled out her phone. While she did something on it, she looked at me and said, “Heather and Duncan wanted to be here, but they’re currently on their annual brother-sister vacation.” Looking at me, she continued, “They go on vacation, just the two of them, every year; this year they’re white-water rafting in Colorado.”

“Leslie didn’t tell me a whole lot about Duncan, but it’s nice to see that he got a second chance.”

Joanna started to tear up briefly, so Stan placed his hand on hers. Turning to me, he said, “I can’t imagine what fate could have befallen Duncan had he not gone to New Horizons.” With a faint smile, he said, “I’m not a religious man, but I thank God every day for bringing Duncan into our lives.”

After she composed herself, Joanna handed me her phone and said, “I have some photos of Heather and Duncan if you feel like looking at them.”

As I scrolled through the photos it became clear that some was an understatement; there had to be over two hundred photos of them on Joanna’s phone. They ranged from Halloween photos to family vacations and what I could only assume was Heather’s college graduation. Handing the phone back to her, I said, “You have a lovely family, Joanna.”

“Thank you, Amelia.” With a smile on her face, she said, “After dinner, I’d love to get a photo with you, so I can show it to your brother and sister.”

Dinner came a short time later; I didn’t want to ruin my new figure so I ordered a chicken salad. Between bites, I turned my attention to Stan and said, “I have to say, Stan; you’re a pleasant change from my first father.” Taking a bigger than normal sip of my wine, I said, “He ran out of my family when I was 8 years old.”

“A man who abandons his family is no man at all.” Looking at me, Stan said, “Amelia, I promise to treat you as though you were my flesh and blood.”

Dinner progressed quickly after that, we alternated between eating and talking. By the time the waitress came around with the dessert menu, I was already referring to them as Mom and Dad. It felt weird to think they were replacing my original family, but it was necessary; after all, I was no longer related to anyone in the Scott family.

After we were finished with dinner, we took the photo that Mom had wanted and they left. Leslie had to leave as well, so I said goodbye to her. As I waited for the elevator to return to my room, I found myself looking forward to seeing them again.
1111111113111111111.title: Meeting the Parents

11111111131111111111.content:
I woke up the next morning to the sound of someone, not too gently, knocking on the hotel room door. Looking at the clock, I saw that it was just after 8:30 AM. “Who could that be?” Throwing the covers off, I was immediately faced with the sight of my naked body.

Suddenly my memory of the night before came back. I’d had a little bit of wine after I came back to the room (which would explain my headache), after which I decided to explore my new body. I guess I got so carried away that I didn’t even get dressed again.

Climbing out of bed, putting on the bathrobe, I slowly walked to the door. Looking through the peephole, I saw Leslie standing there with a bag on her arms. Opening the door, I said, “Leslie, it's 8:30 in the morning. Adding the fact that I’m hungover, I’m not in the mood for more training today.”

“Don’t worry about that, I’m not in the mood to train you today. Sunday is supposed to be a day of rest.” Walking into the room, Leslie said, “I figured we’d take advantage of the amenities here, so I made us a spa appointment for 10:00; then I thought we’d hang out at the pool.”

“That sounds great.” Closing the door, I said, “Do you mind keeping it down a little bit?”

“Sorry, I know what you must be going through.” Peaking in the bedroom, seeing the bed in disarray, Leslie looked back at me. “Looks like you had a little fun last night.”

A memory involving the detachable showerhead flashed in my mind. Turning crimson from embarrassment, I said, “I may have done some exploring last night.”

“No need to be embarrassed, Amelia; you used to be a teenage boy, it’s only natural.” Chuckling, Leslie said, “Hell, I did the same thing my first night. The second night, I went to a gay bar and brought some girl back to my room for a one-night stand.”

Seeing where Leslie was going with that, I shook my head and said, “I’m not even remotely ready to have sex with a guy; I haven’t even been a woman for 24 hours yet.”

“Come on girl, let’s get changed and go to the pool.” Looking at the clock, which said 8:42, Leslie said, “There’s a tankini hanging in the closet for you to wear.”
11111111131111111111.title: The Next Day

111111111311111111111.content:
I’d never heard of a tankini before today, but I already knew that I liked them; the convenience of a two-piece suit with the modesty of a one-piece. I’m sure there’d be occasions where a bikini was appropriate but I figured that I’d generally want to dress sensibly. I’m not going to be one of those girls who always show off their figure to get guys.

I was standing in front of the mirror, getting a good look at myself when there was a knock on the bathroom door. “Come on, Amelia; we don’t want to be late for our spa appointment.”

Spoilsport. With a sigh, I opened the door and said, “Can you blame me for wanting to admire myself in the mirror?” looking at Leslie, I said, “You mean to tell me that you didn’t do the same thing?”

Leslie stood in the doorway, looking me over, for a moment until she said, “You’re right, I shouldn’t hold it against you.” Handing me some clothes, Leslie said, “It’s just, I’ve been under some stress lately; what with the pregnancy and my wife’s schoolwork keeping us from...you know. I could use a day to relax.”

After putting the clothes on over my suit, Leslie and I left the room. As we walked down the hall towards the elevator, I looked at her and said, “Do you always spend this much time with a client?”

“Not normally, no.” looking at me, as she pressed the button, Leslie said, “There’s just something about you that I like.”

Thinking back to when we were designing my new body, I said, “Are you sure it’s got nothing to do with being attracted to me?”

As we stepped into the elevator, Leslie said, “I’ll admit that’s part of it; but mostly it’s because we’ve similar upbringings. We were both raised by single parents; granted, I was raised by a father whose life lessons led to me alienating my daughter.”

Once the elevator reached the lobby, I said, “Sounds to me like you need this more than me.”

As we walked out of the elevator, Leslie nodded and said, “I just wish I could take advantage of more of the spa’s services; but, alas, my pregnancy prevents me from doing that.” With a grin, Leslie said, “Although there’s nothing wrong with a facial and a mani/pedi.”

“I was looking through the list of services before you arrived.” Turning down the hall towards the spa, I said, “I kind of want to try that mud bath; but if last night’s any indication, my body might be too sensitive.”

“The increased sensitivity is only temporary, it’ll wear off by tomorrow.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “You should do the mud bath, I think you’ll enjoy it.”

The two of us walked into the spa; where we saw a guy, about our age, standing behind the counter. If seeing my new female appearance wasn’t enough to make me realize how much had changed, then I definitely realized it when I found myself turned on by the guy. Leaning over to Leslie, whispering in her ear, I said, “He’s cute.”

“You’re right, he is rather easy on the eyes.” With a raised eyebrow, Leslie said, “If I were straight, I’d be all over him.”
111111111311111111111.title: Going to the Spa

1111111113111111111111.content:
I decided to treat myself to a massage after the mud bath; and let me tell you, it was a wise decision. My masseuse was a bona fide miracle worker; if I’d been anything other than straight, I would have proposed to her right then and there.

One shower later, and I was ready to relax by the pool. Heading out to the pool deck, which overlooked the water and had one of those bars that you could swim up to. I picked a lounge chair and stretched out of the soak up the sun; not even bothering to think about where Leslie was.

After a moment, a cabana boy came up to me and said, “May I offer you something from the bar?”

Considering until yesterday I’d been an underage teenage boy, I didn’t have experience in the alcoholic beverage department. Looking over the menu, I said, “What would you recommend?”

“The bartender makes an excellent mojito, ma’am."

I’d heard someone at the restaurant order one of those last night; it looked rather interesting. “Aright then, I’ll try one of those.”

He was back with the drink within minutes; and let me tell you, it was delicious. So delicious, in fact, that I gleefully accepted a second one. I was in a very good mood by time the second one was half gone. So good, in fact, I wanted to share my good time with the cabana boy. As he walked by, with another guests order, I said, “You’ve got a real nice body.” Smiling, I said, “You want to hold it against me?”

In hindsight, I imagine that he got this a lot; but he still played it cool. Looking at me, he said, “I-I beg your pardon?”

Staggering to my feet, I said, “You wanna come back to my room?” grabbing the straps of my tankini, I said, “Or we do it right here, if you want.”
