The conversation remained like that for a short time; as Kelsey caught me up on everything that’s happened since I left. I couldn’t help but think, however, that she was holding something back. I had an idea of what it might be, but I couldn’t prove it until she said: Was that you that I saw parked across the street yesterday morning?

I stared at that message for a moment, taking a sip of my wine while I thought about my response. Taking a deep breath, I reached forward and started typing: Yeah, that was me.

Kelsey didn’t respond for a few moments; likely trying to wrap her head around the fact that I was now a woman. Why did you drive off?

I guess I was nervous; I wasn’t sure how you’d react to the new me.

I always knew there was a possibility that you’d come out of this a woman, but I have to admit, I’m a bit surprised.

I then proceeded to type out a lengthy description of what happened after they dropped me off. I wanted my new life to be different, and being a 26-year-old woman was very different from my old life.

I suppose I shouldn’t fault you for wanting something different. There was a slight pause before another response came through. I didn’t get a very good look at you before you drove off; any chance you could send me a picture?

Every picture I’d taken since yesterday had been uploaded to my computer; so I chose the one of me with the girls from NHI and the one that Malcolm took with me and Caitlin. That last one I sent solely to see how Kelsey would respond. Here are some photos.

After a moment, Kelsey responded. Did you seriously get to meet Malcolm Tucker?

I couldn’t help but chuckle as I wrote my response. That’s right; I bumped into him and Elena Johnson at the airport yesterday. That photo was from earlier today; I was meeting my housemate for lunch and he joined us.

I’m so jealous of you right now. There was another brief pause, followed by another response. You look great in those photos by the way; I can honestly say that’s the first genuine smile I’ve seen you give in a long time. Another pause. I never thought I’d say this about you, but you make an attractive woman.

I looked at the time on my computer and saw that it was almost 3:00; which meant that it was 6:00 for Kelsey. I’m sure Mom’s probably getting dinner ready for you guys; I’ll let you go.

I’ll talk you to later on, Kev...wait, what’s your name now?

Amelia Webber.

I’ll talk to you later, Amelia. Love you.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Chatting with Kelsey

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
About 15 minutes had passed since my conversation with Kelsey. I was still in the sunroom, watching some birds flying around the backyard when I heard my cell phone start to ring. As I reached for it, I saw the caller ID said ‘Mom & Dad.’ With a smile on my face, I answered the call and said, “Hello?”

I was greeted by the cheerful voice of my mother, who said, “Hi sweetie, did I catch you at a bad time?”

I had hoped for a little peace and quiet, but I wasn’t going to tell her that, “No Mom, I’m just relaxing in the sunroom.” Sighing, I said, “I’ve had kind of a stressful day.”

“I thought you sounded a little tense.” Pausing, Mom said, “What’s wrong, honey?”

I felt a smile creep across my face; she may not be my biological mother, but Joanna was certainly treating me like she was. “I nailed my job interview, so my day started out great.” Grabbing my glass of wine, I said, “I met my housemate, Caitlin for lunch; she works over at Paramount. I thought we were making progress towards a friendship, but it turns out she was just using me to further her career.”

I then proceeded to explain everything that’s happened between me and Caitlin since I arrived. That went on for 20 minutes, during which time I would occasionally raise my voice. Once I was finished, Mom said, “While I don’t appreciate anyone treating my daughter like that, I can see where Caitlin is coming from.” Sighing, Mom said, “It sounds like she was quite close to her college roommate; so much so that her faith in people was shattered after she learned of her boyfriend’s infidelity.”

I don’t know why that hadn’t occurred to me until that moment. Now that I saw it from that perspective, I realized that Caitlin’s supposed hostility towards me was just a defense mechanism. “I guess I could give her some space; after all, we did just meet yesterday.” With a chuckle, I said, “I guess I got so caught up in wanting to make new friends, I forgot that some people want to take things slow.”

I heard the front door open at that moment; I turned and caught a glimpse of Caitlin walking down the hall towards the kitchen. I turned my attention back to the phone as Mom started speaking again, “I’m sure you two will become friends in time, just take things slowly.” Pausing, she said, “Before I let you go, sweetie; are you going to be free tomorrow afternoon?”

“I don’t know, I’m still new to Los Angeles so I might want to explore some more.” Getting up from the couch, I said, “Why do you want to know?”

“Your brother and sister are stopping by for your father’s birthday; I figured you’d want to meet them.”

I had a momentary brain cramp until I remembered they were also the ‘parents’ to a teenage boy attending a private school in New York. I suppose it wouldn’t hurt to meet him and my sister. “Sure, why not; I’d love to meet them.”

“Excellent, let’s plan to have a video call around 3:30 your time.” Pausing, Mom said, “I’ll see you tomorrow, sweetie.”

As I walked into the kitchen, I said, “Talk to you later mom, love you.”

Once I ended the call, Caitlin looked at me and said, “I assume that wasn’t Kevin’s mom you were talking with.”

“You’d assume correctly, although I did have a chat with my sister earlier.” Placing my things on the counter, I said, “Look, about what happened at the studio...”

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Welcome Interruption

“Don’t be silly sweetheart, she’ll come around.” Gesturing to Duncan, Mom said, “Besides, your brother has been dying to meet you.”

With that, Mom left Duncan and me alone as she walked off. I got my first good look at him; somewhat muscular with red hair. After a moment, I said, “Have you been dying to meet me, or was that just Mom’s way of making sure I didn’t hang up.”

“No, I have been dying to meet you.” Leaning closer, Duncan said, “It’s not often I get to meet another New Horizons alumni.”

“I imagine Mom and Dad told you some stuff about me.”

“They told me a little; just that you were unhappy in your former life and that your family brought you to New Horizons.” Pausing, Duncan said, “They probably weren’t comfortable telling me a lot of the personal stuff.”

“That’s pretty much the gist of it right there; my former father left when I was 9 years old, I doubt I’d even recognize him if I saw him on the streets.” Sighing, I said, “I was never diagnosed with it but, after I hit puberty, I’m pretty sure I was clinically depressed.”

His boyfriend eventually convinced him to come out to them; believing they would be supportive.

Eventually, it got to be too much, so he OD’d on sleeping pills. “As you can see, my suicide attempt wasn’t successful.” Taking a breath, Duncan said, “I was living in Maryland at the time; the doctor at the ER, after learning my story, told me about New Horizons. I was relieved, however, when I didn’t see the same angry look as before. Taking a deep breath to compose herself, Heather said, “I want to apologize for how I acted earlier; it’s just that this is Dad’s first birthday since Deanna died.” Looking at me, she said, “The two of us were born just over 10 months apart; so we were quite close.”

“The phone call went great; I got a chance to meet my siblings, but that’s not why I’m in a good mood.” No longer able to contain myself, I said, “Rob texted me earlier and asked me on a date.”

Caitlin took one look at me and said, “Let me guess, you agreed to it?”

“Yeah.” The concerned look on Caitlin’s face was enough to put a damper on my mood. Looking at her, I said, “Why? Was that a bad idea?”

“No, it’s fine; Rob seems like a great guy.” Putting her book down, Caitlin said, “It’s just, and forgive me for saying this, you have no experience dating men.”

“It’s not like I had an opportunity to do that in my old life; being a teenage boy after all.” Sighing, I said, “I’ll admit that I’m inexperienced, but what better way to learn than to jump right in?”

“Yeah, that philosophy doesn’t work when it comes to dating.” Taking a breath, Caitlin said, “I’ll help you get ready for the date; if only because I don’t want you to find yourself in over your head.”

While I knew Caitlin and I weren’t at the ‘friends’ stage yet, I was touched that she was still willing to help me. “I’d appreciate any advice you can give me.” Pausing, I said, “This is my first date ever, so I’d like for it to go well.”

Caitlin got up and walked out of the room before returning with a piece of paper in her hands. Handing it to me, she said, “Here’s my number; if you think the date’s going sideways, give me a call and tell me to feed the dog. I’ll come to get you.”

I appreciated the gesture, but I’d be lying if I didn’t think Caitlin was going overboard. Taking the paper, making a note to put the number in my phone, I said, “Do you think it’ll be that bad?”

“Amelia, a guy’s worst case dating scenario is that she turns out to be fat or ugly.” Turning serious, Caitlin said, “The worst-case for women is that I’ll be called to the morgue to identify your body.”

I started to get nervous once I heard that; as all sorts of scenarios started to play out in my mind. Looking at Caitlin, I said, “You don’t think Rob’s the type to do that, do you?”

“He seemed like a genuinely nice guy; despite his poor taste in friends.” Groaning, Caitlin said, “I’m sure you’ll have a great time on the date, but it never hurts to be prepared.”

Now I was thinking about Leslie had said about her first date; and I had no intention of that happening to me. “I suppose I shouldn’t mention New Horizons?”

“Under no circumstances should you mention New Horizons. He seems like a nice guy, but I don’t think Rob would take too kindly to learning the truth about his date.” Taking a breath, looking at me, Caitlin said, “Assuming it goes that far, I’d wait until at least the 3rd or 4th date before you tell him.”

After agreeing to not mention New Horizons, the topic turned to what my outfit would be. Despite their best efforts, New Horizons hadn’t thought of everything; so my clothing options were rather limited. “I should probably go to the mall tomorrow and buy an outfit to wear.”

“Like Ben Franklin once said, ‘Don’t put off until tomorrow what you can do today.’” Getting to her feet, Caitlin wrapped an arm around my waist and said, “Honey, we’re going to the mall.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Downstairs

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once we found a parking spot in the garage, Caitlin and I walked into the mall to find that it was extremely crowded. Stepping over to the railing to get a look at the area, I turned to Caitlin and said, “I guess this explains why the parking garage was so full.”
Looking over a store directory, without turning to face me, Caitlin said, “Don’t tell me kids in New Jersey didn’t hang out at the mall on the weekends.”

“I’m sure they did; but have you forgotten that I didn’t use to be the social type?” following Caitlin towards a nearby escalator, I said, “My weekends were mostly spent playing videos or watching TV.”

As the two of us stepped onto the escalator, Caitlin said, “Going to New Horizons is the best thing that could’ve happened to you.”
“What’s that supposed to mean?”

“Do you need me to spell it out for you?” looking at me, Caitlin said, “You’ve met 2 TV stars, got a job at a major talent agency, and you have a date with a cute guy. That’s all in just the last 3 days.”

I thought about what Caitlin said as we continued down the escalator, and she was right, I’ve come a long way in such a short time. “Plus I can’t ignore the fact that you and I have become friends.”

When I’d mentioned being friends in the past, Caitlin would try to deflect. This time, however, was different. Looking at me, she said, “Okay, you got me; we’re friends.”

As we stepped off the escalator, I said, “See, I knew you’d come around.”

Feigning annoyance, Caitlin groaned and said, “We’re friends, but don’t think that’ll keep me from calling you out if you annoy me or something.”

“Deal.” With a giggle, I said, “So where’s our first stop?”

“First we have to find you the perfect outfit; and that includes the perfect pair of shoes.” Walking towards JcPenny, Caitlin said, “After that’s all done, maybe we’ll see a movie or something.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the Mall

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once inside JcPenny, we made a bee-line for the women’s clothing section; a place I used to dread entering as Kevin, but was looking forward to now. Stopping in front of a display of jeans, Caitlin said, “So you’re going to need three kinds of outfits; depending on what type of date it is.” Looking at me, Caitlin said, “For movie dates, you’ll need short skirts, nothing longer than your knees, and tops that either match or coordinate. If he brings you to a fancy restaurant, you’ll need something more elegant.”

I was beginning to feel overwhelmed, I never knew there was this much involved with picking a date-night outfit. “What about something in between; say a movie and a casual dinner?”

“That’s where the old reliable comes in: the little black dress.” Smiling, Caitlin said, “That ones good for almost any occasion, so you’ll need one in your closet.”

“I already have one, actually; I wore it to a bar in New Jersey.” Half-heartedly examining a pair of pants, I said “But tell me; if they’re good for everything, why not just have a closet full of them?”

“If a little is good then more must be better, huh?” shaking her head, Caitlin said, “Listen if you wore nothing but of LBDs; you’ll either look like you just returned from the walk of shame, or you write a bunch of books about how men should make all the decisions, while women should be barefoot and pregnant.”

I quickly realized how both of those situations would’ve been less than ideal; after all, I didn’t do all this to become a homemaker. Looking at her, feeling suitably chastened, I said, “I am your clay. Mold me."

Caitlin helped me to pick out some outfits before sending me to the dressing room to try them on. New Horizons may not have given me any dating outfits (after all Leslie had to get me the LBD), but they did give me a good eye for style, so I knew which colors went well together and what would look best on me. Once I was dressed, I showed each outfit to Caitlin, turning this way and that.

By the time we got to the dresses, Caitlin was saying, "Give us a turn, honey. Let's see it from every angle."

As I spun around, I looked at her and said, “You’re enjoying this, aren't you?"

“Oh please, you’re enjoying this just as much as me.”

I giggled. It was true, I was enjoying showing off my clothes; for the first time, I understood why Kelsey would do this with Mom. After paying for the clothes we picked out, the two of us started towards the shoe department. We barely walked into the department when someone said, "Caitlin?"

As the two of us turned around, I noticed Caitlin’s expression turn sour as she said, “Fancy meeting you here."

“I...needed some new outfits.” Sighing, the woman said, “I’ve missed you.”
I had no idea who this woman was, but Caitlin wasn’t happy to see her. “Well, the feeling isn't mutual."

Making my presence known, to figure out who this woman was and to prevent a potential incident, I said, “Excuse me, but I feel like I just walked in on a movie that's half over."

“Sorry Amelia, where are my manners.” Sighing, Caitlin said, “Stacy, this is Amelia Webber; my new roommate. Amelia, this is Stacy Buckley, my ex-best friend who was banging my boyfriend behind my back.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Looking for the Perfect Outfit

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was all for meeting new people, but I also wanted to remain loyal to Caitlin. The look on my face must’ve told Stacy that I wasn’t exactly thrilled to meet her. “You can probably tell I’ve heard a few things about you.” Sighing, I said, “Is there anything you feel like adding?”

Stacy was a tad frightened as she looked at me, I suppose I couldn’t blame her; after all, I was a stranger to her. “Not really, I’m sure Caitlin was pretty thorough.” Turning to look at Caitlin, she said, “There’s been a couple of developments since Todd and I moved out.”

“Let’s get one thing straight here, Stacy; you two didn’t move out.” Getting angry, Caitlin said, “I kicked you out, there’s a difference.”

People were starting to gather around and watch the argument unfold. Hoping to keep security from being called, I got between them. Looking at Stacy, I said, “What developments?"

“To start with, I’m pretty sure that Todd is cheating on me.”

Even with my limited experience, I knew enough to figure that once someone cheats once they’ll probably do it again. “You don’t say?”

“Welcome to the club, Stacy; you’ll forgive me if I take the role of club president.” Sighing, Caitlin said, “What with me being the first one he cheated on and all.”

“I thought for sure things would be different, that I’d be able to hang on to him.”

“I’m sorry but what makes you so special?” scoffing, Caitlin said, “I dated him for 3 years; you were only seeing each other behind my back for four months.”

“That leads to my second bit of news.” Taking a deep breath, Stacy said, “I’m pregnant.”

Caitlin and I were both stunned; she was the first to find her voice again. “You're WHAT?"

“Yeah, I’m three months ago; believe me, it caught me by surprise too.” Sighing, Stacy said, “That’s why I need new clothes; I’m too big for my regular outfits but too small for maternity clothes. I even had to switch to wearing flats instead of heels.”

Given the animosity between the two of them, I was surprised by Caitlin’s response. “I’m so sorry you’re in this fix, Stacy.” Hugging her, Caitlin said, “If you need to talk, just give me a call; my number hasn’t changed.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Stacy

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
We didn’t spend much time in the shoe department; the two of us leaving after only finding two pairs that I liked. Caitlin didn’t say a word during the trip home, not even to acknowledge me when I thanked her for the help.

Once we got home, she silently went upstairs to her room. I went about putting everything away from shopping, stopping only to respond to a text from Leslie. Sorry I never got back to you yesterday; the network went down at work. That’s great about the job though, I knew you’d get it.

Caitlin and I had been home for an hour before I got up the courage to check up on her. Walking down the hall, I cautiously knocked on the door. “Caitlin, are you okay?”

After waiting a few seconds for a response, I slowly opened the door and saw Caitlin lying in bed with her back to me. I slowly stepped into the room, stopping only when I heard her say, “Go away, Amelia.”

I briefly considered doing that but decided not to; Caitlin was my friend and I wanted to comfort her. Walking closer to the bed, ever so cautiously, I saw that Caitlin was looking at a well-worn photo album; filled with pictures of what I assumed was her growing up. Sitting on the bed behind her, I looked over and saw that there was another girl in most of the pictures; it took a moment for me to realize it was Stacy.

“I thought you said Stacy was your college roommate?”

Caitlin slowly rolled over to look at me, her face a mixture of anger and sadness. “Did you have a problem with boundaries as Kevin?”

“No, that would have been Kelsey; she would always barge in without knocking.” Looking at her, I said, “You didn’t answer my question.”

Caitlin stared at me for a moment, until she sighed and said, “Stacy and I were college roommates, but we’d also been best friends since we were 6 years old.” Moving the photo album so I could see it, Caitlin said, “The two of us were practically inseparable; which, of course, led to some rumors in High School about us being lesbians.”

I looked at some of the photos on the open page; Caitlin and Stacy in cheerleading outfits, in what I assumed were Homecoming dresses, and a photo on Halloween of them dressed as boys. “Looks like you two had fun together.”

“Stacy didn’t have the best home life; her Mom ran off when she was 9 years old.” Sitting up, Caitlin said, “My family looked after her and her little brother; helping her Dad wherever they could.”

“I suppose this explains why you were so upset about her sleeping with Todd.”

“I would’ve been upset regardless; after all, she was sleeping with my boyfriend.” Looking at me, Caitlin said, “But the fact that it was her made it all that much worse; I mean she was my best friend.”

Seeing that Caitlin was on the verge of tears, I moved closer and hugged her. It wasn’t long before she was crying into my shoulder as I sat there hugging her. Rubbing her back, I said, “Just let it out, it’s alright.”

Caitlin cried for almost 10 minutes until she managed to compose herself. Once she was calmed down, she looked at me and said, “Thanks, I-I needed that.”

“No problem, that’s what friends are for.”

“I hadn’t cried like that since I found out about them.” Sighing, Caitlin said, “I guess seeing Stacy and learning about the pregnancy brought it all back up again.”

“What are you going to do now?” leaning against the back wall, I said, “Have you forgiven her?”

“No, I haven’t forgiven her; I honestly don’t know if that’ll ever happen.” Leaning against the wall next to me, Caitlin said, “For now, I’m just going to reach out and see if there’s anything I can do to help.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I awoke at dawn the next morning to go for a jog around the neighborhood. I figured the mild weather was the perfect opportunity for me to explore. After changing into a decent jogging outfit, I filled my water bottle and left a note on Caitlin’s door.

Once outside, I took a few moments to warm up in the front yard; taking note both of how limber my body was now, as well as looks I was getting from the few people also awake at the time. A few of the guys looking at me were rather attractive, but I stopped short of acknowledging them – after all, I already had a date coming up.

With my earbuds in, and Spotify playing in the background, I started running down the sidewalk. Now Kevin had by no means been out of shape; but now, after 5 minutes of persistent jogging, I realized that I wasn’t even out of breath yet. After another 10 minutes, I came across a small park about a mile from the house. Peaking over the fence, I decided to check it out.

I was jogging along a small pond, completely oblivious to my surroundings, when something tappe my shoulder. After letting out a startled yelp I turned around and saw Elena, wearing a similar outfit to mine, standing a few feet away with an amused look on her face. Once I got over my shock, I pulled out an earbud and walked over to her. As I did, she said, “Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.”

Taking a sip from my water bottle, I said, “I didn’t know you lived around here.”

“What, a big TV star can’t live in the suburbs?” Chuckling, Elena pointed behind me and said, “I live about ½ a mile down the way; you should come by sometime.”

Elena and I went to sit down on a nearby park bench, which gave us both a chance to catch our breath. While that was going on,
I found myself once again wondering why Malcolm and Elena were so interested in spending time with me. It was pretty straightforward with Malcolm; since he found me attractive. But I couldn’t put my finger on it with Elena. “Forgive me, but why would you want to hang out with me? It’s not like I’m some big shot celebrity or anything like that.”

“That’s exactly the reason why I want to hang out with you.” Turning to face me, Elena said, “You’re not some celebrity with an ego the size of Mount Rushmore; you’re just a regular, everyday woman.”

I wondered if Elena’s opinion of me would change if she knew the truth; but, for now, I didn’t bother thinking about that. “You just want a friend who’s down to earth?”

What came next was Elena explaining how, although she loved her job, she was started to get burnt out. “I’ve been on TV, in one way or another, since I was 5 years old.” Looking at me, taking a deep breath, she said, “I never experienced a normal childhood, which is something I’ve always regretted.”

Once I heard that, I briefly considered telling her about New Horizons; until I realized that would require an explanation as to how I knew about them. In the end, however, I placed a hand on her shoulder and said, “If you ever feel like living vicariously through me, then I’m more than willing to help.”

“Thanks, Amelia.” With a smile on her face, Elena said, “That really means a lot.”

Looking down at my watch, I saw that almost an hour had passed since I left the house. “I hate to do this, but I have to get going.” Getting to my feet, I said, “I’ll tell you what; why don’t you come over to my place tonight, you can meet my roommate and we can all hang out.”

“That sounds like an awesome idea.”

The two us parted ways after exchanging phone numbers, and I started my jog back to the house.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Jog In The Park

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Almost as soon as I got back, Caitlin approached me and said, “So I bit the bullet and invited Stacy over to talk. She’ll be here in 20 minutes.”

“Okay,” closing the front door, I said, “I can leave if you feel like talking in private.”

For a moment it looked as though Caitlin was going to take me up on my offer; which I was more than willing to go through with. Instead, looking at me, she said, “No, you can stay.” With a sigh, she said, “Having an impartial third party might be smart.”

Walking past Caitlin towards the stairs, I said, “I can’t guarantee I’ll be impartial, but I’ll do what I can.”

****************************


I was back in my room about 25 minutes later, having just finished taking a shower. As I went to get dressed, I heard a car door close outside followed shortly after by the ringing doorbell. Looking at the clock, I figured it was Stacy; until I heard Caitlin’s voice say, “Todd, what the hell are you doing here?”

The fear in Caitlin’s voice was all I needed to hear as I ran for the door; pulling it open as a man’s voice said, “Where’s Stacy?”

I didn’t care that I was wearing nothing but a towel as I ran down the stairs. My only concern right now was Caitlin. As I rounded the corner into the family room, I saw her holding a lamp in her hands – probably to use in self-defense. “She’s not here, asshole; I kicked you both out, remember?”

From the slurring in Todd’s voice, I quickly figured that he’d either started drinking earlier or hadn’t stopped from the previous night. “Please, you expect me to believe that?” slowly stepping closer, Todd said, “She’s your best friend.”

“She was, until I found out you two were sleeping together.” Raising the lamp, Caitlin said, “Now, once again, get the hell out of my house.”

I decided then and there to get involved, in an attempt to keep things from getting worse. “What’s going on here?”

Both Caitlin and Todd turned to look at me; Caitlin was surprised to see me in nothing but a towel, while Todd focused on my breasts. While I quickly readjusted the towel, Todd said, “Stay outta this, little lady; it doesn’t concern you.”

“That’s where you’re wrong, buddy; Caitlin’s my friend.” Stepping closer, I said, “Now do as she said and get the hell out.”

Caitlin looked at me with fear in her eyes, saying, “Amelia, don’t...”

Before she could even finish her sentence, Todd shoved Caitlin against the wall. That was the straw, as I advanced towards him. He tried to take a swing at me, but he was in no condition to do so. I soon had him on the floor, arm bent behind his back. “That wasn’t smart, asshole.”

Caitlin had recovered enough at that point to call the police. Once she was certain they were on their way, she said, “You can think this over in the drunk tank, Todd.”

The cops came to take Todd away about 10 minutes later; after quickly getting dressed, I gave the police my statement and joined Caitlin on the porch swing. Placing an arm around her, I said, “Are you alright?”

“My backs sore, but I’ll be fine.” Leaning against me, Caitlin said, “Where’d you learn moves like that? From New Horizons?”

“Not exactly; although maybe I’ll suggest you put that in the program.” Sighing, I said, “Actually the woman who helped me design my body; her wife is an Army veteran who does private security on the side. She taught me some moves in case men get a little feisty.”

“Well the next time you talk to her, can you thank her for me?”

I was still pretty wound up; so, when I noticed a car pull into the driveway, I grew concerned. I calmed down, ever so slightly, when I saw Stacy get out of the car. Walking up the sidewalk, she took one look at Caitlin and said, “What happened?”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The police activity had awoken the entire neighborhood, and they were starting to gather around the house. Rather than continue the conversation in public, the three of us went inside. Taking their friendship into account, I stayed back to let Stacy be the one to comfort Caitlin. While the two of them went into the family room, I made my way into the kitchen to give them some privacy.

I was perfectly content with staying there, scrolling through Pinterest, when I heard Caitlin said, “Amelia, could you come in here?”

Pocketing my phone, I got up and walked into the other room. Before I could say anything, Stacy got to her feet and hugged me. “Caitlin told me what happened with Todd; I’m shocked that he’d do something like that. But,” looking at me, she said, “I’m glad you were here to stop him from hurting Caitlin.”

I honestly didn’t know what to do in that moment; I spent most of yesterday afternoon despising Stacy for what she’d done to Caitlin. But now, seeing how upset she was, I realized that she was as much a victim as Caitlin had been. As the two of us sat down, I looked at her and said, “That’s the kind of woman I am; I protect the people I care about.” With a smile, I turned my attention to Caitlin and said, “Even though we only just met, I want you to know that I care about you.”

Moving to sit next to me, Caitlin said, “You may have come on really strong when I first met you; but I’m glad you’re here.”

The three of us embraced on the couch for a few minutes, with no one saying a word so not to ruin the moment. Wiping some tears from her eyes, Caitlin turned towards Stacy and me, “Amelia, I hope you don’t mind; but I was hoping to ask Stacy if she’d like to move back in.” taking Stacy’s hand in hers, Caitlin said, “I don’t care anymore that she slept with Todd; she’s my best friend and I want to support her.”

For a moment I feared that meant I’d have to move out, until I remembered there was an empty room across from mine; that Caitlin said had been used as Todd’s man cave. Once I realized that, I smiled and said, “I’m fine with that; and I promise to help her as well.”

“You don’t have to do that, Amelia; after all, we just met.” Looking at me, Stacy said, “I wouldn’t want to be an imposition.”

“You wouldn’t be; Caitlin said that room’s been empty for months. Besides,” smiling, I said, “It’s not you’ll be asking me to clean up after your all-night porn marathons.”

Stacy chuckled, while Caitlin looked mortified. “Caitlin told you about Todd’s porn habit, huh?”

“Yeah, just a little bit.”

Eventually, after a few more minutes of talking, Stacy went into the bathroom to wash up. As I looked at Caitlin, cleaning up a dozen or so discarded tissues, I had an idea. Getting up to follow her into the kitchen, I said, “Hey Caitlin, is it alright if I invite someone over?” pausing, in a hushed tone so Stacy wouldn’t hear, I said, “I’m still pretty knew to this whole woman thing, so I’m a bit out of my league here.”

After throwing the tissues in the garbage, Caitlin looked at me and said, “Sure, I guess.”

It wasn’t the excited response that I’d hoped for, but it was good enough for me. “Great, just promise me that you guys won’t go crazy when she gets here.”

While I went to retrieve my phone, Caitlin followed me and said, “Oh now I can’t wait to see who it is.”

It didn’t take me long to find Elena’s number in my phone; and considerably less for her to answer. “Hey Amelia, what’s up?”

“Hey; change of plans, do you think you can come over now?” stepping outside the front door, I said, “I’ve got some friends here who could use some girl time, and I’m a little out of my league.”

“Sure, text me the address and I’ll come right over.” Turning serious, Elena said, “Does this situation require wine?”

“Oh yeah, big time.” Sighing, I said, “It’s one of those situations.”
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bringing Stacy Up to Speed

1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Caitlin was upon me before I’d even had a chance to hang up the phone. Looking at me, she said, “So what’s the deal? Is your friend coming over?”

“Yeah, she’ll be here in a few minutes; with wine.” Placing my phone on the counter, I said, “Just promise me you won’t go all fan-girl when you see her; because that was pretty embarrassing to see when you met Malcolm.”

It was clear Caitlin was about to say something else; but instead, she said, “Fine, I promise that I’ll behave.”

Caitlin and I walked back into the family room to find Stacy sitting on the couch. Looking at me, she said, “So who’s this friend you invited over, Amelia?”

I was a little apprehensive about telling her; Stacy was going to find out soon anyway. “It’s Elena Johnson.”

Stacy’s jaw dropped when I said that, “Are you serious right now?” looking at me, she said, “You know Elena Johnson, star of Double Trouble.”

Before I could answer for myself, Caitlin stepped in and said, “Not only that; but she knows Malcolm Tucker as well.” Gesturing to me, Caitlin said, “We ran into him at the commissary and they were totally flirting with each other.”

“Wow; I would’ve slept with Todd earlier had I known it’d lead to this.”

I caught the glare Caitlin was giving Stacy, as she said, “Too soon, Stacy; way too soon.”

“Sorry.” Wincing as she realized her mistake, Stacy said, “Guess I went overboard a little.”

The doorbell rang at that moment; leading me to say, “Just promise you guys won’t go crazy when you meet her, alright?”

Once they both nodded in agreement, I went to the door. Upon opening it, I saw Elena standing there holding three unopened bottles of wine. She barely had time to hand me the wine before, to my annoyance, Caitlin and Stacy ran up and pulled her through the front door.
1111111113111111111111111111111111111111.title: Elena Arrives

111111111311111112.content:
"So, what's next?" I asked, after I finally figured out how to do my hair and makeup. "Shall we check out the spa in this hotel?"

"There'll be time enough for that tomorrow," Leslie said. "You don't need to get the works done to see your parents. I just thought we'd - oh!"

"What is it? Are you okay?"

In reply, Leslie took my hand and held it to her belly. The baby kicked.

"Oh, my," I said. I'd always been interested in pregnant women, but it meant more to me now, since it could happen to me now.

"I thought you might like that," Leslie said. "This little guy drives me crazy sometimes, but he makes up for it."

"It's a boy, huh? How about that?"

"We're going to raise him better than I was, so he won't repeat my mistakes."

"I wish you well. You were saying before?"

"Oh, yeah. I thought I'd keep you loose with your next lesson in womanhood: the chick flick."

So we watched a couple of movies. Back when I was Kevin, I would have turned up my nose at these movies, since they didn't have nearly enough explosions to keep me interested. Now, though, I responded to the emotions presented on the screen. I was glad I wasn't wearing heavy makeup, or my tears would've meant a total disaster.
111111111311111112.title: Later On (After the lessons)

111111111311112.content:
I found myself walking through the mall with Kyle and David; stopping outside of a clothing store. After checking through the racks, I found a shirt that I liked.

Coming up next to me, Kyle said, “You should go try that on.”

I didn’t see the harm, so I walked into the changing area. Once I had the shirt on, I realized that it was incredibly uncomfortable. Wondering why it was so tight around my chest, I looked down and saw a pair of breasts underneath the shirt. Where did these come from?

Opening the changing room door, I was surprised to find that I was no longer inside a mall clothing store; instead, I was in front of a changing cabana on what looked to be a tropical beach. Looking down, I saw that my shirt and shorts had been replaced with the bottom half of a bikini and body paint on my breasts.

There was a flurry of activity around me the moment I stepped onto the sand; as two guys rushed me down the beach to the water. I looked around and found a large number of people with equipment nearby; with a man behind a camera looking at me. “Just walk in the surf; I’ll take care of the rest.”

I did just that; with men keeping me lit with reflectors as the photographer took photos. This doesn't seem much like the life of
a Hollywood agent.

“You’re beautiful, Sienna; if SI doesn’t put on the cover, they’re just pissing money away.” Looking at me, the photographer said, “This could be the highest-selling swimsuit issue in history!”
111111111311112.title: A Puzzling Dream

1111111113111121.content:

“Liz and I will be right there.” Heading towards the door, Miranda turned to Leslie and said, “Get Amelia dressed and bring her to the conference room.”

11111111131111211111.title: Continue

Looking over at the clock on my nightstand, Amelia said, “My flight to LA doesn’t leave for a few more hours; there’s nothing stopping us from spending some more time together.”

111111111311112111111111.title: Settling into My New Life

“I’m glad to hear you’re good; because Amelia was concerned about you.”

My heart skipped a beat at the mention of Amelia’s name, “Y-You heard from Amelia?”

“Yeah, she called me during one of her layovers; told me everything and asked that I check up on you.” Her tone changing, Leslie said, “So how are you really doing?”

It took a moment to think of an answer to that question. “I’m miserable, Leslie.” On the verge of tears, I said, “I’ve tried to remind myself that nothing could ever really happen between us; but that didn’t stop me from falling hard for Amelia.”

“She told me about the conversation you guys had this morning.” After a brief pause, Leslie continued, “If you need someone to talk to, I can come over after work.”

Looking at the clock, I saw that I had just over an hour to get ready, “I appreciate the offer; but I’ve already got plans tonight.”

“Oh really?” chuckling, Leslie said, “You got a hot date or something?”

“No, I assure you it’s nothing like that.” With a weak chuckle, I said, “It’s this guy I met at the pool; he’s taking me out to dinner.”

“Didn’t you tell him you were a lesbian?”

“Yeah, right after he asked me out.” Lying back on the bed, I said, “But he seems like a sweet guy, and it wouldn’t hurt to make some friends.”

“Well I hope you have fun; if anything, it might help get your mind off Amelia.”

“That’s pretty much the plan.” Getting up from the bed, I said, “I’ve got to start getting ready, so I’ll talk to you later.”
1111111113111121111111111.title: Back In the Roon

11111111131111211111111111.content:
I took one last look at myself in the mirror before walking out the door; admiring how my dress accentuated my figure and how nice my heels made my legs look. Checking my hair and makeup one more time, I found myself wondering why I was even going to this much effort, it’s not like this evening will lead to something else.

But as I stepped out of my condo, I realized my choice of outfit had something to do with my chosen profession – the desire to look glamorous regardless of the situation. As I started towards the elevator, I wondered how Kelsey and my friends would react if they saw me like this. They’d probably have a tough time believing that I used to be their friend and brother.

I made a mental note to reach out to Kelsey once I was settled in, to let her know that I was alright. While waiting for the elevator, I decided to hold off on telling her everything – I’d save for later the fact that I was a lesbian model.

The elevator came and took me down to the lobby; I stepped out to find David waiting for me nearby. He stood up as I approached him, saying, “Wow, you look amazing.”

Looking at David, I saw he was dressed semi-formally; I was overdressed compared to him, “Thanks, you look pretty good yourself.” As we started walking out of the building, I said, “So what’s on our schedule for this evening?”

“I was thinking we could try this new Italian restaurant in the Village.” Opening the door for me, he said, “How does that sound?”

“I’m sure whatever you decide will be lovely.” Walking out the door, I said, “I’m just looking forward to an evening where I don’t have to wonder if there’ll be a second date.”

Leading me down the steps towards a waiting cab, David said, “For what its worth, if I were a lesbian, we’d definitely be having a second date.”
11111111131111211111111111.title: Meeting David for Dinner

111111111311112111111111111.content:
I realized David’s rave review of the restaurant was correct the moment we walked inside the door; there was a long line of people waiting to get tables. I waited at the bar while David waited in line for a table. I was nursing a Bud Light when he took a seat next to me, “It’s going to be at least an hour before we can get a table.”

I could tell by his tone that David was subtly asking if that was okay with me, “That’s fine with me; more time to work up an appetite.”
After giving his order to a hostess, David looked at me and said, “So Sienna, why don’t you tell me a little about yourself.”

“There’s not a whole lot to tell, really; I’m the youngest of three girls and I’m an aspiring model.”

David’s jaw dropped as he looked at me, “Damn, now it really sucks that you’re a lesbian.”

“For you, maybe; but definitely not for me.” Taking a sip of my beer, I said, “Getting paid to be around scantly clad women at photo shoots is a dream come true.”

The hostess returned at that moment with David’s beer; as he tipped her, he said, “Have you been in any magazines that I’d know about?”

“I’m afraid not; I’m still new to the modeling world.” Starting to feel the affects of the beer, I said, “I got my first professional shoot in a few days.”

Focusing on me, David said, “I wonder how my High School bullies would feel, if they knew I was having dinner with an attractive model.”

My heart went out to David upon hearing he’d been bullied; I’d only know him for a little while, but I could tell he was a nice guy. He could probably stand to lose a few pounds, but he wasn’t unattractive. “Why don’t you tell me a little about yourself, David?”

“There’s not much to tell, really; I’m an accountant for Citi.” Taking a big sip of his beer, David said, “Until recently I’d been seeing this girl for 3 years, until I found out she was cheating on me.”

Upon hearing that, I couldn’t help but think of Amelia, “I can sympathize with that; I, uh, just recently parted ways with someone very special to me.”

“Oh,” looking at me, David said, “How long were the two of together?”

The more I thought about it, the more I regretted bringing Amelia into the conversation; having her leave after a one-night stand was nothing compared to David’s experience. “We weren’t a couple in the traditional sense; but she knew me better than anyone.”

*****************************


After almost 90 minutes without a table, David and I decided to cut our losses. We ordered sandwiches and found a bench overlooking the fountain at Washington Square Park. By the end of the evening, it was as though David and I were old friends.

We took a cab back to our building, where David graciously walked me to my room. While fumbling with my keys, I turned to David and said, “Would you like to come in?”

Looking at me, David said, “Are you sure?”

Opening the door, I took a step inside and turned back to look at David, “Look, I’ll be honest; I’m feeling pretty lonely right now and wouldn’t mind having someone to wake up to.”

I could tell that David was hesitant; and I couldn’t blame him. After a moment, he smiled and said, “If it’s what you really want, then I’ll stay.”

Once the two of us were inside, I closed the door and kicked off my heels. Taking David’s hand in mine, I led him upstairs to my bedroom. Let’s just say, although David wasn’t enough to convert to my heterosexuality; he was definitely good enough to scratch that particular itch.
111111111311112111111111111.title: Spending Time with David

1111111113111121111111111111.content:
I was up bright and early the next morning, but not by choice. David failed to mention that he snored in his sleep, so I didn't get much sleep during the night.

But I didn't let that ruin what was an otherwise pleasant evening; while I knew it wasn't going to become a recurring thing, I appreciated David's willingness to help me out.

As I climbed out of bed, I wondered how Kevin's friends and family would respond if they knew I'd had sex with 2 different people in less than 36 hours.

I silently walked across the room towards the bathroom; because I wasn't a fan of how sweaty I felt.

**************


Stepping back into the bedroom after the shower, I saw that David was awake and looking at his phone. Sensing I was in the room, he looked at me and said, "For a moment I thought perhaps you left during the night; until I remembered this was your place.'

Adjusting the towel as I sat on the bed, I said, "I want to thank you for last night; it really helped to get my mind of everything that's been going on lately."

Sitting up next to me, David said, "I imagine this will be just a one time thing?"

"You'd be correct." Chuckling, I said, "I'd be like the world's worst lesbian if I regularly had sex with a guy."

"For what its worth, the girl who left you is a fool." Looking at me, with a sincere tone to his voice, David said, "If I were a lesbian, I'd never leave a girl like you."

"Thanks, that means a lot." Caressing his hand, I said, "If I were straight, you'd be just the type of guy I'd be into."

Getting up from the bed, David said, "I should probably get going; I have to be at work in an hour." Turning to face me, he said, "I'll leave my number for you, in case you ever want to talk or hangout."

Watching as he went towards the bathroom, I said, "Thanks David."
1111111113111121111111111111.title: The Next Morning

11111111131111211111111111111.content:
The fact that it was supposed to rain all day meant that I was limited in what I could do today. I’d been to NYC a few times as Kevin, so I knew I wasn’t missing much in terms of touristy stuff. With my photo shoot scheduled for tomorrow morning, I decided it was best to just stay in the condo and relax for the day.

After getting dressed and helping myself to a healthy breakfast, I grabbed my laptop and went out on my enclosed porch. Booting up the laptop, I quickly got a notification telling me that I had several emails. Hoping to find one from Amelia, I was disappointed when all I saw were emails from Leslie and some woman who identified herself as my agent.

Ignoring the latter for a moment, I opened the email from Leslie; briefly surprised to see that it appeared to be business related rather than personal.

Hello Ms. Grayson,

In all the chaos of the last few days, we neglected to inform you of the secure site you could use to communicate with loved ones from your former life. I’ve included the secure address along with a username and password.

Take Care,
Leslie

Looking at the information on the screen, I wasn’t entirely sure I wanted to contact Kelsey and my mom – at least not yet. I wanted to get a better understanding of who I was before letting them back into my life. So, after saving the information on my desktop, I opened the email from my agent:

Dear Ms. Grayson,

My name is Erica Rodriquez with Brady Talent. Normally I like to meet with a prospective client before taking them on, but you came highly recommended by my boss. You’re no doubt already aware of tomorrow’s photo shoot; but I would like you to arrive 30 minutes early so we can meet in-person.

Yours Truly,
Erica Rodriquez

I already knew I had to be at the shoot for 9:00, so it wasn’t too much of an inconvenience for me to arrive there for 8:30. After making note of that on my calendar, and responding to the email, I closed my laptop and watched the weather outside.
11111111131111211111111111111.title: A Short Time Later

1111111114.content:
I gave my decision some serious thought; after all, this was a life-altering decision I was making. After a few moments, with a nervous smile, I said, “I think I’ll go with Option 4; the older male.”

I had briefly considered the other options but couldn’t imagine myself in any of those situations. I couldn’t imagine being a 5-year-old girl; solely because I didn’t want to grow up again. Then there was the concern that I’d hate that life and it would’ve been for naught. I’d already been a 13-year-old boy; hell, that was the reason I was doing this. Even if I changed my gender and became a 13-year-old girl, what was keeping that life from the same as my old life? I didn’t want to be a 26-year-old woman; I remembered my mom telling me stories about her 20s and that didn’t appeal to me.

So that left only the older man and the older woman. I remembered what Duncan had told me, and thought about how happy he seemed as Helen, but that life wasn’t for me. I didn’t want to give up 40 years of my life. With no other choices, I settled on the man. Once I made that decision, I promised myself that I was going to be a better man then my father had been. I wasn’t going to follow in his footsteps and run out on his family. I was going to be a loving father, one who’d be there for his kids; even if that meant building that family myself.

“Are you sure, Kevin?” Dr. Willard must’ve sensed my anxiety. “Once you go through with the procedure, there’s no going back.”

I knew in my heart that I had made the right decision. “I’m sure, Doctor.”

“Well then, I suppose congratulations are in order; you’ve just made one of the biggest decisions of your life.” As she jotted something in my file, she looked at me and said, “Forgive me, but you don't look as happy as I thought."

“Trust me, Dr. Willard, I’m happy.” Sighing, I said, “I’m just very nervous.”

“That’s not surprising; after all, you’ve got a whole new life ahead of you.” Looking at me, kindly, Dr. Willard said, “Normally I’d take you directly to one of our Life Designers, but I believe they’re all at lunch; so I’ll take you to the waiting room instead.”

After she grabbed the file, I followed Dr. Willard out of the room; going down an unfamiliar hallway. “Forgive me, Dr. Willard; but aren’t we going the wrong way?”

“You were in our intake waiting room before; since you’re in the process of becoming a new person, we’ve got a private waiting room down the hall for people like you.” Looking at me, she said, “This way if someone doesn’t meet our standards, we won’t expose them to people who did.”

As we arrived outside a door that said VIP Waiting, I said, “I guess that makes sense, wouldn’t want someone knowing something they shouldn’t.”

“Exactly.” Opening the door, Dr. Willard said, “I’ll leave you here, Kevin; I wish you luck and hope you find happiness.”

I walked inside the waiting room, which was not as spartan as the other one, and took a seat. Several other people were waiting as well; including a middle-aged woman, a boy about my age, and an elderly man. Every one of us was nervous, but we were anxiously awaiting the start of our new lives.
1111111114.title: Be A Better Man Then Your Father

11111111141.content:
A few minutes passed before the door opened and Life Designers came to get the others. It wasn’t long before I was the only one left in the empty room. Spotting a mirror nearby, reflecting sunlight directly into my eyes, Getting up, I walked over and found myself looking at my reflection – one that had been my constant companion for 14 years. It dawned on me that I was about to give it up for a new one.

I didn’t realize there was someone else in the room until I heard a voice behind me. “You saying your goodbyes, Mr. Scott?”

“I, uh...” turning around, I saw a pregnant young woman standing in the doorway. I recognize her as one of the women I’d seen earlier. “Call me...uh Kevin. I was just... uh"

“There’s nothing to worry about, Mr...sorry, Kevin; that’s what its there for. My name’s Leslie Cummings, I’ll be your Life
Designer.” Stepping to the side, she said, “If you’ll follow me, we’ll get to work designing your new life.”

I followed Leslie out of the room and down the hall; entering a large office space with six desks evenly spaced, although only three of them were currently being used. Leslie led me to a desk in the corner; I took a seat as she slowly settled into her chair. “What’s going to happen now, Ms. Cummings?”

“Please, call me Leslie.” Moving her keyboard over, Leslie said, “This is where we work on designing your new life. Have you given any thought to what you want it to be like?”

“No, not really.” Pausing, I said, “To be honest, I’m only here because my mom and sister thought I needed to do this.”

“Okay then, we’ll start at the beginning.” Tapping a pen against her lips, Leslie said, “What would you like your name to be?”

“A name?”

“First and last, please.” Looking at me, she said, “You could keep Kevin, but I recommend against it; it’ll make the adjustment easier."

I thought about that for a few moments, until my thoughts drifted to my old friends. I finally decided on a way to honor them both; looking at Leslie, I said, “Call me David Williams.”

“It’s nice to meet you, David.”

****************************


I spent the better part of the next hour answering all of Leslie’s questions; from hair color to skin color. I eventually settled on being light-skinned with dark brown hair and an athletic build. I didn’t have to worry about gaining weight or anything, thanks to Leslie making some tweaks to give me an excellent metabolism into my old age.

The questions were pretty straight forward until Leslie came to one that I couldn’t answer. Looking at me, all serious, she said, “Penile size?”

Choking slightly, I said, “Ex-Excuse me?”

“There’s no need to blush, we’re both adults here. How well endowed would you like to be, David?” looking at me, she said, “If it helps, I used to be quite well endowed myself.”

Given the nature of this company, I shouldn’t have been surprised when I heard that. But I was. “You used to be a man? What happened?”

“I was a widower in my mid-40s; one day my daughter came out to me and well, I didn’t take it very well. I ended up alienating her and my family.” Sighing, Leslie said, “Eventually I found myself at NHI clinic in Alabama; where I decided that I wanted to have a life like my little girl. So that’s how I became a 22-year-old lesbian; my wife and I have been married for 3 years and, as you’ve probably noticed, I’m currently expecting.”

“All this time I thought people came here only because they were unhappy with their lives.” Looking at Leslie, I said, “Was such a drastic change worth it?”

“Don’t get me wrong, I loved my daughter’s mother very much; but Grace, I’m fairly certain she’s my soulmate.” Leaning back, Leslie said, “As for my daughter; I’ve gained a deeper understanding of her, and even see her once a week at my Lamaze class – even if she doesn’t know it’s me.”

After that, we went back to the questions; eventually settling on a straight male with average-sized junk. I couldn’t help but laugh when Leslie said girls will be all over me looking at the way I was about to. “If you say so, Leslie.”

“Hey, I was a guy for 43 years; I know what the ladies like.” Turning her monitor towards me, Leslie said, “Do you want to see the new you, David?”

Before me on the screen was a very handsome and athletic-looking man. Looking at Leslie, I said, “I know we decided on 37, but could you make me 39 instead?”

“Sure, but why?”

“Well I used my friends to come up with my name, and my sister gave me some photos to remember her; the only other person in my life was my mom and she’s 39.”

Leslie made the adjustment and the image on the screen shivered and adjusted slightly matching the new age. Once that was done, she said, “Now it’s time to choose your career. What do you have in mind?”

“Leslie, I’d like to be...”
11111111141.title: A Life Designer comes to pick you up

111111111411.content:
After thinking it over, I said, “I’d like to be an architect, Leslie; I want to build and constructive.” smiling, I said, “I want to help people who are looking to start something new.”

With a chuckle, Leslie said, “Sounds a lot like a Life Designer to me.”

“I guess you’re right; although that’s not what I had in mind.” Chuckling, I said, “I was thinking more homes and businesses.”

“Oh well, I tried my best; architect it is.” Looking at her screen, Leslie said, “Now to figure out where to get the degree from.
Oh I know, I haven’t used MIT in a while.”

I looked at her, surprised. “Wait, you can just give me a degree from any college?"

“Not exactly, there are schools all over the country that we’re affiliated with; MIT is one of them.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “You’ll get an actual degree from them; although with MIT they usually ask that you be in the Alumni Association for the first 5 years.”

“That sounds great to me, but I don’t know if I’m smart enough to have gone to MIT or be an architect.”

“Don’t worry, we give you all the necessary skills needed to succeed in your new life.” Pausing, Leslie said, “For me, it was things like feminine hygiene and learning how to dress; but for you, we’ll give you what you need to understand building codes and math skills to make things work.”

“What about job placement?” feeling a tad nervous, I said, “Do I get a job as well, or do I have to find one on my own?”

Checking her computer, Leslie said, “It seems you’re in luck, David; we’ve got an opportunity in Chicago that will work well for you.”

“Oh?”

“Given your age, it’s a bit harder to find jobs with a firm; they typically hire "new" architects.” Looking at me, she continued, “You’re 39 years old, so that means you’re just entering your prime earning years. If you’re willing, we can set you up with your firm in Chicago; with strings attached of course.”

“What kind of strings?

“New Horizon has been looking to expand to the mid-west for a few years; if you accept, we’ll hire your firm to design and build our Chicago-based clinic.” Smiling, she said, “It’s a win-win; you’ll gain a footing in Chicago and New Horizon will be in a position to serve the Chicago market. We’d also like to be able to place new workers at your firm; younger architects, interns, Secretary or Office temp workers.”

“What are my other options?”

“The same situation; but we’d place you in another city.”
111111111411.title: An Architect

1111111114111.content:
“Let me get this straight; if I move to Chicago, I get a new life, my very own architectural firm and all I have to do is design a new building for your company?”

“That and take employees when we need you too.”

It was a no-brainer; I’d be a fool not to take it. With a sense of finality, I said, “I’ll do it.”

“Just let me save everything and then I’ll take you to Transfigurations; where, Mr. David Williams, you’ll become a new man.”
Getting up, she said, “Shall we?”

********************************


We walked into a room down the hall where I saw a young woman with pink hair sitting behind a desk. ”Dr. Weintraub, let me introduce David Williams; he’s your next patient.”

Getting up to shake my hand, Dr. Weintraub said, “It’s a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Williams; I’m Liz.”

After saying goodbye to me, Leslie turned to Dr. Weintraub and said, “I’ll leave David in your capable hands, Liz.” Pausing, she said, “Before I forget, I’m planning a surprise for Grace and I’d love your input; could you stop by later?”

Once Leslie left the room, Dr. Weintraub looked at me and said, “So Mr. Williams, or do you prefer David?"

“David’s fine, so long as I can call you Liz.”

“That’s fair, David it is then.” Smiling, Liz said, “Did Leslie tell you about our process here in Transfiguration?

“I grew up reading Harry Potter, so I figured this is where I’ll be transformed; but no, Leslie didn’t mention anything."

“Short and sweet it is then.” Leading me over to a chair, Liz said, “I’ll plug this drive into the computer; it’ll program the nanites. While that’s happening, I’ll set you up with an IV that will give you both a sedative and the nanites.”

“Is this where I’ll get those skills that Leslie mentioned?”

“Of course; we’ll give you everything you’ll need to succeed as a 39-year-old man.” As I sat in the chair, she said, “Before we begin is there anything you need to do as Kevin Scott? Do you need to make any phone calls; or is there anything that you want to keep? Whatever you don’t want will be sent back to Kevin’s family.”

I remembered the envelope that Kelsey had given me. Pulling it from my pocket, I said, “This has pictures of me and my twin sister; I’d like to hold onto them.”

A few minutes later, after changing into a hospital gown, I was in the chair with an IV in my arm. After I gave the signal that I was ready, Liz pressed a button. “When you wake up you’ll officially be Mr. David Williams.”

********************************


I dreamt that I was back home watching a movie with Kelsey, Kyle, and David; some cheesy blockbuster that I wasn’t entirely interested in. Suddenly Mom walked into the room and asked, “Why don't we watch a family movie.”

My voice a little deeper, I said, “Sure thing.” Turning around, I saw that Kyle and David were gone; only Kelsey remained. She over to me with a movie in her hands, “What about this one, Dad?”

Before I could answer, Kelsey, disappeared; leaving me alone with my mom…I mean, Abigail. I sensed that I was closer to her age now; and I knew that she wasn’t my mother anymore. Suddenly, as the others had before, she disappeared.

New memories began to appear; thankfully they weren’t overriding my old memories. I saw myself as a kid, albeit with darker hair, building a sandcastle. Then I was a teenager making a shed; followed by my first kiss at a local movie theater. After that memories came in rapid succession; high school, college, my first solo project.

I woke up in a hospital bed, with Liz standing nearby. Seeing me, she said, “Morning sunshine; or should I say Happy Birthday?”

I smiled, feeling the five o'clock shadow on my face; with a hand, I brushed the stubble, grinning at the idea that I could now grow a beard if I wanted to.

“How long was I out?’

“About 6 hours; the older you become, the longer you’re unconscious.” Grabbing a nearby bag, she said, “I’ve got some clothes for you; once you’re dressed, we’ll get you discharged and you will be on your way, Mr. Williams."

I got dressed fairly quickly; feeling oddly cold. I threw on a pair of khakis and dress socks; along with a blue dress shirt. Once that was finished, Liz led me out of the room and down the hall. I saw Dr. Harris approaching and walked up to her. Shaking her hand, I said, “Thank you so much, Dr. Harris.”

“You’re most welcome, Mr. William; after all, we’ve needed a Chicago branch for a while now.”

“That reminds me, when do I leave for Chicago?”

“We’ve got you a flight ______.
1111111114111.title: Going to Chicago

11111111141111.content:
“We’ve got you on a flight this weekend; in the meantime, we got you a room at a 4-star hotel near the airport. Everything will be covered by us, so feel free to make use of the amenities.” Smiling, Dr. Harris said, “We have transportation coming to take you there, and the hotel has an airport shuttle.”

Dr. Harris walked off a few minutes later; as a young woman, in her late teens, walked into the lobby. Liz led me down the hall to the waiting room where I’d seen Helen. As I took a seat, fidgeting ever so slightly, I thought about Helen and hoped she got to see her sister off. I had the room to myself until the young girl from earlier entered.

She didn’t say anything as she took a seat; I couldn’t help but wonder what led her to come here. Looking at me, she said, “Are you looking to start over as well?”

“No, I’ve already started my new life; I’m just waiting for my ride to the hotel.”

“Oh.”

“I’m David, by the way.” Smiling, I said, “It’s nice to meet you Miss uh...."

“Berkhart.” Regaining some composure, she said, “I'm Katrina Berkhart.”

"It's nice to meet you Miss Berkart."

“Does it hurt?” looking at me, nervously, she said, “I mean the transformation and all that.”

“It only hurts if you’re leaving loved ones behind, but physically you feel no pain.”

Katrina appeared to brighten a bit as a man appeared in the doorway; likely relieved that it was going to be painless. Looking at me, the man said, “Mr. Williams, I’ll be your driver for the evening.”

Getting up, I turned to Katrina and said, “I hope you find happiness, Ms. Berkhart.”

******************************


After driving across town, I found myself in the lobby of a resort I’d only glimpsed in passing. Walking up to the counter, I said, “Hello, I’m David Williams; I believe I have a reservation.”

“Yes sir, Mr. Williams; we’ve been expecting you.” Looking up from his computer, after typing my name in, he said, “I’ve got you in room 626; one of our deluxe suites, I trust that will be acceptable?”

I smiled as I realized this was the first time I’d checked into a hotel on my own; until today I hadn’t been old enough to do it. “That will be just fine, thank you.”

Handing me a small envelope, the man said, “Here’s your key; you’ll find our bar on the top floor and the pool down the hall.” Smiling, he said, “There are several restaurants in the shopping mall across the street; along with a movie theater. I hope you enjoy your stay, Mr. Williams.”

After thanking the man, I walked through the hotel to check out some of the amenities before heading to my room. I waited for the elevator for 10 minutes before deciding to take the stairs. By the time I reached the 4th floor, I was winded, and by the 6th I was struggling for air. I may have been fit and athletic but I was still 39 years old.

My room was quite large; consisting of a king-size bed, a hot tub, and a shower; along with a balcony and a full kitchen. I was about to take a seat on the couch when there was a knock at the door. Walking over, I saw a bellhop standing there with a package. “This was just delivered for you, sir.”

After giving the bellhop a small tip, I closed the door and carried the package into the living room. Opening the box, I saw a letter inside:

Dear Mr. Williams,

We trust that you’ll enjoy your accommodations. Inside this package, we have put three sets of clothes of varying formality, a swimsuit along with a Cubs & White Sox hats. We apologize there is no business suit, but there will be one at your home in Chicago.

We hope you’ll remain in contact with us; as we enjoy making new friends. Many of the girls go to the movies on Thursdays; you’re more than welcome to join us but we’ll understand if you don’t want to be seen with several gorgeous young women.

Please take care, Love, from everyone.
NH

I couldn’t help but laugh at the note; a guy my age might look out of place hanging out with those young women. After taking a short nap, followed a refreshing shower, I decided to get a good look at my new body. For the first time in my life, I was proud of the man I saw in the mirror - a feeling that hadn't existed several hours ago.

It was still early in the evening, so I wondered what I was going to do next – I certainly didn’t want to spend my evening in the room.
11111111141111.title: A Few Days at a Resort

111111111411112.content:
I quickly threw on my swimsuit and walked down the hall to the elevator; having no intent to use the stairs again.

I got to the elevator just as it opened; and a woman in her mid-30s stepped out, with long blonde curls and a dress that left nothing to the imagination. My mouth was wide open; never before had I found a woman like her to be attractive. Sure she was pretty but when I'd been Kevin, I would have found her too old and my eyes would have been focused on her average top half. Now I was thinking solely about wife material. She saw me staring at her and smiled as she walked past.

I couldn’t stop thinking about her as I rode the elevator down the pool. This was the first time I’d been attracted to an older woman that wasn’t a celebrity or a porn star. As the elevator reached the bottom floor, I got out and made my way to the pool area. What I saw there was pure chaos; kids running around and making noise, teens wishing they were somewhere else, and a hot tub filled with parents lamenting the fact they’d had kids.

To them it was chaos, but this was everything I’d ever wanted; a chance to have a family of my own. I took a seat near the far corner, only to have a small girl of around 9-years-old accidentally fall into my lap. She looked at me apologetically; so I said, “It’s alright.” I wanted to say more, but a woman who I assumed was her mother was staring daggers at me.

After spending a few minutes in the pool, I decided to give up; it was too loud and crowded for me. Disappointed I climbed out of the pool, put my shirt on, and walked back to my room.
111111111411112.title: To the Pool

choices: Go to the Movies with the girls
1111111114111122.content:
I gave up on going out and exploring as I changed out of my swimsuit. It was getting late and my day had been unforgettably busy. I ordered take-out Chinese food and had it delivered to my room. Soon after finishing my meal I fell asleep to the drone of television.

Waking up with the sun was a novel experience. As Kevin, I had tried to sleep as long as possible, but as soon as the sunlight reached my window I stirred. Groggy I got up and took a shower. Once cleaned up and dressed I still couldn't shake the grogginess from my head, and a growl from my stomach told me I was hungry. I peered into the rooms mini-fridge at the take-out food, but my stomach wouldn't accept it. It was then that I realized how early it was. The hotel would have breakfast.

The breakfast room was on the main floor off the lobby. As I exited the elevator the smell of coffee cleared my head. My stomach growled again as if saying "that is what we want". I gathered a full plate breakfast food and a cup of coffee and found a small table in the corner of the room. I watched older couples sit and slowly gnawed on their breakfast, while business men rushed in grabbing a piece of toast and quickly returned to the lobby. Occasionally I got up to refill my coffee cup, and with each cup began to feel more awake. I found a newspaper on one of the tables and became engrossed in the business section, especially with an article on building trends in the mid--west.


Later on I returned to my room. I spotted the note that I had been sent when New Horizon had sent me clothes. The Idea of meeting with several beautiful women for a few hours sounded like fun. I did however a few hours to kill before they would be off work.

To kill time I found the hotel gym. It was a relatively small room, set back behind the pool area. Three treadmills, an arm hoist and a squat rack was about it for machines, though several free weight racks lined the walls. Seeing the room empty, I stepped on to a treadmill. I had never been into fitness before but after trying the treadmill, I couldn't think of why I ever didn’t like fitness. I ran for miles with no problem. After seeing the five mile mark hit I really began to appreciate how fit my new life was. I would have been heaving for air after a mile as Kevin, but now I was warmed up and ready to hit the racks.

Sweat was pouring down my forehead when the gym door opened. I looked up as the woman from the elevator last night walked in. This time she wore spandex pants and a loose t-shirt with her hair pulled up into a high ponytail. I averted my eyes as she noticed me. I was determined to not be caught staring a second time.

Deciding to be macho, I put a few more weights on the rack just in case she was watching, and was rewarded with a smile when she noticed. The woman then stepped onto a treadmill and began to run. My eyes drifted towards her, but when I saw her looking I quickly focused on my own work out. After an hour of working out I could feel the fatigue set in. Once I finished my set I began to put the weights back onto a rack. The woman stopped her own set and smiled at me.
“I saw you last night didn’t I?” she said. Her voice, smooth and welcoming.

“Uh yeah. I had just arrived and was heading to the pool”

“Oof. how did it go?”

“It was loud, a bit chaotic. I didn't stay long.” I said playing it cool.

“I’m Diana,” she said, stepping forward to shake my hand.

“David”

“It is nice to meet you David. How long are you here for?” Diana asked casually. Though there was an interest in her eyes and I noticed she looked down at my hand.

“I fly home Saturday morning”

“Oh me too. Hey, I can see that you are getting ready to go so I won’t hold you up but if you are not busy Friday night I will be up in the Upstairs Bar. If you want to join me, I certainly wouldn't mind the company” Diana said handing me a small card that had her name and what I assumed was her phone number on it.

“Thanks.” I said putting her card into my pocket. “I’ll see you then.” and left for the door, surprised that on day two and my first full day as David I was already having better luck with the ladies than I had ever had as Kevin.
1111111114111122.title: The Next Day

11111111141111221.content:
Considering it was a weekday evening, I was surprised to see how packed the Mall was. I found a bench outside the theater to sit on while I waited for the girls from New Horizons to arrive. I didn’t have to wait before I heard a familiar voice. “David, I didn’t think you’d come.”

Looking up, I saw Leslie Cummings walking towards me with three other women; one of whom had tattoos down most of her right arm. I got up as they arrived, hugging Leslie as I said, “I needed to get out of the hotel room; there’s only so much to do there.”

“I can sympathize.” Taking a seat next to me, a huge smile on her face, she said, “Ladies, this is David Williams; an architect from Chicago.”

“Yeah, sure he is.” Looking at me, the tattooed woman said, “I’ll bet he used to be someone else a few days ago.”

“Do you ever get tired of knowing everything?” sighing, Leslie said, “David, this know-it-all next to me is my wife Grace. She’s retired Army Intelligence; so although she knows not to ask who you were, she’s smart enough to know the truth.”

Hearing that, I looked at Grace cautiously; until she smiled and said, “Don’t worry, your secret’s safe with me. After all, you’re just like my wife.”

Not exactly, I didn’t use to be a homophobic ass. Leslie continued with the introductions, turning to the woman next to her. “These are my co-workers Erin and Carrie.”

“It’s nice to meet all of you.” I felt weird knowing that I was now suddenly a decade older than everyone here, whereas a few days earlier I’d been a decade younger. I caught Erin and Carrie looking at me with the kind of expression I’d seen Kelsey give to guys she liked. They quickly giggled and turned away when they realized I saw them. “So, um, what movie are we seeing?”

“Hold your horses, David; we’ve got some business to attend to first. There’s a situation at work we think you can help us with, but we’ll understand if you refuse.” Gesturing to Erin and Carrie, Leslie said, “We’ve got a 12-year-old boy who we’re unable to place in a local home, and it’ll be a few days before we can contact families further out.”

“Okay, I’m listening; although I’m not sure what this has to do with me.”

“Leslie mentioned that you wanted to start a family; if you were willing, this boy could become your son.” Looking at me, Leslie said, “If you say yes, we could even alter his genetics so that you two are related. What do you say? Do you want to be a father?”

I couldn't help smiling as a pregnant Leslie asked if I wanted to be a Father. “How would you make us related?”
Erin interjected and said, “If you’re willing, we’ll take a sample of your DNA; we’ll splice it with the boy’s so that, at least paternally, you’ll be related.”

“If you agree, then we can take care of everything tomorrow, and you two will leave for Chicago on Saturday like planned.”

I looked at all four ladies; trying to process everything that was going on. I’d only been a grown man for a few days, now they were asking me to become a father. After a moment I realized there was little chance I wouldn’t agree with this. Looking at them, I said, “I’ll do it.” Taking a pause, I said, “What is his name? How old is he?” I asked as questions began to fill my head.

“Whoa, calm down David; his name is Andrew and he’s 12 years old.” Looking at me, seeing the gears spinning in my head, Leslie said, “Andrew can tell you the rest tomorrow if he wants to.”

I realized that I was now responsible for someone other than myself. “When can I pick him up?”

“We’ll send a driver to pick you up around 8:30 to bring you to the Clinic; once we’re finished, we’ll have someone take you both back to the hotel.” With a sense of finality in her voice, Leslie said, “Now. what movie do you girls want...oh right, and David.”

Erin and Carrie voted to see a new rom-com; so did Leslie, but I suspected for different reasons. Grace and I wanted to see the new action thriller, but we were outvoted.

*********************************


We left the theater about 2 hours later; Carrie and Erin were laughing and Leslie was crying. Grace seemed annoyed but I suspected that she’d enjoyed the movie. As for me, I was so caught up with the prospect of becoming a father that I’d missed the first half of the movie. I must’ve fallen asleep at some point because I woke up to Grace elbowing me in the stomach.

Slipping her hand into Grace’s Leslie said, “Well that was fun.”

“Is anyone up for drinks?” pausing, Carrie said, “How does Pina Coladas at Applebee's sound?”

Indicting her stomach, Leslie said, “Sorry, but that’ll be a hard pass for me.”

“Oh right, sorry.” Turning to me, the same flirtatious look from earlier, Carrie said, “How about you, David?”

“Thanks, but I’m going to pass; I’m not as young as I used to be.” Smiling, I said, “I appreciate the offer though, but I’m going to turn in.”
11111111141111221.title: Movie Night

111111111411112211.content:
