The lobby was quite busy the next morning; with people coming and going. I was sitting in a recliner by the fireplace when I heard a familiar voice behind me. “Well good morning, David.”

Turning around, I smiled when I saw Diana approaching me from the elevator; wearing a dress that showed off her figure. “Good morning, Diana; you’re looking lovely this morning.”

I was a bit startled by that; complimenting an older woman’s appearance wasn’t something I usually did. But then again, I wasn’t the same teenage boy I’d been a few days earlier. To her credit though, Diana smiled and said, “Thank you; are you off to work?”

Well, not exactly. “I’m waiting for a company driver to pick me up at any moment.” Looking at her, I said, “How about you?”

“Fingers crossed, I’m hopefully off to close a deal.”

“Oh really?” curious, I said, “What is it that you do?”

Diana wasn’t even hiding it; with a raised eyebrow and a smile on her face, it was obvious that she was flirting with me. “Meet me at the bar tonight, and I’ll tell you all about it.”

“Sounds like a plan to me.”

Walking towards the lobby doors, she turned to wave and said, “Sounds like a date.”

*********************************


An hour later I was walking into New Horizons for the second time in my life. I walked up to the receptionist from yesterday, who said, “Good morning, Mr. Williams; Dr. Weintraub and Mrs. Cummings are expecting you.” Pointing down the hall, she said, “If you’ll take a seat in the waiting room, I will let them know you are here.”

I walked down to the waiting room; but before I could even walk in, I saw Leslie waving me down. As she got closer, she said, “I’m glad you could make it, David; are you ready?”

Following her down the hall, I said, “Are we going to see Andrew?”

Walking into an examination room, Leslie said, “Not yet; there are still some things we need to do for both of you.” Gesturing to an examination table, Leslie said, “Have a seat, Liz will be in shortly do collect a sample.”

Liz walked in a few minutes later; looking at her, I said, “How are we doing this, Liz? Do you need a blood sample or a um...”

“Nothing so crude as all that, David.” Smiling, Liz said, “Now open wide and say Ah.”

After the sample was taken, Liz led me back to the waiting room. As she turned to leave, I said, “How long will this take?”

“That depends; we’re rewriting DNA that’s already been changed once before. It is perfectly doable, but much like writing over something in pencil that you already erased once, we have to be careful not to blend the new “lead” with the old.” Looking at me, Liz said, “We’re looking at between 45 minutes to 6 hours, recovery included, depending on how similar your DNA is already.”

I took a deep breath. “Thanks, Liz.” she smiled at left.

*********************************


The next two hours went by with no word from the back; although I did see five people enter the waiting room before they were taken back. The first was a teenage girl I’d remembered seeing in school; she was a year or two older than me, kind of a loner so I never got to learn her name.

Next came an older woman, probably in her mid-60s; she smiled at me as we sat there. After that came a guy in his early 20s; judging by his appearance, I figured he wasn’t doing much with his life. The fourth was a middle-aged man, similar to my age. The fifth client was another teenage girl, though I had never seen her before.

The middle-aged man reappeared a short time later; looking angry as he walked past the room. All I could hear as he walked by was something about like “mid-life crisis my ass.” I figured that meant they’d determined that they couldn’t help him. After that came a busty, blonde girl who looked to be in her early 20s; smiling at me as she walked past.

Soon after an athletic-looking college-age man came out; winking and grinning at me as he passed. I suspected that he used to be the older woman who’d passed the time by staring at me. It was nearly 45 minutes before another person, a woman in her late 40s, walked past the window. The only clue I had that she wasn't who she looked like was her arms crossed under her bosom.

Leslie walked out shortly after with a small boy, no older than 5 or 6, I began to get up when she shooed me back down and continued to walk past me to the reception counter. She then came back a moment later, and said, “Andrew’s awake and asking for you; are you ready to meet your son?”
111111111411112211.title: Back to New Horizons

1111111114111122111.content:
Leslie and I walked to a small room in the back; stopping outside, she said, “Alright David, are you ready to meet your son?”

It was all I could do to nod, I was so nervous. Leslie peeked through the doorway before turning towards me and gestured me in. The room was brightly lit; I saw Leslie and Liz standing off to the side, looking towards the center of the room. On the examination table was a 12-year-old boy; one that I recognized immediately. He looked just like a younger me; not Kevin, but David. He had the same hair, the same nose, and the same grin as he examined himself

“Andrew, this is your father.”

Andrew looked up me for the first time, his eyes lit up with surprise as he looked at me. His smile grew exponentially bigger as he jumped off the table. “Dad!?”

I knelt on one knee, looking at him. “That’s right, Andrew; I’m your father.”

I was choking back tears as Andrew ran over and hugged me. We remained like that for a while, until Leslie said, “David, there are some forms that you both need to sign; after that, you’re free to leave.”

********************************


It was mid-afternoon when the driver dropped Andrew and me at the hotel. The lobby was empty as we walked to the elevator. Looking up at me, Andrew said, “Dad, I’m hungry.”

“Nice to meet you Hungry...I’m Dad.” I smiled at my first dad joke, while Andrew just rolled his eyes. Looking at him, I said,
“We’ll get something once we get to the room.”

Once we got to the room, Andrew dropped a duffle bag inside the door as he went off to explore. I was looking through the menus for local restaurants when I heard him exclaim, “Whoa! This room has a Jacuzzi!”

I was excited to see him excited; I didn’t know anything about his past, but I was glad to see him happy. As he walked back into the main room, I pointed to the menus and said, “Have a look at these; I’ll let you choose where we go for dinner.”

Andrew took a seat at the desk as he looked over the menus. Glancing back at me, he said, “You were right by the way.”

Puzzled, I said, “Come again?”

“I said you were right.” Looking at me, a smile on his face, Andrew said, “The transformation didn’t hurt at all.”

I racked my brain trying to figure out what Andrew was saying; then it hit me. “You were Katrina Berkhart, the girl from the waiting room?”

“That’s right. Dad.”

Suddenly all I could think about was the look of utter defeat on Katrina’s face in the waiting room. It made the look of utter joy on Andrew’s face all the more special. “Do you want to talk about it?”

“I guess it’s only fair that you know; after all, you’re my father now.” Andrew hesitated for a second before saying, “But before we talk, could we go here and get some food first.” Andrew held up a menu of a burger joint a short walk from the hotel.

“Of course, son.”
1111111114111122111.title: Meeting Andrew

11111111141111221112.content:
As soon as I opened the door, Andrew walked in with the leftovers from dinner. As he put the fries in the fridge, he said, “Those burgers were great; and I think the shakes were probably the best I’d ever had.”

I took note of the amount of energy that Andrew now had, I knew it was only a matter of time before he crashed. “It was, but don’t complain when your stomach is upset tonight.”

“Okay.”

The two of us took a seat on the couch; Andrew sat next to me fidgeting. Looking at him, I said, “You don’t have to tell me anything, Andrew; I’ll love you just the same.”

“No, you deserve to know who I used to be.” Taking a deep breath, Andrew said, “As you know my name was Katriana Berkhart; I was 19 years old and a sophomore in college. For as long as I...Katrina could remember, she wanted to be a school teacher. Everything was going great; I had perfect grades, a loving family, friends, and an amazing boyfriend.”

My eyes locked onto Andrew’s; trying to convey concern and love. “I take it something happened?”

“Everything was great until last week; I was at a party with some sorority sisters and my boyfriend, there was tons of music and drinking. Slowly my friends left with guys and my boyfriend led me upstairs. I realize now that I’d had too much to drink, so I wasn’t thinking clearly when my boyfriend and I started to fool around.” Sighing, Andrew said, “Everything changed after that; it turns out my boyfriend filmed our night together and leaked it online. Once I found out, like an idiot, I decided to confront my boyfriend; he just laughed and asked if I wanted to film another. He dumped me on the spot when I refused.”

“I’m so sorry.” I whispered. “That sounds rough”

“Trust me, it gets worse.” Taking a deep breath, she said, “I was beyond upset, as you might imagine; so I called my mom to explain what happened. She told me to come by the house to talk. I beat them there and was waiting on the front porch when it happened. I saw their car in the corner. As they entered the intersection a car came from nowhere and...”

I knew, once Andrew went quiet, what had happened. Andrew started crying, so I pulled him in for a hug and said, “Andrew, I’m so sorry.”

Andrew weakly smiled. “There is one more thing.”

My face turned pale. “You’re kidding right?”

“After my parent's funeral, the university revoked my scholarship because of the video; and suggested that I find another major.” Sobbing, Andre said, “My roommate found me on the floor, I’d overdosed on sleeping pills. Long story short, after the hospital visit my roommate brought me to New Horizons; where I met you.”

“I’m sorry for everything that happened to you, son.” Hugging him, I said, “Let’s make a new life together; how’s that sound?”

“That sounds great...Dad.” after taking a moment to calm down, he said, “Now it’s your turn?”

“Pardon?”

“You said we both needed to learn about each other’s past; I told you mine, now it’s your turn.”

“Alright, but it’s not as tragic as your story.”

“It doesn’t have to be.”

“Yes son, I was unhappy.” I proceeded to tell Andrew everything about my life; from my father leaving to my sister and mom realizing that I needed a change. Once I was finished, I showed Andrew some of the pictures Kelsey gave me. “This was me and my sister.”

Staring intently at the photo, Andrew said, “Wow, your sister’s hot!”

“Andrew!”

“Sorry, I...I’m not sure why I feel that way.”

I quickly realized just how different things would be for Andrew now; whereas I’d gotten older and more mature, Andrew had jumped the gender fence and was brought right back to the cusp of puberty. “I guess it would be my duty as your father to guide you through puberty. You are a growing boy, remember.”

Andrew walked off and returned with a framed photograph. “Here’s a picture of Katrina’s parents.”

I took the photo and realized that it was a high school graduation photo; Katrina looked so happy standing next to her parents. The man in the photo had kind eyes but a gruff demeanor, the woman was stunning; with a bright smile and clear happy eyes. I couldn't help but take notice of her. Turning to Andrew, feeling the need to mess with him, I said, “Now your mom was hot.”

Looking at me, mortified, Andrew said, “That’s gross, Dad.” It was clear from his smile that he was messing around. “I just thought of something; what exactly will we tell people about my mom?”

Thinking for a moment, I said, “What if we tell people she died shortly after you were born; it’ll explain why we don’t have a lot of photos or memories of her.”

“I think that works. But can we say she died in a car crash when I was very little?”

I saw the meaning behind his words. He wanted to use part of Katrina’s parent’s death as part of his story. I couldn't blame him. My name and age were all due to honoring people in my past life. “Yeah, we’ll go with that. Your mother died in a car accident shortly after you were born.”
11111111141111221112.title: Back At the Room

111111111411112211121.content:
After we finished our man-to-man chat, as was the case with most children his age, Andrew decided that he’d had enough of me for one day. So while he got changed and went down to the pool, I decided to pass the time by contacting my family.

I logged into New Horizon’s secure site and found the communications page. The moment the page loaded I noticed that Kelsey was already logged in, so I clicked her name and typed out a message. Hey sis, it’s me.

A million thoughts poured through my mind while I waited for Kelsey to respond; mainly focusing on how supportive she would be. I didn’t have to wait very long for her response. Kevin!? I was wondering when you’d get in contact.

Kelsey was always the impatient one; I’d only been gone for a few days but she was acting like I’d been gone longer. Sorry, I’ve been getting used to the new me.

I can imagine. There was a brief pause before she typed again. I read some confidential stories online; about how some male clients left the Clinic as women. Did you?

Yes, I did. Unable to resist messing with her, I said, I’m now a 22-year-old aspiring fashion model.

Years of growing up together had given Kelsey the ability to know when I was messing with her; even over a text message. Very funny; what did you end up as?

It must’ve been a special occasion at the restaurant because while people were eating they came around and took photos. I logged into my email to download the photo of myself and Andrew. Before I could write anything about the message, I accidentally pressed the send button.

I silently cursed myself for making that mistake; although that turned into a verbal expletive when I saw Kelsey’s response. Who’s that adult in the photo? Mom says he’s cute.

I retched a little bit when I saw that; as I quickly typed out a response to address that error. That’s me; the young boy is my son Andrew.

There was silence for a few moments until I noticed someone else logging on – Mom. Did you just say that young boy is your son?

Yeah, he’s another New Horizons client; they couldn’t place him with a family so they asked if I’d take him. Pausing to take a breath, I continued, Thanks to the wonders of science, he and I are biologically related.

Kelsey typed out a response at that point. I’m glad you said that wasn’t you; it makes me feel better about thinking that he’s cute.

He’s 12 years old, Kelsey.

So, I’m 14? I can’t think a younger boy is cute?

This topic was getting too weird for me, so I said, Can we change the subject? It’s bad enough he thinks you’re cute; I don’t need him learning that you think the same way.

The chat continued for a little while longer until Mom said it was time for dinner. I said goodbye and logged off just as Andrew walked back into the room. Walking up to me, dripping wet, he said, “Dad, can I have some money? A bunch of us from the pool want to see a movie.”

I was amazed by how quickly I went into parenting mode. Looking at Andrew, I said, “Are there going to be any adults there?”

“Yeah, this kid’s older sister is going to be there.” Looking at me, he said, “Please dad, can I go?”

I sighed and walked over to my wallet. Handing $30 to Andrew, I said, “Don’t spend it all on snacks, okay?”

“Thanks, dad.”
111111111411112211121.title: Contacting the Family

1111111114111122111211.content:
I walked off the elevator, and into the bar, just after 6:45. I didn’t see Diana yet, so I made my way to the bar and ordered a drink. I was sitting, facing the entrance when I saw two familiar faces walk in – the busty blonde and the older woman from New Horizons.

While the busty blonde made her way towards the opposite end of the bar, where a younger man was sitting, the woman saw me staring at her and made a bee-line towards me. I started to get nervous as she got closer; due in large part to the determined looked on her face. Without even asking, she took a seat next to me and said, “Didn’t I see you at New Horizons today?”

“Yes, you did.” Taking a deep breath, I said, “If you don’t mind my asking, which one were you?”

After getting her drink, the woman looked at me and said, “You get straight to the point, don’t you?” taking a sip, she said, “I was that 22-year-old man in the corner.”

I don’t know why, but for some reason, I’d suspected that was who the woman used to be. As much as I wanted the conversation to end, I found myself drawn into it. The woman, now going by Helena, explained that she was written out of the will by her former family. She freely admitted that she was a trust fund baby; whose only serviceable skill was throwing parties and sleeping with girls.

After she finished explaining everything, I was stunned. People like me and Andrew went to New Horizons to make a better life for ourselves, but Helena had gone there to get back her former lifestyle. Looking at her, I said, “I can’t believe you went to New Horizons for such a selfish reason.”

“Please sweetie, like you wouldn’t have done the same thing in my position.” Taking a sip of her drink, Helena said, “As I said, I had no discernible skills so there was no way I’d be able to continue my lifestyle of choice.”

I was getting more annoyed with each passing second; this woman took advantage of New Horizons for her own selfish needs. I was surprised that she passed the evaluation; that man with the mid-life crisis was more deserving than Helena. “So what now; use your looks to bag yourself a rich husband who will pamper you?”

“Yeah that’s it in a nutshell; perhaps I’ll even find a way to get some revenge on my former parents.”

It suddenly dawned on me why Helena had come over to me. “Don’t tell me, you thought I would be willing to play along?”

“The thought had occurred to me; but honestly, I was just hoping you’d want to have sex with me.”

Before I could even respond to that absurd proposition, I was interrupted by the sudden appearance of the busty blonde standing next to me with her arms wrapped around some guy from the bar. “Can I have the room key, mom? This handsome devil and I want to have a little fun.”

Taking the room key from her purse, Helena said, “Here you go, sweetie; have fun.”

Once the two walked off, I turned to Helena and said, “You two are mother and daughter?”

"Hard to believe that she used to be a dull, unattractive teenage girl."

I was stunned; that busty blonde used to be my former classmate. I didn't know her that well, but I was more than surprised by the drastic changes she went through. Before I could say anything, Diana appeared next to me and said, “Hi sweetie, sorry I’m late.”

Helena gave Diana a smug, angry look while I got up and said, “It’s okay, I just passed the time talking with this interesting woman.”
1111111114111122111211.title: The Bar

11111111141111221112111.content:
Helena took one look at Diana and grunted in disgust. “So, you’ve already got yourself a girlfriend, huh?” Diana stepped aside while Helena got up and walked past her, looking down at her dismissively.

Sitting in the now vacant seat, Diana looked at me and said, “Do you know her or something?”

As I sat there, looking at Diana, I tried to figure out how to respond to that question. After a moment, I decided to fudge the truth a little bit. “We’ve got a mutual friend, but I’ve never spoken to her before now.”

After ordering herself a drink, a smile on her face, Diana said, “If you ask me, I think she wanted to get better acquainted with you.”

The smile on Diana’s face grew when she saw me blushing; I’d be lying if part of me hadn’t found Helena to be physically attractive for her age, but her personality was a big turn off. As I took a sip of my drink, I found myself thinking about how much things had changed for me in just the last few days.

Who would have imagined, earlier this week, that I’d be a grown man having a drink with an attractive woman old enough to be my mother? Add to that the fact that I suddenly found myself with a 12-year-old son, and a promising career waiting for me in Chicago, it was safe to say that I was happy.

I was so caught up in my thoughts that I hadn’t realized Diana was trying to get my attention. “David, eyes up here!”

“Huh?” snapping back to reality, I said, “Was I…oh God, I’m so sorry; that was rude of me.”

“Relax, no one’s stared at these girls since High School.” Playfully emphasizing her chest, Diana said, “You were staring more into space than me; I just found that phrase tends to get a man’s attention pretty quickly.”

“Still, I’m sorry.” Smiling, I said, “You were saying?”

“I was asking what you did for a living and where home was.”

“I’m an architect; I’m opening a small firm in Chicago next week.”

I smiled when I saw her give an impressed look. “You own your own firm?”

“I haven’t opened it yet, but I’ve got some possible contracts lined up.” Pausing, I said, “What about you, Diana?”

“I work in advertising; the business side, not the creative side.” Looking at me, she said, “I’m a regional manager for several branches throughout New England and New York; I’m technically based out of St. Louis but I’m traveling 50 weeks out of the year.”

*******************


Diana and I spent the evening getting to know each other over dinner. As time went by I found myself getting more confident, as I would flirt with her and she’d respond in kind. After a while, I realized it was getting late. Getting up from the table, I said, “I had a lovely evening, Diana.”

“As did I, David.” Looking directly into my eyes, she said, “But there’s no reason why it couldn’t continue.”

My heart skipped a beat; I knew enough about romance to know what she was implying. “Do you mean go back to my room and…”

“Yeah, if you want to; you’ve been nothing but a gentleman all evening.” Looking at me, seductively, Diana said, “If I’m being honest, you’ve been driving me crazy all night.”

I couldn’t believe my luck; a gorgeous woman wanted to come back to my hotel room – and it was her idea. Offering my hand to Diana, I said, “Let’s go.”

Taking my hand, Diana pulled me towards the elevator; her hips swaying as she pulled me through the hallway to the elevator.
11111111141111221112111.title: The Date With Diana

111111111411112211121111.content:
Once we were in the elevator, Diana started to show me what she had in mind as she wrapped her arms around me and started kissing me. Her breath had a hint of alcohol but it wasn’t overpowering. Once the elevator reached my floor, I backed out and the two of us ran down the hall to my room like a bunch of teenagers.

I fumbled briefly with my room key; finally opening the door so Diana and I could enter. “Wow, your room is much nice than mine.” Looking around, admiring the suite New Horizons had given me, Diana said, “Do you mind if I freshen up in your bathroom?”

I silently nodded as I took a seat on my bed; only pausing to breathe once I heard the bathroom door close. “Was this happening? " I thought to myself. "Can I do this? Is this how adults hook up? Will she be able to tell I'm inexperienced? ”

My concerns were all for naught as the door opened to reveal Diana standing there in nothing my lingerie. My reaction harkened back to the first time I met her; thinking she was one of the most beautiful women in the world. “I take it, by your expression, that you like them?” smiling, Diana said, “I bought this especially for you.”

Looking at her, all I could think to say was, “You look hot."

“That’s cute, you sound like a schoolboy.”

Even if she meant it to be funny, I took that as a warning – I needed to watch how I spoke from now on. Looking at me, she said, “Well you’ve seen my underwear, it’s only fair that I see yours.” Sauntering over, she placed a hand on my waist and said, “Do you need some help?”

I didn’t say a word as she worked on my belt, allowing me to start undressing. Once I was finished, I sat on the bed in all my glory. “Look at that; I knew you looked athletic but I didn’t think you were that fit.”

Dressed in only my boxers I meekly blushed as I murmured my gratitude. “T-Thank you.”

“Well I’m ready; and from the look of things so are you.”

Diana leaned over and pushed me down on the bed; as I let my body take over. We spent the first few minutes kissing each other until we felt it was time. I was mesmerized by the site of her naked chest; as I’d never seen one up close before. Letting my body take over once more, I was about to go to work when the door opened.

I felt my heart skip a beat when I heard Andrew say, “Dad, I’m back!”

I heard Andrew’s footsteps approaching the bedroom door, which I foolishly forgot to close. In the meantime, Diana was freaking out. “What’s going on here?”

Andrew walked into the room at that point; covering his eyes as he realized what was happening. “Oh God, I’m sorry!”

I thought the worst was over as Andrew left the room; only to realize that wasn’t the case when Diana wriggled herself out from under me and covered herself with a sheet. “Who was that?”

“That’s my son, Andrew; he was at the movies with some kids.” Looking at the clock, I saw that it was 10:45. “I’m sorry, I guess I lost track of time.”

“You forget to mention you have a son, and all you can say is sorry?” scrambling to get dressed, Diana said, “Is there anything else you haven’t told me? Like, perhaps, that you're married?”

“I’m not married; my wife died shortly after he was born.”

“I’m sorry to hear that, but having a child is something you might want to tell people about.” Looking at me, hurt, Diana said, “I thought you were better than that, David.”

“I’m sorry, I should’ve been more upfront; but I usually never get this far.”

That was a stretch of course, but I must’ve said something right based on Diana’s expression. “I’m sorry David, but I...I can’t do this.” Gathering the last of her things, she said, “It was fun...at first.”

I was alone for a few minutes after Diana left; until Andrew slowly walked in with a nervous look on his face. “I’m sorry Dad, I didn’t know.”

“It’s okay Andrew; it’s not your fault.” Sighing, I said, “I behaved like an idiot and didn’t think things through.”

There was silence for a moment; until Andrew said, “If it helps, she was pretty hot.”

I wanted to reprimand him for saying that, but the smile he had on his face changed my mind. Shaking my head, I said, “There’s no way I’m ready to raise a teenage son.”

“Don’t worry Dad, it’s not my first time.” Sitting next to me, Andrew said, “Besides this time around won’t be as bad; there won’t be drastic physical changes, just a rush of hormones.”

I wanted to lecture him once more, but decided against it. “We have an early flight tomorrow; why don’t you get ready for bed.”

Andrew got up and walked into the bathroom to brush his teeth. After a moment, he came out holding a card in his hand. “Dad, was that woman’s name Diana?”

“Yeah.” Looking at him, I said, “How’d you know that?”

Handing the card to me, Andrew said, “She left a business card in the bathroom.”
111111111411112211121111.title: Bedroom Hijinks

1111111114111122111211111.content:
Andrew and I gathered up our things before leaving the room just after 8:00 the next morning. As the elevator arrived, I felt a pang of regret when Diana didn’t step out of it. Memories from the night before flashed through my mind as I stepped inside; memories of how I screwed things up with Diana by not being more open with her.

As the elevator when down the lobby, I looked over and saw Andrew typing away on his phone. “Who could you possibly be texting at 8:00 in the morning?”

“Just a friend, Dad; don’t worry.”

“I’m your father, Andrew; it’s my job to worry.” As Andrew put his phone away, I said, “Who were you texting?”

Andrew hesitated for a moment, clearly unsure of what to do next. After a moment, he said, “Promise you won’t get mad?”

Having been his age until quite recently, I knew it was never a good sign when someone said that. Looking at him, with a stern look on my face, I said, “Andrew.”

“I reached out to my old roommate last night; the one who brought Katrina to the Clinic. I wanted to say goodbye to her before we left; to show her that I was okay.” Looking at me, Andrew said, “She’s downstairs in the lobby right now.”

For the first time since this began, I found myself justifiably angry with my son. “Andrew Williams, you should know better than to do that without asking me.” With the sternest voice possible, I said, “I don’t want my 12-year-old texting some 20-year-old woman that I’ve never met before.”

Judging from the shocked expression on his face, that wasn’t the reaction Andrew had been hoping for. “Megan’s not some woman, Dad; she’s my best friend.” Looking at me, Andrew said, “Besides, I didn’t think I needed your permission to contact her.”

“You’re 12 years old, Andrew; everything you do requires my permission.” Sighing, I said, “Right now I’m more upset about the fact that you gave her sensitive information about yourself.”

“Do you seriously think she’ll use that against me?” glaring at me, Andrew said, “If it hadn’t been for her, you wouldn’t have a son.”
1111111114111122111211111.title: The Next Day

11111111141111221112111111.content:
Andrew’s comment cut me deep; deeper than I would have imagined. “I’m your father, Andrew, and you’ll obey my rules. Do you understand?”

He just stared at me, clearly regretting what he said. After a moment, he finally said, “I don’t see what the big deal is.”

“You’re a 12-year-old boy, Andrew; it’s not at all appropriate for a boy your age to be in contact with an older woman.” Sighing, as I knelt in front of him, I said, “How would Katrina’s father have reacted if she’d done what you did?”

I could tell that my words were influencing him, as tears began to well up in his eyes. I also noticed a look of defiance as well; a look I knew all too well. “She’s the only connection I have left to my past life, dad; she’d never use that information against me.”

I don’t know what drove me to do it, but I looked at Andrew said, “Katrina didn’t think her boyfriend would release a sex tape of her, and we both know how that turned out.”

I regretted saying that the moment it came out of my mouth; especially after Andrew started crying in front of me. Between tears, his voice rife with anger and sadness, Andrew said, “How dare you.”

“Andrew, I-I didn’t mean that.” Placing a hand on his shoulder, I said, “I’m so sorry, son.”

Andrew looked at me as I started crying as well. “I just wanted to say goodbye to her; I didn’t get to do that at the clinic.”
“Let me talk to her first, okay?” beginning to understand why Andrew did what he did, I said, “If she’s the kind of girl you say, then I’ll let you say your goodbyes.”

As I stood back up, I saw the anger in Andrew’s eyes slowly turn to hope.

*********************


After we checked out of the room, Andrew and I walked through the lobby until he grabbed my arm. Pointing towards a window overlooking the pool, he said, “That’s her, dad.”

I saw a petite woman, wearing leggings and a shirt with her college logo on it. “Stay here, Andrew; I’ll go talk to her.”

Before I could even move, Andrew grabbed my hand and prevented me from leaving. He just looked me in the eye; with the same look of pain and hope still there. I smiled at him and he let go. Walking up to the girl, who was looking at her phone, I said, “Megan?”

“Katrina?” looking up from her phone, she said, “Is that you?”

“No, I’m not Katrina; my name is David.” Taking a seat across from her, I said, “I asked to meet with you before I allowed you to see my son.”

Megan’s eyes furrowed before a look of understanding dawned on them. “I’m sorry, I’m Megan Hunt.” Offering her hand, she said, “I brought Katrina to New Horizons to keep her from killing herself. She was my best friend; both in this life and my last.”

After hearing that I let myself feel at ease – knowing she was a former client herself made me feel better. “I need to know that I can trust you, Megan; what are your plans once you learn who Katrina became?”

“I’d never tell anyone the truth if that’s what you’re asking; I simply want to say goodbye.” Looking at me, Megan said, “I know she’s no longer the Katrina I grew up with; but, with your permission, I’d like to stay in contact with her."

Hearing that, my instincts told me that I could trust her. Turning around, I gestured from Andrew to come over; a big grin on his face as he ran over to us. As he stopped next to me, I turned to Megan said, “Megan, this is my son Andrew; but you knew him as Katrina.”

Without saying a word, Megan pulled Andrew into a huge hug; which he struggled with for a moment before relaxing. After a moment, Megan broke the hug and said, “You look adorable.”

Turning to look at me, Andrew said, “Dad, can I have a minute alone with Megan?”

“Of course.” Gesturing to a nearby chair, I said, “I’ll be right over there.”

I looked back briefly as I walked away, only to find them hugging again. “I can’t thank you enough for this, Meg; you saved my life.”

“I was only returning the favor, Kat; after all, I couldn’t let my best friend die when I knew I could save her.” Getting a good look at Andrew, Megan said, “I see you jumped the gender fence.”

“I chose the 12-year-old girl option, but decided to change my gender.” His voice oozing with contempt, Andrew said, “I didn’t want what that asshole did to me to ever happen again.”

I wasn’t a fan of the language Andrew was using, but I understood that he was talking about his former boyfriend. “I’m sure you’ll grow up to be a complete gentleman; you’ll have girls fawning all over you in high school.” Smiling, Megan said, “You got lucky in the dad department; he must care about you if he’s so protective of you.”

Andrew glanced at me and smiled; turning back to Megan, he said, “You think so?”

“I remember what Kat’s father was like; I think David is 100x better than he ever was.” Pausing, Megan said, “Is it just a coincidence that the two of you look similar?”

“Nope, it’s not a coincidence.” Smiling, Andrew said, “New Horizons worked their magic to make me his biological son.”

“Well, in that case, you’re going to be quite handsome when you’re older.” With a grin, Megan said, “Your dad is pretty attractive for his age.”

I wasn’t supposed to be listening to their conversation, but I couldn’t help but blush at that remark. Megan was attractive as well; if I were 15 years younger, I would’ve been all over her. Megan must have realized that I was listening in because she looked at me and smiled while Andrew said, “Meg, that’s disgusting.”

Seeing that Andrew was getting embarrassed, I decided it was time for me to come to the rescue. Walking over to them, I said, “Say goodbye, Andrew; we’ve got to head to the airport.”

Tears filled both their eyes as Andrew went in for a big hug. “I love you, Megan; thank you for saving me.”

I let the two of them hug for a moment; until it was time to go. “Andrew, you’ve got my permission to contact Megan again once we’re settled.”

This time I was the recipient of one of Megan’s hugs; as she embraced me and, without Andrew hearing, whispered in my ear, “Thank you.”

*********************


The trip to the airport wasn’t long; after the shuttle dropped us off, we quickly made our way through security with our carry-on bags. I’d never flown before, and I’d heard horror stories about airports; so I was relieved to see things were going smoothly.
11111111141111221112111111.title: Continue

111111111411112211121111111.content:
The plane took off without a hitch as it began the two-hour flight to Chicago. The stewardess came around 20 minutes into the flight with the drink car; I was tired so I ordered a coffee. After a few sips of the coffee, I decided to rest my eyes for a bit as the clouds passing by outside lulled me to sleep.

*************************


I was awakened about 20 minutes later to the feeling of Andrew poking my arm. “Dad?”

With my eyes still closed, and my voice sounded more tired than I’d meant it to, I said, “Yes, Andrew?”

“I...um, wanted to thank you.”

“Oh yeah?” suddenly wide awake, I turned to look at him, “For what?”

“For letting me stay in contact with Megan, it means a lot to me.”

Taking a sip of the lukewarm coffee, with a bitter after taste in my mouth, I said, “You two were close, weren’t you?”

“We were closer than you might think.”

I’d be lying if I said the thought of Katrina and Megan together hadn’t crossed my mind for a brief instant. “What do you mean?”

“As I said before, Megan was the one that brought me to New Horizons; she explained the entire process to me.” Looking at me, Andrew said, “You’re probably wondering how she knew all that, right?”

“Give me some credit, Andrew; I know she was a client.” Seeing the shocked expression on Andrew’s face, I continued, “She mentioned how you were best friends in both of her lives.”

“When I was growing up most of my friends thought that I was an only child; I just had a brother they didn’t know about.” Tearing up, Andrew said, “My brother Jacob was 7 years older than me, he died of cancer when I was 9 years old.”

I placed an affectionate hand on Andrew’s shoulder as he continued. “My parents both worked long hours, so Jacob was the one who took care of me; as a result, he didn’t have many friends. One day he collapsed at school and doctors told us that he had terminal brain cancer.” Sobbing, Andrew said, “He tried to hide it as things got worse, but I could tell that he was scared. One day my mom picked me up with an afterschool program and told me that Jacob had died. We had a funeral for him; after that, I grew up as an only child.”

The plane shuddered momentarily as we went through a patch of turbulence. “Then came college orientation where I met this girl who I got along with instantly – Megan.” Looking at me, wiping his eyes, Andrew said, “We decided to become roommates and she became my best friend. She always knew just want to say to make me feel better. That’s how I found out that she used to be my older brother.”

So that’s why Andrew was so upset; he didn’t want to lose his brother again. Looking at Andrew, I said, “Wait a minute; New Horizons has only been open 5 years, how could Megan have gone to them 10 years ago?”

“I guess they were looking for test subjects to ensure the procedure was safe; because Megan told me how Mom brought her to some hospital in the dead of night. The choices were limited back then, apparently, but Jacob chose to become a girl my age.” Sighing, Andrew said, “I’m sorry about how I acted earlier; it’s just I didn’t want to lose the only connection to my parents that I had left.”

“I guess I can’t fault you for that.” Smiling, I said, “Who knows, perhaps Megan will be part of our life in the future.”

Moments later the flight crew announced that we’d begun our descent; it wasn’t long before Andrew and I got our first glimpse of Chicago as we came in over the lake.

***********************


After grabbing our luggage, and using the bathroom, Andrew and I walked to the long-term parking lot where New Horizons said we’d find our car. As we hopped into our new SUV, Andrew looked at me and said, “Where to now, Dad?”

“Let’s go home, son.”
111111111411112211121111111.title: During the Flight

1111111114111122111211111112.content:
A week passed as Andrew and I settled in. Our house was out in the suburbs, which was nice as it meant we had a yard and some space away from our neighbors. The neighborhood however looked beautiful. Tall trees lined the streets, nice cars in the driveways, and children playing in their yards. I knew Andrew was itching to explore but as of yet we had been busy. Our house was a blank slate. All walls were white, flooring was unfinished, and no furniture to speak off. A note in our car had told us that would be the case along with a check for several thousands of dollars. That check was to be used for furnishing the house. There was plenty of money even if Andrew and I spent our money a bit lavishly.

After a week of picking out materials, and working with contractors to install everything, it was time to go to my new office.

My office was several miles from home but an easy commute. Situated still in the suburbs I didn't have to face all of the traffic and commuters heading into the city. As I pulled into my building's parking lot I saw one other vehicle. I was expecting that though. A phone call last night told me I was meeting some New Horizon executives to go over my building and to start designing theirs.

As I parked a middle-aged man and a young woman got out of the car. The man was tall, had thinning hair and a bushy mustache. The woman was slender and looked east Asian.

"I'm David Williams, how can I help you folks today?" I said extending my hand as they approached.

"I am Arnold Galt, we spoke on the phone last night" Arnold said as I recognized and shook his hand. " and this is my associate Miranda Zhang. She will be taking over as head in the chicago branch once we have finalized our project."

I unlocked the door and led them inside. Arnold began giving me a tour of the building. It felt a little strange being told that something was mine but knowing nothing about it. To top it off be shown around by a client who made the whole process possible.

By the end of the tour Ms. Zhang, Mr Galt and I were seated in my office. "We want something modest, something that won't attract too much attention, but it needs to stand out so people realize we are there" Arnold said.

"What he means is we want something modern looking but subdued. Something where people won't pay attention to the clients who want to use our facility, but won't mistake who we are." Miranda said, clarifying Arnold's comments.

I nodded as ideas began to form in my head. "How about the interior? Do you want things streamlined or compartmentalized? The clinic I attended had me running all over the building, but I couldn't tell you if that was purposefully done by the clinic or poor designs by the planner."

Arnold looked thoughtfully at Miranda. "It's your building Miranda, what do you want?"

Miranda smiled. "Make it streamlined, but I would like separate wings each capable of independent operation, we don't need another Miami" she said as Arnold nodded.

"We are limited on space, are you sure you want the building to have wings leading out or would you rather have two separate main halls running parallel with rooms alternating entrances between the halls filling the center? A cross-section hallway could make ease of travel if you need to get to the other hall without needing to backtrack all the way up the trunk." I said.

"I like that better. Could you make up some renderings of some possible designs and give us a few options?" Miranda asked.

"Of course Ms. Zhang. If you give me a few days to work on it. I should come up with a few suitable designs and be ready to present them next week."
1111111114111122111211111112.title: A Week Later

11111111141111221112111111122.content:
"So this is the design you'd like to go with Ms. Zhang?" I said showing Miranda the final draft of the building plans.

"Absolutely, I trust your capabilities and have been pleased with all your designs Mr. Williams. Let's go with it" Miranda said, smiling with her decision.

As I packed up the files and charts Miranda watched with interest. "So we are looking at about a year before we can open correct?"

"That's right given everything goes to schedule you should be able to open right around labor day." Miranda looked relieved. "Everything okay Ms . Zhang?" I asked, seeing her face.

"Yes, yes. I'm just under a lot of pressure to perform. It's not often a new clinic is opened especially in such a large untapped market. A lot of eyes are on me, watching to see if I'll succeed."

"I understand," I said sympathetically. "I will do my best to make this project succeed."

"Thank you." Miranda said with tired caring eyes. "I'll talk to you later then." She said as she walked out of the door.

I looked at the clock, our meeting had taken most of the afternoon. "Andrew should be home from school" I thought to myself. "It is probably time for me to head out too. If I leave now I can miss the rush hour" i thought, convincing myself.

**********

An hour later I was pulling into the garage. It seemed everyone had the same opinion and while I didn't have far to go, cutting across traffic was not fun.

"Andrew im home, are you here?" I called while entering the house. I saw his book bag at the same time as his reply "yeah dad I'm in my room."

"Doing homework? I called back seeing his books poking out of his backpack. The sound of his TV was evident from his room. "Do your work first Andrew then you can play." I said repeating the phrase my mother must have told me a billion times. Andrew grumbled down the stairs as I walked to the kitchen. "oh it can't be that hard, what do you have middle school math?"

"Its pre-algebra" Andrew sighed.

"Pre-algebra? Oh, you tested out of your regular math didn't you. Ha, thats hilarious they probably thing your a math genius…. Its almost like you've learned all of this before." I teased as he came to the kitchen table with his homework.

"I dont remember any of it now, dad. But I think because I once did, it comes to me quicker." Andrew said "besides all my teachers assume that because you're a mathematics guy with all the architecture and engineering and stuff that I am too."

"Probably a good thing to let them assume." I said throwing in a frozen casserole in the oven. "Dinner will be ready in an hour. I'll be in the study." I told him as I walked out of the kitchen.
11111111141111221112111111122.title: Jump to next week

111111111411112211121111111221.content:
It has been the better part of a month since Andrew and I arrived in Chicago. The firm was off to a good start, with one more contract apart from New Horizons. Andrew was doing decent enough in school, although his teachers keep emailing me about a supposed attention problem. He had made a few friends in the neighborhood and although he has not mentioned anything yet, I am beginning to suspect he might have a crush on a female classmate.

I have been in semi-frequent contact with my former family; Kelsey was still coming to terms with the fact that I was now old enough to be her father, while Abigail was constantly trying to give me parenting tips. I know her heart was in the right place, considering we were both single parents, but I was getting tired of the constant advice. Put that together with the awkward sexual tension and I found myself having a weird relationship with my former family.

*****************************


It was the Friday before Columbus Day Weekend and I was sitting in the baggage claim of O’Hare International Airport. It seemed that Megan had a long weekend, so she had asked me a few weeks back if she could fly out to Chicago and spent it with us. I did not have a problem with it, so I readily agreed to her request.

I was idly checking my phone when I heard a familiar voice holler, “Uncle David!”

I barely had a chance to look up from my phone before I was hugged by Megan. After a moment, I returned the hug and said, “How was your flight?”

“Pretty uneventful, although I was sitting next to this really cute guy.” Looking around, running a hand through her hair, Megan said, “Where’s Andrew?”

“He’s at home working on a history project.” Grabbing Megan’s bag, I said, “What’s with the whole ‘Uncle David’ thing?”

Shrugging, with a grin, Megan said, “I dunno; it seemed appropriate at the time.”

“That reminds me; were your parents okay with you coming out here?” pausing, I said, “They know about Andrew, but they’ve never met me before.”

As we headed towards the baggage claim, Megan said, “They were a little uncertain at first; but then I mentioned how you were a fellow New Horizon alum.”

***************************


After retrieving a surprising amount of luggage for a 3-day trip, Megan and I made our way to the short-term parking lot. Once I paid the parking fee, I started driving back to the house while Megan admired the sights as we drove along the highway.

We drove in silence for about 10 minutes before I decided to speak up, “So, Megan, why’d you pack so much for a 3-day trip?”

Looking at me, Megan said, “You don’t know a lot about girls, do you?”

“I had a twin sister before this; but no, I don’t have a lot of first-hand knowledge.” Looking at her, I said, “So what’s with the luggage?”

“I like having a lot of options to choose from.”

As I drove off the highway, I felt like Megan was hiding something from me. I wanted to ask what was going on but felt it wouldn’t be appropriate; after all, we’d scarcely spoken for more than 20 minutes since we met.

Fate must’ve been on my side; because as I turned onto my street, I saw an unfamiliar car parked in front of the house. I started to get a little annoyed; thinking perhaps Andrew had invited friends over without asking me.

After pulling into the garage, and helping Megan with her bags, I walked into the house ready to confront Andrew. I heard voices coming from down the hall, so I walked that way. “Andrew, would you mind explaining…”

I stopped midsentence as I walked around the corner into the living room; stopping in my tracks when I saw Kelsey and Abigail standing in front of my fireplace. Looking at me, Abigail said, “Surprise!”
111111111411112211121111111221.title: A Holiday Weekend

1111111114111122111211111112211.content:
"Ma…. Kels…. What are you guys doing here?" I was shocked to see my former family standing in the living room.

"It's my fault," Andrew said, "you've seemed like you were missing them and one day after school I saw you left the New Horizon chat up so I added Kelsey and Aunt Abby and planned this." I frowned when he said Aunt Abby. It implied that mom was my sister and I hadn't really considered that.

Kelsey and Mom moved in for a hug and I felt their embrace. Some of the stress I was feeling melted a way. It was good to see them in person. "How long are you here for?" I asked, breaking away from their hug.

"Just the long weekend. Kelsey has school on Tuesday and a date afterwards." Abigail said, as kelsey blushed.

"A date?" I was a bit surprised. I hadn't known Kelsey was interested in anyone. "With whom?"

Before Kelsey could answer Abigail answered. "She started going out with Kyle." She gave me a knowing smile before continuing, " he has been helping out around the house since "Kevin's" passing, and grown closer to Kelsey. I think they were comforting eachother after you were gone." Then in a fake but stern voice said, " But he better not comfort you in other ways… im to young to be a grandma." Causing both Kelsey and I blush. I knew and had shared with Kelsey how much of a crush Kyle had on her.

"Mom, not in front of my son" I said gesturing to Andrew who was looking red in the ear.

Looking a bit subdued, she said "sorry Andrew dear." Then turning to me, "and you should probably stop with the mom talk. You're old enough to be my twin" a small tear filled her eye again. "Call me Abigail or Abby."

"Alright Abby" I said giving her another hug. After a moment or two, a gurgling noise could be heard. Andrew clutched his stomach. "I guess that means dinner time." Seeing Megan standing in the corner and Kelsey and Abby in front of me I realized my normal planned meal wouldn't feed all of us. "Well, family" I said gesturing to everyone, "do we want to eat-in or eat-out?"
1111111114111122111211111112211.title: Continue

11111111141111221112111111122111.content:
No one seemed to agree on what to do for dinner; with Andrew and Kelsey opting to eat it, while Megan, Aby and myself wanted to eat out. So, we decided to compromise; Abby and I would go get some pizza to bring back home.

As we walked down the driveway to my car, Abby took a quick look back at the house before looking at me. “Are you sure it’s smart leaving Andrew alone with Kelsey and Megan?”

“We’ve got nothing to worry about; Andrew promised me that he’d behave.” Getting in the car, I said, “He said they were just going to sit by the pool and talk.”

As she climbed into the car, I got the feeling Abby was going to say something; until she stopped herself. “I was about to ask what they could possibly talk about; but then I remembered Andrew used to be a girl.” Looking at me, she said, “That knowledge is going to make him quite popular with girls at school.”

Turning to Abby as I backed out of the driveway, I said, “Andrew’s only 12 years old, Abby; he’s not ready to start dating yet.”

Once that was settled, the conversation turned to idle chit-chat. “So how are things at work, David?” looking at me, Abby said, “Were you and that Ms. Zhang woman able to finalize a plan for her building?”

“I actually met with her a few days ago to finalize everything; we break ground next week.”

“I’m glad to hear that.” Pausing, looking rather uncomfortable about something, Abby said, “It seems like you’ve made quite a life for yourself out here; who would have thought becoming a 38 year old man with a teenage son was the key to making you happy.”

Pulling into the restaurant’s parking lot, I said, “As I told you already, Abby; raising Andrew wasn’t part of my original plan.” Turning the car off, I looked at her and said, “I probably would’ve been fine without a son; but now that I have one, I can’t see my life without him.”

“I was the same way when you and Kelsey were born; I was terrified by the thought of being a parent, until I held both of you in my arms.” Looking at me, with a chuckle, Abby said, “Look at me; it’s been almost three weeks and I’m still talking as if you’re my son.”

“That’ll change in time; it took me a week to stop thinking of you as my mother.” Getting out of the car, I said, “Of course it helped that I’m now only a few months younger than you.”

“I don’t know if that’s a smart idea; that might open up a whole new set of problems.” Walking around the car, Abby said, “Convincing myself that you’re still my son is the only thing keeping me from acting on certain...feelings that I’ve been having.”

Hearing that brought me back to the first time I contacted them, shortly after my transformation. Prior to learning the truth, Abby had mentioned thinking that I was attractive. I had hoped those feelings had gone away, but it seems they hadn’t. What’s more; being around her was causing me to have the same feelings. “It’s probably best not to think about that; it would just make things awkward.”

**********************************


The ride back to the house was filled with an awkward silence; neither Abby nor myself said a word the entire ride back. As we pulled into the driveway once more, hearing music playing in the backyard, I turned off the car and looked at Abby. “Perhaps it would be best if you and Kelsey stayed at a hotel, Abby.”

“What?” shocked, Abby looked at me and said, “Why?”

“It’s obvious that you’re feeling conflicted about your feelings towards me; and, if I’m being honest, so am I.” sighing, I said, “The two of you staying at a hotel is probably the only way to keep us from doing something we’ll regret.”

Abby was silent for a moment; until she leaned over and kissed me. I briefly pulled away, startled by unexpected kiss. But then something happened that surprised both myself and Abby – I leaned forward and returned the kiss. We kissed for a moment until a tapping noise behind me broke our concentration. Abby and I turned to find Andrew standing outside the door with Kelsey and Megan – all three of their faces in shock.
11111111141111221112111111122111.title: Bringing Home Takeout

111111111411112211121111111221111.content:
Abigail and I were faced with a mixed bag of expressions as everyone was staring at us; Kelsey looked both shocked and horrified, Andrew looked as though he was trying to figure out what this all meant, while Megan’s surprised expression was quickly replaced by a huge grin. “Why Ms. Scott, aren’t you a deviant minx?”

“Back in the house, NOW!” I barked, as Abigail turned scarlet, “We’ll be in with the food in a minute.”

Looking at us both, under her breath, Megan said, “I bet you’ll take a minute.”

I scowled at her for a moment, until a grin told me she was only joking. I waited until they were all back in the house before turning to look at Abigail. “That’s not how I was expecting things to go.”

Abigail was mortified, “I-I kissed Kev...I kissed my son.”

“I’m not your son anymore, Abby; I’m David.” Looking at her, I said, “What we did was awkward, for sure, but there’s nothing wrong with two adults sharing a kiss.”

We talked for a few moments more until we agreed to discuss this more later; we got out of the car as I gathered the food and went inside for dinner.

**********


No one said much during dinner; although Andrew and Megan managed to make small talk between the two of them. Kelsey was just sitting there; probably wondering what might’ve happened had we not been interrupted. Once we were finished,
Megan caught my eye and nodded, “Hey guys, what do you say we get some ice cream?” turning back to me as she ushered the others towards the door, she said, “Uncle David, can I borrow your car?”

With the keys already in hand, I gave them to her and said, “Thanks.”

Giving me a brief hug, she looked at me and said, “Good luck.”

Suddenly it was just Abigail and me, alone in a quiet house. Without saying a word, I gathered all the dishes and brought them to the sink. Abigail walked over with the glasses and utensils, as she watched me at the sink. “I could never get you to do that at home.”

A smile on her face to me that she was just trying to start a conversation. Grabbing a dirty plate, I said, “I’m not that lazy teenage boy anymore.”

Abigail was quiet for a moment; it didn’t take long to realize she’d just given me a once over. "I can see that.”

Turning to look at Abigail. I said, “Did you know that we’re not related anymore? New Horizon’s process completely changes a person’s DNA.” Looking at her, as small tears formed on her face, I said, “I could’ve become a Black woman, an Asian man, or even a busty blonde if I wanted.”

“I know, I read all about it before bringing you there.”

“I guess what I’m trying to say is that I may have grown up as Kevin; but I also, thanks to new memories, grew up as David as
well. The only part of Kevin Scott that stills exists is our memories of him.”

“I had to watch as they put an empty coffin in the ground; but hearing that makes me realize my son is truly gone.”

I rushed to embrace her as I realized I made have been insensitive. “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to upset you.” Holding her close, I said, “I can never repay you for everything you’ve done for me; I’m here, raising a son of my own, because you wanted me to be happy.”

The two of us hugged for a few minutes; taking comfort in each other’s arms. After a moment, she looked up at me and said, “You’re not Kevin, are you?”

Shaking my head, I said, “Not any longer.”

I was going to say more when I was cut off by a kiss on the lips; this time, however, I didn’t hesitate before returning it. I
wasn’t sure how long we stood in the kitchen; Abigail’s kiss was more passionate then anything I’d ever experienced before.

**********


The two of us were sitting in the living room, laughing and sharing stories, when Megan returned with the kids. Megan poked her head in first, checking to make sure the coast was clear before motioning for the kids to come in. Handing me back the
keys, she said, “Thanks, Uncle David.”

“No Megan, thank you.” Catching her eye so she knew what I meant, I said, “How much do I owe you?"

“$50.” She said causally, before I raised an eyebrow. “What? It was worth a try."

Handing her $20 from my wallet, I said, “Go get something nice.”

Giggling and jumping in the way only teenage and college age girls could, Megan took the money and said, “You’re the best!”
111111111411112211121111111221111.title: Caught

1111111114111122111211111112211112.content:
Today wasn’t going as I’d planned; I was woken up by the Police calling to tell me there’d been a break in at the firm. I quickly got dressed and rushed out the door before the others were awake, leaving a note telling them what was happening.

I was a bundle of nerves the entire drive there, hoping that everything was alright. Once I got there, I saw half a dozen police cruisers in the parking lot. As I got out of the car, I made a mental note to buy an alarm system.

The police led me around the corner to a group of girls in their mid-20s, all wearing jogging outfits. I was told how they’d been jogging when they saw someone break a window, before going inside and returning with a computer. After giving their information to the police for follow up, I thanked them for calling 911.

***************************


The police gathered what evidence they could, including camera footage from the adjacent building, before telling me they’d be in touch. After calling the house and explaining what happened, I went to a nearby hardware store to get some plywood for the window.

I was in the middle of covering the window when I heard a car door close behind me. Turning around, I saw Megan walking over with the others. Meeting them halfway, I said, “You guys didn’t need to come by, I wasn’t going to be here much longer.”

“We know; but this was on the way, so we decided to stop by.”

The previous night, Andrew had expressed an interest in going to the Museum of Science & Industry. The five of us had planned to make a day of it. “I’ll tell you what; give me a few minutes to lock up, and then we can leave.”
1111111114111122111211111112211112.title: A Break In

11111111141111221112111111122111121.content:
A few hours had passed since we arrived at the museum; it was shortly before 12:00. We had just finished walking through the mine exhibit when we started getting hungry. The food court was only a short distance away, so it was decided that we’d head there.

While the others were sitting at a nearby table overlooking the lake, I was waiting in line to pay for the food. I was minding my own business when I felt a tap on my shoulder, followed by a voice saying, “David?”

Thinking it was Megan or Abigail, I turned around only to find myself staring at Diana. I hadn’t seen or heard from her since that night at the hotel. Coming to my senses, I said, “Dia-Diana, hi!”

“I saw you looking at the model train diorama earlier; I wanted to come over and say hi, but I saw you were with another woman.”

It didn’t take a genius to realize she meant Abigail; but it did take me a little longer to recognize the hint of jealously in Diana’s voice. Looking at her, I said, “Oh that’s just my cousin Abigail, she’s out visiting for the weekend with her son.”

“Oh.” Staying with me as the line moved forward, Diana said, “Whose that older girl with you?”

“That’s my niece Megan, she’s also visiting for the weekend.” With a chuckle, I said, “My house is very crowded at the moment.”

We made idle conversation as continued through the line; neither of us brought up the night at the hotel. It seemed Diana was in Chicago for a family gathering; she was passing time at the museum before catching a flight back. Once I paid for the food, I led Diana over to introduce her. Before I could even say anything, Abigail looked Diana over and said, “Whose this, David?”
11111111141111221112111111122111121.title: A Surprise Reunion

choices: The girls want to know details
111111111411112211121111111221111211.content:
"Abby, this is Diana. Diana, this is Abigail and her daughter Kelsey. My niece Megan and you've uh, met Andrew before." I sputtered remembering with some embarrassment how she had met Andrew. Andrew blushed slightly giving a small wave.

Everyone pushed together a little bit more so Diana could have a seat.

"How's business?" Diana asked. After taking a bite of her food.

I nodded, trying to swallow my food before speaking. "Things are going well" I managed to say. I picked up a few of those prospective clients I mentioned last time we talked. That made opening up my firm go very smoothly. My only hiccup happened today actually. We had a break-in this morning. I'm not sure if anything was stolen or if it was just an attempt to vandalize but I got that on my plate this week. What about you? Advertising going well?" I asked. I began to block out my surroundings and my family as I listened to Diana speak and tell me about her life. Business was good but her dad wasn't well.

"I'm transferring to Chicago. I'll be taking the same position I'm in but will be working in an office a bit more. I start here before Thanksgiving. It works out great because I can still work but be here for my family when needed at the same time." She said.

I sat up a little straighter as she said she was coming back to Chicago. Abby noticed and raised her eyebrow at me, letting off a small smile showing what I hoped was approval. "I'm glad you will be staying in Chicago. I'm not glad about the reasoning, I hope your dad will recover, ``I said quickly, " but it's always nice to be near family and friends, ``I said, propping my own eyebrow up. As if I was asking if I was included in her friends.

She smiled at me. "I think I'd like to get together sometime when I am back in town. If you want to give me your number i'll call you next time I'm around." She said, as I handed her my business card. "Thanks." She said as she got her wallet out if her purse. She pulled a card out and put mine in its place. "Here is mine." She said handing me her own card. "I'm sorry to cut and run. I hope we can catch up and maybe try again next time I'm here. But I got to catch the train, in order to make it to the airport. It was nice meeting all of you." Diana said as she got up to excuse herself.

I watched her disappear into the crowd before turning back to the rest of the family.

"What...who was that?" Abby said.

"That's Diana." I said answering her question but not her implication.

"She's a knockout, good for you Uncle David" Megan grinned at me.

I smiled," thanks. We've only had one date, and that ended poorly." I looked at Andrew who said nothing but blushed. "It's a miracle she reached out to me in a crowd. I didn't think I'd ever see her again. Anyways where to next?" I said stretching my back as I said it. I was trying not to have to go into the story but I wasn't sure if Kelsey and Abby would drop the subject. "More museums? aquarium? Shopping on the magnificent mile perhaps?" I said looking at the girls and Andrew.
111111111411112211121111111221111211.title: Continue

1111111114111122111211111112211112112.content:
The girls, much to my annoyance, refused to drop the subject as we made our way towards the museum exit. I held off on acknowledging their pleas until we were outside. Once we were in a semi-private area, I spun around and said, “If you guys promise to stop pestering me, I’ll tell you what happened.”

Megan, Kelsey, and Abby looked at each other for a moment before they all sat down on a nearby bench. The attention they gave me reminded me how I used to be when my grandparents told stories. Kelsey was the first to speak, “So why exactly didn’t the date go well?” looking at me, she said, “Was it because you were lousy in bed?”

I was caught off-guard by Kelsey’s question; I hadn’t expected her, of all people, to ask me that. Judging from the look on her face, she was just as surprised as I was. “The date went great; we had dinner at the hotel restaurant, we talked and got to know each other.” Sighing, I said, “We adjourned back to my hotel room; I was excited by the prospect of having sex with her. We were all ready to start when...”

Interrupting me, Andrew said, “When I came back from the movies and walked in on them.” His face red from embarrassment, Andrew continued, “I guess Dad hadn’t mentioned me, so Diana freaked out and left.”

The girls looked at me; I was surprised by the annoyed looks on each of their faces. “What’s with the looks?”

“You’re definitely not my son, David; I raised him to be truthful.” Looking at me, her face red, Abby said, “How could you not tell Diana you had a son?”

“I was nervous, and a little drunk.” Sighing, I said, “It was my first time being with a woman since Andrew’s mother died, and…”
Everyone, including Andrew, looked at me in surprise. “What did you just say?”

I stammered for a moment as I realized what I had just said. “Sorry, it’s just...I’ve got two sets of memories in here.” Blushing, I said, “Getting back to the topic at hand, I’d never been with a woman before so the fact that I had a son slipped my mind.”

“She’s clearly still interested in you, Uncle David.” Getting up, Megan said, “Perhaps her moving to Chicago will help you two reconnect.”

After that conversation ended, the five of us sat down to decide what we should do next.
1111111114111122111211111112211112112.title: The girls want to know details

11111111141111221112111111122111121121.content:
Everyone but Megan was enjoying the aquarium; which came as a surprise to me because I’d been told she liked marine biology. I noticed she kept looking at her phone with a look of pure dread. I wanted to ask her what was wrong but felt that it wasn’t my place.

After a while, however, I decided to go for it and ask her what was wrong. Pulling her aside, I said, “Megan, are you okay?”

Megan was about to speak when suddenly she was interrupted by her phone ringing. Looking at her phone, I noticed all color drained from her face. “Crap, here goes nothing.”

I watched silently as she walked a short distance away; from the arm movements I could tell that it wasn’t a pleasant conversation. Looking away from a moment, I spotted Andrew standing nearby with Kelsey and Abby. Even from a distance, I could tell that Andrew was looking down Kelsey’s shirt - That’s just great; my son is ogling my former sister.

Before I could even do anything about that, I saw Megan hang up her phone and walk back over to me. Looking at her, I said, “What’s wrong, Megan; you’ve been acting pretty strangely for the last hour.”

“I made a pretty rash decision before coming out here; I hoped I would’ve had chance to discuss it with my folks before they found out about it.”

Concerned, I looked at Megan said, “What did you do, Megan?”

Anxiously rubbing a hand down her arm, Megan looked at me and said, “I dropped out of college so I could come live with you and Andrew.”

“You did what!?”
11111111141111221112111111122111121121.title: At the Aquarium

111111111411112211121111111221111211211.content:
After barely composing myself, I grabbed Megan by her arm and forcibly pulled her towards an exit. I was understandably angry and didn’t want to have a loud discussion in view of dozens of people. Once we were outside, I let go of Megan’s arm and stared at her. It was clear from the look of fear on her face that she hadn’t expected me to react as I had.

“Uncle David, I can...”

“Unless you want me to get even angrier, I suggest you stop talking.” Trying my best to remain as calm as possible, I said, “What the hell were you thinking? Dropping out of college is probably the dumbest thing you could possibly do.”

I watched as Megan slowly started rubbing her arm; seeing the bruises from when I’d grabbed her. Looking at me as tears started flowing, Megan said, “I didn’t want to lose my best friend!”

“There were plenty of other options to choose from; I would’ve been more than willing to let Andrew come stay with you and your family, or even have you spend time out here.” Rubbing my mouth, I said, “When were you going to tell your family, or me, about this?”

“I don’t know, okay.” Crying, Megan said, “I was so concerned about losing Andrew that I wasn’t thinking straight.”

Out of the corner of my eye, I saw Abby rounding the corner with Andrew Kelsey; one look from me and they turned around. No longer feeling angry, I turned back to Megan and said, “I can certainly understand feeling like you had no other choice; I mean barely a month ago I was a teenager, not I’m raising a son all by myself.”

“What’s going to happen now?” wiping away some tears, Megan said, “I’ll understand if you decide to send me home.”

“No, Andrew would hate me if I did that.” Sighing, I said, “I’ll tell you what; I’ll call your parents tonight and see if we can’t work things out.”

“If it makes things any easier, I could always transfer to a local college.” Looking at me, Megan said, “In the meantime, I could help out around the house or do odd jobs for you at the firm.”

“If your parents are fine with that arrangement, then so am I.” embracing Megan, I said, “Just from now on, don’t make any rash decisions.”

As the two of us walked back to join the others, Megan smiled and said, “Deal.”
111111111411112211121111111221111211211.title: Lecturing Megan

Secondary Characters:
• Abigail Scott – 39 years old; single mother to Kevin & Kelsey Scott. She feels terrible that her son in so unhappy; and is willing to do anything to help him.

• David Beltran – 15 years old; another of Kyle’s best friends. Unlike Kyle, David fully supports Kevin’s decision.

She was formerly a conservative bible thumper with an adult daughter. When her daughter came out to her; she felt that her beliefs would cost her their relationship. She’s now a pro-choice woman; with a wife and a baby on the way.

info.brief_description: Kevin Scott is an unhappy teenager; until he's given a chance at a new, happier life.
info.description:
Kevin Scott is a 15-year-old boy; he lives at home with his mom and sister. Kevin is an unhappy teenager, often imagining what it would be like to lead another life. One day his mom and sister give him a gift to do just that - a reservation with New Horizons; a company that specializes in giving people the life they've always dreamed of. There is, however, a catch; if Kevin goes through with this, there's a chance he'll never see his family again.
